TcAttribute.description: Date filter name. This cannot be null
Date filter start date. This cannot be null if the end date is null. If it is null, all results before the end date are returned
Date filter end date. This cannot be null if the start date is null. If it is null, the filter end date is now
Property name represented by the ColumnDef instance.
Represents the ImanType instances of objects whose properties are to be shown as columns
Represents the travesal path for a dynamic compound property, from destination object to the source object
Display Name for the column.
awp0LastExecutionTime is Date which represents the time of last execution. NULL value not allowed.
awp0SavedSearch is TypedReference which represents the saved search executed. NULL value not allowed.
awp0ExecutingUser is TypedReference which represents the user who executed the saved search. NULL value not allowed.
Search string. This cannot be null
Indicates if this saved search is globally shared. Valid values are true or false
Date filters. This field is not currently used
Numeric filters. This field is not currently used
String filters. This contains all the filter information for the search

awp0ChartOn is a String which represents the category, in TypeName.propertyName format, which was charted on when the search was saved. awp0ChartOn will be used when executing the saved search to determine which category to chart on. awp0ChartOn adds the ability for the user to retain the charted category for when they saved the search and upon executing the search they will not have to reselect that category to chart again. Null value will be allowed for awp0ChartOn. Having a null value would then default to the existing behavior of selecting a category to chart on based on what the server returned.

TcClass.description: This class holds the last used column configuration for a given user/group/role combination

TcAttribute.description: awp0ColumnConfigRef is a typed reference property that represents the primary object of this relation. It can point to any Fnd0UIConfigurationObject. In case of Named Column Configuration, this can represent the last used named column configuration. Null values are not allowed for awp0ColumnConfigRef
awp0LastUsedBy is an untyped reference property which tells who used this configuration.

TcClass.description: This class represents a Named Column Configuration object that a user or an admin can create to view a table with the specified columns

TcAttribute.description: awp0ColumnConfigId is a string property that uniquely identifies the awp0NamedColumnConfig object.NULL values are not allowed for awp0columnConfigId
awp0IsAdmin is a boolean property that indicates the admin column configuration in the list of available named column configurations. default is false. Nulls are not allowed.
awp0ColumnConfigName is a string property that represents the name of the Column Configuration object. NULL values are not allowed for awp0ColumnConfigName.
Numeric filter name. This cannot be null
Numeric filter start value
Numeric filter end value
String filter name. This cannot be null
String filter value. This cannot be null
awp0WorkspaceId is a string property which is unique to identify the workspace. Null Values are not allowed for awp0WorkSpaceId.

awp0IsDefaultWorkspace is a Boolean property that indicates the default workspace in the list of available workspace mappings between a workspace and its associated organization. default is false. Nulls are not allowed.
This flag indicates whether filtering is supported on the given column.
This flag indicates whether the given column is frozen.
Display Name for the column

OperationInputProperty.description: Indicates if this saved search is globally shared. Valid values are true or false

awp0ChartOn is a String which represents the category, in TypeName.propertyName format, which was charted on when the search was saved. awp0ChartOn will be used when executing the saved search to determine which category to chart on. awp0ChartOn adds the ability for the user to retain the charted category for when they saved the search and upon executing the search they will not have to reselect that category to chart again. Null value will be allowed for awp0ChartOn. Having a null value would then default to the existing behavior of selecting a category to chart on based on what the server returned.

awp0ColumnConfigRef is a typed reference property that represents the primary object of this relation. It can point to any Fnd0UIConfigurationObject. In case of Named Column Configuration, this can represent the last used named column configuration. Null values are not allowed for awp0ColumnConfigRef
awp0LastUsedBy is an untyped reference property which tells who used this configuration the last time.

TcDataset.description: This dataset is used to store references to the TcXML schema, the Solr schema XML file and the XSL files required to transform TcXML data files to Solr data files. These files are consumed by the FTSIndexer.

TcRuntimeType.description: This is the root business object for the dynamic runtime business objects representing the saved query criteria.

This is a runtime business object that represents the information needed to execute saved queries in Teamcenter. This is used in Active Workspace to expose the Advanced Query functionality to the end user

TcProperty.description: This is a typed reference property that represents an advanced query name. It has the Awp0AdvancedQueryNames LOV attached that represents the list of all advanced queries, retrieved from database.
This is a typed reference property that represents a quick search name. It has the Awp0QuickSearchNames LOV attached that represent the list of all quick searches, retrieved from database.

TcRuntimeType.description: Awp0AlternatesProvider business object is used to display Global Alternates available for the selected business object
Favorites Provider
Active Workspace Full Text Search Data Provider. This business object implements the full text search capabilities in the Active Workspace application

Awp0InboxProvider represents the data provider for the Inbox location. This object is used for paging data in the inbox page, so the entire contents of the Inbox need not be returned all at onceInbox Provider is used in the Active Workspace application

Awp0ObjectSetRowProvider represents the data provider for an objectSet. This object is used for paging data in an objectSet, so the entire contents of an objectSet table need not be returned all at once.Object Set Row Provider is used in the Active Workspace application
Recent Objects Provider

Active Workspace Where References Data Provider, and it finds all WorkspaceObjects in Teamcenter that reference the specified WorkspaceObject. This data provider generally is used in Where-Used tab at Active Workspace Client to display all reference objects for selected object.

Awp0ResourceProvider represents the data provider for the user selection panel. This object is used for paging data in the user selection panel, so the entire contents of the panel need not be returned all at once. The Resource Provider is used in the Active Workspace application

Awp0SavedQuerySearchProvider is primarily used by Active Workspace Client(AWC) to support Saved Query search. This Object has implementation logic for user selected saved query execution and returning search results.
Data provider for Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.
Provider for providing the Workflow signoffs data of WorkspaceObject.

AWC Object Type Search Provider. This provider is primarily used by AWC to support search of a business object types available in database. It has implementation logic for querying business object types and returing the search results.
A runtime business object which represents the surrogate user in the user's profile page.

TcProperty.description: The e-mail address of the surrogate user.
The phone number of the surrogate user.
The first day when the surrogate assignment becomes active.
The last day of the active surrogate assignment.
References the surrogate user involved in the assignment

TcRuntimeType.description: Search provider for Visual Navigation Cards (VNC) functionality. Visual navigation cards are used to support graphical browsing of data. This data provider helps to support pagination to mitigate the possible performance impact while loading large list of VNC's.VNC Provider is used in the Active Workspace application

Awp0XRTObjectSet is a runtime object which represents an XRT objectSet. It contains the list of columns and rows to be presented in an objectSet table. This business object is used by the Active Workspace application. It is not recommended to add properties or subtype this BuisnessObject, as it is internal to the ActiveWorkspace framework.

TcProperty.description: The list of rows to be displayed in an objectSet table.
The list of columns to be displayed in an objectSet table.

TcRuntimeType.description: Awp0XRTObjectSetColumn defines a column to be displayed in an objectSet table. The data in this object is used by clients to determine how to render the column in an objectSet table.Object Set Column is used in the Active Workspace application. Adding properties or subtyping this BusinessObject is not recommended as this class is used internally to ActiveWorkspace Framework.

TcProperty.description: awp0PropertyName represents the internal name for the property which is to be used by the client. This property may not be NULL.
awp0PropertyDisplayName represents the display name for the which is to be displayed by the client. This property may not be NULL.
True if the property belongs to relation being traversed to get data.
awp0DataType represents the data type of the property. This property may not be NULL.
Max allowed length if this property data type is string.
True if this an array property.
Max number of the elements allowed for the array property.
This property indicates whether this column is sortable or not. Default value will be True, that means by default this column is sortable.

TcRuntimeType.description: Awp0XRTObjectSetRow represents a single row to be displayed in an objectSet table.The row object contains the primary, secondary, and relation objects for the relationship and is used by clients to show and edit related data.This BusinessObject is used by the ActiveWorkspace application.Adding properties or subclasses to this BusinessObject is not recommended as it is used internally to the ActiveWorkspace Framework.

TcProperty.description: awp0Relation represents the relation which was traversed to get from the primary to the secondary object. May be NULL if the traversal was done via a reference property.
True if this row is allowed to be cut.
Awp0RelationTypeName represents the relation name which was used to traverse from the primary to the secondary object. May be NULL if the traversal was done via reference property.
Display name for the relation or reference property which was traversed to get from the primary to the secondary object.
Awp0RelationTypeName represents the reference property name which was used to traverse from the primary to the secondary object. May be NULL if the traversal was done via relation.

awp0Target represents the object to be displayed in the table. In the case of primary to secondary traversal, this would be the awp0Secondary object. In the case of secondary to primary traversal, this would be the awp0Primary object.
Primary or start end of the relation or reference property being traversed.
Secondary end of the relation or reference property being traversed.
Relationship between primary and secondary objects.
Determines if the source (primary) business object is modifiable.

TcRuntimeType.description: This runtime object represents the client context, it contains the client scope that user is currently in and the selections.

TcProperty.description: The client scope user is in.
The objects selected by the user.

TcRuntimeType.description: This runtime business object represents the objects selected by the user in the client.

TcProperty.description: The objects selected by the user in the client.
Parent selection for the object. For example, for cut operation, it is the selected parent object.
Optional context name, for example, for cut operation, it is the relation name between parent object and child object.

TcStandardType.description: Represents an Active Workspace (AW) indexed object from a system external to Teamcenter This is the base external business object in Active Workspace

TcProperty.description: Name of the external system
The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the external system
The list of property namesThis cannot be null
The BMIDE class name of this business objectThis cannot be null

TcStandardType.description: Date filter for full text search. A date filter allows a user to filter down the search results by specifying either a filter start date or a filter end date or bothThe Date Search Filter is used in the Active Workspace application
Represents the Column Definition for Dynamic Compound Properties in table view
Awp0FTSSearchExecution is a light weight Business Object to hold execution records of saved search objects (Awp0FullTextSavedSearch).
Full text saved search. It contains all the search criteria - the search string and filters that can be persisted and reexecuted.This is used in the Active Workspace application

TcProperty.description: Array of search filter strings

TcStandardType.description: Awp0IdContextListOfValues is type of Fnd0ListOfValuesDynamic to represent the list of objects of type IdConext for the property idcontext_list of IdDispRule type.
Awp0LastUsedColumnConfig represents which was the last used column configuration for a table for a group member object.This is a link between the column configuration object and the group member.

Awp0NamedColumnConfig represents what columns are configured for a given table on the client side. This is a Column Configuration which has a name associated with it. A name can be specified for this column configuration. It is attached to Fnd0ClientScope with Fnd0UIConfigCollectionRelation.
Numeric filter for full text search. This is not currently used but may be used in the future in the Active Workspace application
This is a business object that is a child of the Fnd0ListOfValuesDynamic. It overrides the parent implementation to return a list of values representing all the quick searches in the database.
This business object represents a custom dynamic LOV in Active Workspace. Awp0RelationsCustomLOVBO is used with Awp0RelationsDLOV(exhaustive). The values for LOV are retrieved codefully.

This business object is used to get list of revision rules used by the logged in user. It overides fnd0askLOVValues operation to get this Revision Rule List. It also overrides operation fnd0isValueValid to validate the revision rule and persist the value in preferences.
String filter for full text search. It captures all the filter criteria for search. Typically this is part of a Saved Search String filter is used in the Active Workspace application

Awp0Workspace is a business object that represents a workspace (client configuration) in Active Workspace Client. Workspaces are used to control pages, commands, columns and other client configuration artifacts in Active Workspace.
Awp0WorkspaceOrgRel is a business object that represents the mapping between a Workspace (Awp0Workspace) and its associated organization (group, role, user etc).

TcProperty.description: This property defines the property names and values to display in an object's cell in the client.The format for this property value is:<Property Display Name>\\:<Property Display Value>If a property is a date property, then the Property Display Value is in the format of: {__UTC_DATE_TIME}1234567890Where 1234567890 is the time in UTC format.
This property represents the FMS ticket for a thumbnail image.

This property contains the selected Revision Rule for the logged in user. It is attached to a dynamic LOV Awp0RevRule which provides the list of Revision Rules to the logged in user. The getter method on this property is used to get the current Revision Rule selection from the preferences.
This relation will associate an image to an object.
Represents the configured revision, as per user session's revision rule, for the revision object pinned with the Tile.

This is a runtime string array. It references Participant ImanType names that are to be displayed with the "Required" flag in the client. This property derives its value from its respective workflow's root task template's existing persistent attribute by the same name. It is used by the Assign participants user interface to filter out those participant types that are not used by the current workflow instance and differentiate those that are used for required assignments versus optional signoff assignments.

This is a runtime property of string array type. It will list all the participants which should be shown in the Participants page based on the preference WRKFLW_display_paraprticipants and active workflows. If WRKFLW_display_paraprticipants is set to allowable, it will list the names of all the participants associated with the selected object's type.If WRKFLW_display_paraprticipants is set to assignable, it will list the names of the assignable participants only which are used in the current workflows. i.e. if the object is in workflow; it will combine existing properties fnd0OptionalParticipants and fnd0RequiredParticipants and return those which are assignable by the current user.If the preference WRKFLW_display_participants is set to all_assignable, then show all the assignable participants ignoring current workflows if any.
This is a run time attribute that returns the list of specifications this SpecElementRevision participates in. This property is deprecated in Active Workspace 3.3.

This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can add an ad-hoc reviewer (signoff) at the perform signoff stage of a task. This property gets its value from execution of a BMIDE Condition called Fnd0AddReviewerPrivilege. Default condition value will be "1=1" which means it is true .

This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can add an ad-hoc task (Do ask or Review task) as a dependent subprocess to this task. This property gets its value from execution of a BMIDE Condition called Fnd0AddTaskPrivilege. Default condition value will be "1=1" which means its true.
This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can assign this task.
This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can perform this task.
This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can promote this task.
This property evaluates whether a Folder object has contents within it.
Determines whether the type Id Display Rule is modifiable by the current user. This is set to true if the current user has WRITE access to the object, false otherwise.

This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can add an ad-hoc reviewer (signoff) at the perform signoff stage of a task. This property gets its value from execution of a BMIDE Condition called Fnd0AddReviewerPrivilege. Default condition value will be "1=1" which means it is true .

This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can add an ad-hoc task (Dotask or ReviewTask) as a dependent subprocess to the task associated with the signoff. This property gets its value from execution of a BMIDE condition called Fnd0AddTaskPrivilege. Default condition value will be "1=1" which means its true.
This is a runtime Boolean property that reflects if the current user can assign this task.
This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can perform this task.
This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can promote this task.
A list of all responsibilities shared by this user to other users.
A list of all responsibilities shared by this user from other users.
ID of the Identifier object. This property updates the idfr_id property of the Identifier.

Compound property representing the data file reference on master forms
A reference property that points to the users who belong to the project team.

LOVDynamic.description: Dynamic LOV to represent Advanced Query Names
LOVDynamic.name: Awp0AdvancedQueryNames
LOVDynamic.queryClause: SELECT qid FROM ImanQuery WHERE "query_class" LIKE "*"

LOVDynamic.description: Dynamic LOV of Type Awp0IdContextListOfValues returns the list of objects of type IdContext.
LOVDynamic.name: Awp0IdContextValuesDLOV
LOVDynamic.queryClause: SELECT qid FROM IdContext WHERE "idcxt_name" LIKE "*"

LOVDynamic.description: Dynamic LOV to represent Quick Search Names
LOVDynamic.name: Awp0QuickSearchNames
LOVDynamic.queryClause: SELECT qid FROM ImanQuery WHERE "query_name" LIKE "*"

LOVDynamic.name: Awp0RelationsDLOV
LOVDynamic.queryClause: SELECT qid FROM ImanType WHERE "artifactName" LIKE "*"

LOVDynamic.description: Dynamic LOV of type Awp0RevRuleLOV which contains the list of all Revision Rules available for a given logged in user.
LOVDynamic.name: Awp0RevRule
LOVDynamic.queryClause: SELECT qid FROM RevisionRule WHERE "object_name" IS_NOT_NULL "IS_NOT_NULL"

EventType.description: Trigger event when base line creation is complete.

EventTypeMapping.description: Creation of new base line for requirements structure in Active Workspace will trigger the event.

TcGlobalConstant.description: The default number of search filter categories to display.
TcGlobalConstant.name: Awp0FilterCategoryDisplayCount

TcGlobalConstant.description: The default number of search filter values to display within any search filter category.
TcGlobalConstant.name: Awp0FilterValueDisplayCount

TcGlobalConstant.description: The constant controls the list of file types allowed for FTS indexing. Valid values are file extensions( e.g ".txt")
TcGlobalConstant.name: Awp0IndexableFileTypes

TcTypeConstant.description: Category or categories (comma separated) that a Business Object can belong to.
TcTypeConstant.name: Awp0BusinessObjectCategories

TcTypeConstant.description: Indicates that search for classification data will be enabled.
TcTypeConstant.name: Awp0SearchClassifySearchEnabled

TcTypeConstant.description: Indicates that classification data associated with the Business Object will be indexed for searching.
TcTypeConstant.name: Awp0SearchIsClassifyDataIndexed

TcTypeConstant.description: Indicates that the Business Object will be indexed for searching.
TcTypeConstant.name: Awp0SearchIsIndexed

TcTypeConstant.description: Indicates that the Object from external system will be indexed for searching.
TcTypeConstant.name: Awp0SearchIsIndexedExt

TcTypeConstant.description: This constant controls the export of revision rule information to SOLR for revisable WorkspaceObject.
TcTypeConstant.name: Awp0SearchRevRuleIsExported

TcTypeConstant.description:
This constant indicates a comma separated list of revision rule entries that are not supported during SOLR query of revisable WorkspaceObject.
Valid values are: CFM_entry_working CFM_entry_status CFM_entry_group CFM_entry_latest CFM_entry_group_item_type CFM_entry_precise
TcTypeConstant.name: Awp0SearchUnsupportedRevRuleEntries

TcPropertyConstant.description: Property names from the reference object to be used while indexing typed or untyped references for searching. This needs to be a subset of properties from the Awp0SearchPropFromRefType constant Also see Awp0SearchRefTypeNames
TcPropertyConstant.name: Awp0FilterPropFromRefType

TcPropertyConstant.description: Indicates that the Inbox contents can be filtered on the property. This property constant can be applied to only persistent and compound single value properties.
TcPropertyConstant.name: Awp0InboxCanFilter

TcPropertyConstant.description: The priority of the property in the list of filters to be shown in Inbox.
TcPropertyConstant.name: Awp0InboxFilterPriority

TcPropertyConstant.description: Indicates that the search results can be filtered on the property.
TcPropertyConstant.name: Awp0SearchCanFilter

TcPropertyConstant.description: The priority of the property in the list of filters to be shown for full text search.
TcPropertyConstant.name: Awp0SearchFilterPriority

TcPropertyConstant.description: Indicates that the property should be indexed for searching by the search engine.

ServiceInterface.description: EffectivityManagement service provides the capability to apply revision effectivity to releaseStatus of business object such as Itemrevision in activeworkspace.
ServiceInterface.name: EffectivityManagment

ServiceInterface.description:
A global alternate part is interchangeable with another part in all circumstances, regardless of where the other part is used in the product structure. A global alternate applies to any revision of the part and is independent of any views. Parts and their global alternates are related only in a single direction. The GlobalAlternate Services exposes operations that are used to manage global alternates of the specified items, such as adding or removing global alternate.

The GlobalAlternate service can be used for supporting the following use-cases :

    • Add one or more global alternates to the list of global alternates of the selected item.
    • Remove selected global alternates from the list of global alternates of the selected item.
ServiceInterface.name: GlobalAlternate

ServiceInterface.description:
This service provides operations required to support the File Management System (FMS) functionality, and is intended to be used with the Active Workspace client. This service contains operations that run in the Teamcenter Server context to supply business logic functionality which controls the flow of user data. The data being controlled by this service exists within files, as represented by ImanFile objects within the Teamcenter Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system.
This service provides the following file management use cases:
    • Manage PLM file downloads (reading a file from a Teamcenter volume).
    • Manage PLM file uploads (adding a file to a Teamcenter volume).
ServiceInterface.name: FileMgmt

The GetFilesAndTicketsInfoResponse holds the list of names and their FMS tickets for the first file as primary named reference associated with the Dataset and ServiceData.

The response array will have a structure of file name and FMS Ticket that corresponds to every input Dataset object array in the same order. In case an element in the input array does not have an associated file name and ticket information , the response array will have a structure of blank string for that input and this input object will be passed in the partialError.

OperationTemplate.description: This operation assists in an asynchronous file replace using the Datashare Manager. When a single file is being replaced, the PLMD (Product Lifecycle Management Data) file is downloaded to the Transient volume and the file ticket returned. In the case of multiple files being replaced, the output structure is populated with additional informaton needed for the Replace operation.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FileMgmt::loadPlmdTicketForReplace
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Information required for the file replace operation is returned in LoadPlmdTicketReplaceResponse.The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141170 Teamcenter ersion is less than 11.4.0.
    • 14167 An invalid Dataset object was provided.
    • 14168 Unable to create a PLMD file under transient volume due to FMS BootStrap errors.
    • 14169 Unable to create a PLMD file under transient volume due to Operating System directory permissions.

OperationParameter.description: Input information about the Dataset and file to be replaced.
OperationParameter.name: infos

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation fetches the name and the Teamcenter File Management System (FMS) ticket of the file, related to the input business objects of type Dataset, as the primary named reference. In case multiple files are related to the Dataset as primary named reference , this operation fetches the first file and its corresponding FMS ticket.

This operation can be invoked by the Active Workspace client with at least one of the input objects of type Dataset, this means Active Workspace client enables the Download command when at least one of the selected object is of type Dataset. This operation handles types other than Dataset gracefully and warns the user for the invalid selection.

The primary named reference of the Dataset is defined through its definition using the BMIDE tool of Teamcenter. This operation finds the primary named reference using the Tool Actions and the Reference definitions of the type Dataset. Tool Actions of the type Dataset defines the mapping of the operation on the Dataset with the named reference and the Reference definition of the Dataset maps the named reference and the extension of the file. Citing an example , if there are multiple files associated with the named reference i.e ‘Text’ , the first file associated with this named reference is selected. In case , the first file is deleted , the second file associated with this named reference takes precedence.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FileMgmt::getFileNamesWithTicketInfo
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of file name and their corresponding FMS ticket for the first file of the primary named reference of every input Dataset.

The following partial error may be returned:

•    141365     ‘x’ of ‘y’ selections were downloaded.
•    141366     The object was not downloaded because it is not a dataset.
•    141367     The object was not downloaded because it is empty.

OperationParameter.description: A list of BusinessObject objects for which the file name and the its file ticket is to be retrieved.
OperationParameter.name: businessObjectsIn

Operation.description:
This operation fetches the name and the Teamcenter File Management System (FMS) ticket of the file, related to the input business objects of type Dataset, as the primary named reference. In case multiple files are related to the Dataset as primary named reference , this operation fetches the first file and its corresponding FMS ticket.

This operation can be invoked by the Active Workspace client with at least one of the input objects of type Dataset, this means Active Workspace client enables the Download command when at least one of the selected object is of type Dataset. This operation handles types other than Dataset gracefully and warns the user for the invalid selection.

The primary named reference of the Dataset is defined through its definition using the BMIDE tool of Teamcenter. This operation finds the primary named reference using the Tool Actions and the Reference definitions of the type Dataset. Tool Actions of the type Dataset defines the mapping of the operation on the Dataset with the named reference and the Reference definition of the Dataset maps the named reference and the extension of the file. Citing an example , if there are multiple files associated with the named reference i.e ‘Text’ , the first file associated with this named reference is selected. In case , the first file is deleted , the second file associated with this named reference takes precedence.
Operation.name: getFileNamesWithTicketInfo
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of file name and their corresponding FMS ticket for the first file of the primary named reference of every input Dataset.

The following partial error may be returned:

•    141365     ‘x’ of ‘y’ selections were downloaded.
•    141366     The object was not downloaded because it is not a dataset.
•    141367     The object was not downloaded because it is empty.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1:
    In Active Workspace client, when user selects Dataset objects and clicks on the “Download” command then the client starts downloading the file directly from the FMS with the help of the FMS ticket information.

Use Case 2:
    In Active Workspace client, user selects the Dataset objects and clicks on the “Copy File Download Link” command to copy the URL of the file on the Teamcenter and OS clipboards. When the copied file download link is hit by the user on a different page then the client starts downloading the file directly from the FMS with the help of the FMS ticket information.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of BusinessObject objects for which the file name and the its file ticket is to be retrieved.

Operation.description: This operation assists in an asynchronous file replace using the Datashare Manager. When a single file is being replaced, the PLMD (Product Lifecycle Management Data) file is downloaded to the Transient volume and the file ticket returned. In the case of multiple files being replaced, the output structure is populated with additional informaton needed for the Replace operation.

    • 14169 Unable to create a PLMD file under transient volume due to Operating System directory permissions.

ParameterInfo.description: Input information about the Dataset and file to be replaced.

ServiceInterface.description: The MultiSite Services provides operations to share the data within the sites in the Multi-Site federation. Data sharing is achieved using the data replication, through import and export operations. These are the foundation of Multi-Site Collaboration. Using this service the participating sites in a Multi-Site federation get a reliable way of importing the data from the rest of the site(s).
ServiceInterface.name: MultiSite

OperationTemplate.description: This operation queries for Object Directory Service (ODS) publication records at the target ODS site based on the input criteria and serializes the data into one or more TC XML files. The search criteria can be date based or a list of objects which have been previously published. Read tickets are returned for the generated TC XML files.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::MultiSite::fetchODSRecords
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
This operation returns a list of FMS read tickets to TC XML files containing PublicationRecord data, full paths to any relevent error logs and a list of faiiled objects in UID form. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 100101 – Connection to ODS failed.
    • 100103 – Invalid ODS site supplied.
    • 100104 – Requesting client site has no access to ODS.
    • 100014 – User has no read access to publication record.
    • 11045 – Invalid TIE option supplied.
    • 11184 – Invalid TIE session option supplied.

OperationParameter.description: The name of the site to interrogate.
OperationParameter.name: odsSiteName

OperationParameter.description:
Specifies the type of search, valid values are:
    • 0: Search for Publication Record by last publication date including deleted Publication Record.
    • 1: Search for Publication Records by creation date.
    • 2: Search for Publication Records by UIDs.
    • 3: Set up the environment for tracking deleted Publication Records.
    • 4: Clean up the deleted Publication Records by deletion date.
OperationParameter.name: searchMode

OperationParameter.description: The beginning date of the record search. The format is “YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS”. Required by search modes 0 and 1. Not used by search mode 2 and 3.
OperationParameter.name: startDate

OperationParameter.description: The end date of the record search. The format is “YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS”. Required by search modes 0 and 1. Not used by search mode 2 and 3.
OperationParameter.name: endDate

OperationParameter.description: A list of PublicationRecord business objects to search for in UID format for search mode 2. Not used by search modes 0, 1, 3 and 4.
OperationParameter.name: pubrList

OperationParameter.description:
A map (string, list of strings) of search option keys and a list of key values. Supported key values:
    • batchSize : The maximum number of records to be returned in a single TCXML file. Search results that are larger will be returned in multiple files. The lowest supported value is 5000. Batch size will be set to 5000 if a lower value is supplied.
    • searchTypeList: Limit the search to Business Object types in this list.
OperationParameter.name: odsSessionInfo

Operation.description: This operation queries for Object Directory Service (ODS) publication records at the target ODS site based on the input criteria and serializes the data into one or more TC XML files. The search criteria can be date based or a list of objects which have been previously published. Read tickets are returned for the generated TC XML files.
Operation.name: fetchODSRecords
Operation.returnDescription:
This operation returns a list of FMS read tickets to TC XML files containing PublicationRecord data, full paths to any relevent error logs and a list of faiiled objects in UID form. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 100101 – Connection to ODS failed.
    • 100103 – Invalid ODS site supplied.
    • 100104 – Requesting client site has no access to ODS.
    • 100014 – User has no read access to publication record.
    • 11045 – Invalid TIE option supplied.
    • 11184 – Invalid TIE session option supplied.
Operation.useCase: This will be used to extract ODS data for indexing purposes. The output will be used to populate data to a search engine like Solr.

ParameterInfo.description: The name of the site to interrogate.

Specifies the type of search, valid values are:
    • 0: Search for Publication Record by last publication date including deleted Publication Record.
    • 1: Search for Publication Records by creation date.
    • 2: Search for Publication Records by UIDs.
    • 3: Set up the environment for tracking deleted Publication Records.
    • 4: Clean up the deleted Publication Records by deletion date.
The beginning date of the record search. The format is “YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS”. Required by search modes 0 and 1. Not used by search mode 2 and 3.
The end date of the record search. The format is “YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS”. Required by search modes 0 and 1. Not used by search mode 2 and 3.
A list of PublicationRecord business objects to search for in UID format for search mode 2. Not used by search modes 0, 1, 3 and 4.

A map (string, list of strings) of search option keys and a list of key values. Supported key values:
    • batchSize : The maximum number of records to be returned in a single TCXML file. Search results that are larger will be returned in multiple files. The lowest supported value is 5000. Batch size will be set to 5000 if a lower value is supplied.
    • searchTypeList: Limit the search to Business Object types in this list.

StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: Structure represents the output of the operation.
Struct.name: CreateTracelinksResponseData

StructElement.name: tracelinkObject

Typedef.description: PropertyValues is a map of property name (key) and property values (values) in string format.
Typedef.name: PropertyValues

Typedef.description:
A map of preferences and their values. Current supported key values are createTracelinkWithOccurrences, createComplyingTracelinkWithOccurrence, createDefiningTracelinkWithOccurrence. The supported values are "true" and "false". Keys and their values both are case sensitive.
If createComplyingTracelinkWithOccurrence is "true", the complying object for the created tracelink will be the occurrence.
If createDefiningTracelinkWithOccurrence is "true", the defining object for the created tracelink will be the occurrence.
If createTracelinkWithOccurrences is "true", the defining and complying object for the created tracelink will be the occurrence.
Typedef.name: RequestPreference2

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation retrieves the information about the FullText dataset versions for the given Requirements. It also retrieves the contents and properties of the FullText dataset which are displayed in the user interface.
The following partial errors may be returned:
159001: An internal error has occurred in the Requirements Management module. Please report this error to your system administrator.
141308: The type of operation to perform in invalid.
141309: The selected input object does not contain FullText object.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::RequirementsManagement::getFullTextVersionInfo
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
If successful, the Requirement Revision and its FullText dataset versions and its contents will be returned along with the ServiceData. If an error occurs then ServiceData will contain partial error.
The following partial errors may be returned:
159001 An internal error has occurred in the Requirements Management module. Please report this error to your system administrator.
141308 The type of operation to perform in invalid.
141309 The selected input object does not contain FullText object.

OperationParameter.description: List of objects of type Requirement Revision or Arm0RequirementElement to get the FullText dataset versions.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation creates a FND_TraceLink object between the primary and secondary business objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::RequirementsManagement::createTracelinks
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of CreateTracelinksResponseData structures, one for each successfully created FND_TraceLink object corresponding to each input and the ServiceData. Any failure will be returned with clientId mapped to error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors. Following error codes are returned in the ServiceData.

    • 141300 -The trace link was not created because both start and end items must be occurrences.
    • 141301 -The trace link was not created because either the start or end item is a context root element.
    • 141302 - The trace link was not created because either the start or end item is missing.
    • 141303 - The "trace link relation" cannot be created between a "object type" and a "object type".
    • 141304 - The trace link was not created because the relation "trace link relation" already exists between the start and end items.
    • 141305 - The trace link was not created because the end item needs to be an occurrence.
    • 141306 - The trace link was not created because the start item needs to be an occurrence.

OperationParameter.description: Structures which hold the required information to create tracelinks between the given business objects.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This operation retrieves export templates from database.These export templates are of type SpecTemplate and ExcelTemplate that are used to exporting Teamcenter objects to Office applications using the template option. The templates are retrieved based on the input filter.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::RequirementsManagement::getExportTemplates
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: The GetExportTemplateResponse structure contains the information about type of template and the display name of the template. The type of template can be "SpecTemplate" or "ExcelTemplate".

OperationParameter.description: The filter to determine the type of export templates to fetch based on the input Teamcenter objects like Item and ItemRevision. Valid values are "SpecTemplate", "ExcelTemplate" or both.
OperationParameter.name: filter

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation will exports the selected occurrences in the structure to the application such as MSWord and MSExcel. The behavior of export operation is controlled by applicationFormat argument specified in ExportToApplicationInput2 structure.
Following are supported application formats from input.

    • MSExcelLive - This mode provides the capability of editing of properties of underlying ItemRevision in MSExcel and save the changes to Teamcenter. The generated sheet allows user to login and change the properties from MSExcel application. The changes will be saved to Teamcenter when user exits out of the cell in MSExcel application. Teamcenter extensions for Microsoft Office should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordXMLLive - This mode provides the capability of structural editing of SpecElementRevisions in MSWord. Users can edit the rich text of Requirement and perform structural changes to the exported Requirement(s) in the word document. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSExcel - This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to static MSExcel application.
    • MSExcelReimport- This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to MSExcel application for reimport purpose. The generated sheet can be used to for add/remove structure elements or to update the properties on the SpecElement revision. The generated sheet should be reimported back to Teamcenter. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordCompare - This mode provides the capability of comparing the contents of source and target objects using MSWord application. The comparison document is generated asynchonously in the background and user is notified when the comparison document is generated. Dispatcher and notification services should be running to support this application format.
    • HTML- This mode provides the capability of fetching the HTML contents of input SpecElement objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::RequirementsManagement::exportToApplication
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The contents of the input SpecElements and the transient file read tickets of the exported file. The following partial errors may be returned.
    • 126001:An internal error has occurred in the Occurrence Management module.
    • 126002:No Adapter could be found to handle the Product. The system has not been adequately enhanced or customised to deal with the data given to it as input.
    • 126003:The selected input object is not an BusinessObject of type Awb0Element.
    • 126004:The supported application formats are MSExcel, MSWordXMLLive, MSExcelLive, MSExcelReimport, MSWordCompare and HTML.

OperationParameter.description: Input for the operation to export the selected occurrences to MSWord or MSExcel.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation exports the selected occurrences in the structure to an application such as MSWord and MSExcel. The behavior of export operation is controlled by applicationFormat argument specified in ExportToApplicationInput structure. Additionlly this operation allows callers of the SOA to supply a parameter to let the objects be checked out during export.will allow Teamcenter objects to be checked out. The objects may be checked out during the export.

Following are supported application formats from input.

    • MSExcelLive - This mode provides the capability of editing of properties of underlying ItemRevision in MSExcel and save the changes to Teamcenter. The generated sheet allows user to login and change the properties from MSExcel application. The changes will be saved to Teamcenter when user exits out of the cell in MSExcel application. Teamcenter extensions for Microsoft Office should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordXMLLive - This mode provides the capability of structural editing of SpecElementRevisions in MSWord. Users can edit the rich text of Requirement and perform structural changes to the exported Requirement(s) in the word document. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSExcel - This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to static MSExcel application.
    • MSExcelReimport- This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to MSExcel application for reimport purpose. The generated sheet can be used to for add/remove structure elements or to update the properties on the SpecElement revision. The generated sheet should be reimported back to Teamcenter. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordCompare - This mode provides the capability of comparing the contents of source and target objects using MSWord application. The comparison document is generated asynchonously in the background and user is notified when the comparison document is generated. Dispatcher and notification services should be running to support this application format.
    • HTML- This mode provides the capability of fetching the HTML contents of input SpecElement objects.


This operation is for Teamcenter internal use and is unpublished.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::RequirementsManagement::exportToApplication2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
ExportToApplicationResponse2
The contents of the input SpecElements and the transient file read tickets of the exported file.

The following partial errors may be returned:
126001 An internal error has occurred in the Occurrence Management module.
126002 No Adapter could be found to handle the Product. The system has not been adequately enhanced or customised to deal with the data given to it as input.
126012 The selected input object is not an BusinessObject of type Awb0Element.
126013 The supported application formats are MSExcel, MSWordXMLLive, MSExcelLive, MSExcelReimport, MSWordCompare and HTML.
515024 Invalid object for checkout.

OperationParameter.description: Input for the operation to export the selected occurrences to MSWord or MSExcel.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation exports the selected occurrences in the structure to an application such as MSWord and MSExcel. The behavior of export operation is controlled by applicationFormat and objectTemplateInputs arguments specified in ExportToApplicationInput4 structure. If user selects the "include attachments" option, then this operation can export a .zip file that will include all the attachments associated with the selected object along with the document. The objects may be checked out during the export.

Following are supported application formats from input.

    • MSExcelLive - This mode provides the capability of editing of properties of underlying ItemRevision in MSExcel and save the changes to Teamcenter. The generated sheet allows user to login and change the properties from MSExcel application. The changes will be saved to Teamcenter when user exits out of the cell in MSExcel application. Teamcenter extensions for Microsoft Office should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordXMLLive - This mode provides the capability of structural editing of SpecElementRevisions in MSWord. Users can edit the rich text of Requirement and perform structural changes to the exported Requirement(s) in the word document. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSExcel - This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to static MSExcel application.
    • MSExcelReimport- This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to MSExcel application for reimport purpose. The generated sheet can be used to for add/remove structure elements or to update the properties on the SpecElement revision. The generated sheet should be reimported back to Teamcenter. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordCompare - This mode provides the capability of comparing the contents of source and target objects using MSWord application. The comparison document is generated asynchonously in the background and user is notified when the comparison document is generated. Dispatcher and notification services should be running to support this application format.
    • HTML- This mode provides the capability of fetching the HTML contents of input SpecElement objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::RequirementsManagement::exportToApplication3
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The contents of the input SpecElements and the transient file read tickets of the exported file.

The following partial errors may be returned:

126001 - An internal error has occurred in the Occurrence Management module.
126002 - No Adapter could be found to handle the Product. The system has not been adequately enhanced or customised to deal with the data given to it as input.
126012 - The selected input object is not an BusineddObject of type Awb0Element.
126013 - The supported application formats are MSExcel, MSWordXMLLive, MSExcelLive, MSExcelReimport, MSWordCompare and HTML
515024 - Invalid object for checkout.
141091 - The selected object currently checked-out by another user.
141092 - The selected object currently not checked-out by user.
141093 - Some of selected objects are currently checked-out by another user.
141094 - Some of the selected objects are not checked-out by user.

OperationParameter.description: Input for the operation to export the selected occurrences to MSWord or MSExcel
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation creates baseline of the selected business object.The selected object can be of type ItemRevision or Awb0Element .Baseline is a mechanism to to preserve the current state of the object in time . This is asynchronous operation and is invoked by synchronous service operation createBaseline . createBaselineAsync operation performs the actual baseline creation. When the business object selected for baselining is a structure occurrence of type Awb0Element, new baseline revisions are created for all the occurrences in that structure. When the selected business object is of type ItemRevision, then a single baseline revision is created. User is notified after baseline creation is complete.

This operation will be used internally and will not be published.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::RequirementsManagement::createBaseline
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: If an error occurs then ServiceData will contain partial error.

OperationParameter.description: The BaselineInputData represents the data required to baseline selected object.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This SOA operation sets the body text property of a FullText object to the supplied html or pain text content. The SOA operation is called when a user modifies requirements in the active workspace client. It accepts SpecElement Revision or FullText objects to process. All modified objects and exceptions are added to the returned service data.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::RequirementsManagement::setRichContent
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: The objecs will be returned in the 'plain' slot of the ServiceData with partial errors for any UID that is not valid or references an object the user does not have asscess to.

OperationParameter.description: A vecrtor of setContentInputs
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation sets the contents of the FullText or SpecElementRevision object. The input content type can be 'HTML', 'Plain' or 'RichText' type. All modified objects and exceptions are added to the returned service data. Additionally this operation will prevent the user from overwriting the contents of FullText or SpecElementRevision object, when multiple users are trying to update contents of same object by comparing last saved date of FullText object.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::RequirementsManagement::setRichContent2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The objects will be returned in the 'plain' slot of the ServiceData with partial errors for any UID that is not valid or references an object the user does not have access to. Additionally following possible error returned in Service Data.
141023 The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user

OperationParameter.description: A vector of setContentInputs
OperationParameter.name: inputs

When the business object selected for baselining is a structure occurrence of type Awb0Element, new baseline revisions are created for all the occurrences in that structure. When the selected business object is of type ItemRevision, then a single baseline revision is created. User is notified after baseline creation is complete.

Operation.description:
This operation retrieves the information about the FullText dataset versions for the given Requirements. It also retrieves the contents and properties of the FullText dataset which are displayed in the user interface.
The following partial errors may be returned:
159001: An internal error has occurred in the Requirements Management module. Please report this error to your system administrator.
141308: The type of operation to perform in invalid.
141309: The selected input object does not contain FullText object.
Operation.name: getFullTextVersionInfo
Operation.returnDescription:
If successful, the Requirement Revision and its FullText dataset versions and its contents will be returned along with the ServiceData. If an error occurs then ServiceData will contain partial error.
The following partial errors may be returned:
159001 An internal error has occurred in the Requirements Management module. Please report this error to your system administrator.
141308 The type of operation to perform in invalid.
141309 The selected input object does not contain FullText object.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: Get FullText dataset versions and contents
User selects a Requirement in Home folder. User goes to History tab where document history list will be displayed.This document history list will contain information about all the Requirement Revision and its FullText dataset versions and its contents. User selects any two FullText dataset versions and clicks on compare which will give compare HTML report.

Use Case 2: Get FullText dataset versions during Freeze of derived Requirement
User loads the requirement specification in ACE (Active Content Experience) panel. User clicks on 'Reuse' command which shows the 'Reuse and Derived' panel. User selects 'Create a derived Specification' and selects a tracelink type and clicks on Create button. This creates a derived of the existing Requirement specification. User selects a derived Requirement and clicks on 'Freeze' option which shows the FullText dataset versions. User will pick a version and clicks on Ok button. This will freeze the Requirement and it will show the contents from the dataset version that user had picked.

ParameterInfo.description: List of objects of type Requirement Revision or Arm0RequirementElement to get the FullText dataset versions.

Operation.description:
This operation creates baseline of the selected business object.The selected object can be of type ItemRevision or Awb0Element .Baseline is a mechanism to to preserve the current state of the object in time . This is a synchronous operation and it returns back immediately with partial errors if any. This operation calls createBaselineAsync (asynchronous service operation) which performs the actual baseline creation. When the business object selected for baselining is a structure occurrence of type Awb0Element, new baseline revision is created for all the occurrences in that structure. When the selected business object is of type ItemRevision, then a single baseline revision is created. User is notified after baseline creation is complete.

This operation is for Teamcenter internal use and is unpublished.
Operation.name: createBaseline
Operation.returnDescription:
If an error occurs then ServiceData will contain partial error.
The following partial errors may be returned:
141089 - The Object "Object A" was not saved because it is an unsupported type.
Operation.useCase:
1. User loads a structure in ACE (Active Content Experience) panel. The ACE panel is used for smart navigation of occurrences in a structure.
User selects an occurrence and in Tool and Info command bar, clicks on 'Save As or Revise' option. This will show up a panel with tab options as "Revision" and "New". In Revision tab, 'Save as Baseline' checkbox is present. After selecting this checkbox, 'Baseline Template' dropdown box appears. The user selects a baseline template from dropdown followed by a click on "Save" button, resulting into baseline creation. Irrespective of the selected occurrence, after clicking "Save"; the entire structure ie. top most parent occurrence and all its children are baselined. When the baseline creation completes, a notification is sent to the client.

2. User selects an ItemRevision in non ACE view and in Tool and Info command bar clicks on 'Save As or Revise' option. This will show up a panel with tab options as "Revision" and "New". After selecting this checkbox, 'Baseline Template' dropdown box appears. In Revision tab, 'Save as Baseline' checkbox is present. The user selects a baseline template from dropdown followed by a click on "Save" button, resulting into baseline creation for this item revision. When the baseline creation completes, a notification is sent to the client.

ParameterInfo.description: The BaselineInputData represents the data required to baseline selected object.
