This is asynchronous operation and is invoked by synchronous service operation createBaseline . createBaselineAsync operation performs the actual baseline creation. When the business object selected for baselining is a structure occurrence of type Awb0Element, new baseline revision is created for all the occurrences in that structure. When the selected business object is of type ItemRevision, then a single baseline revision is created. User is notified after baseline creation is complete.
Operation.name: createBaselineAsync
Operation.returnDescription: This is an asynchronous method, there is no return value.
Operation.useCase:
1. User loads a structure in ACE (Active Content Experience) panel. The ACE panel is used for smart navigation of occurrences in a structure.
User selects an occurrence and in Tool and Info command bar, clicks on 'Save As or Revise' option. This will show up a panel with tab options as "Revision" and "New". In Revision tab, 'Save as Baseline' checkbox is present. After selecting this checkbox, 'Baseline Template' dropdown box appears. The user selects a baseline template from dropdown followed by a click on "Save" button, resulting into baseline creation. Irrespective of the selected occurrence, after clicking "Save"; the entire structure ie. top most parent occurrence and all its children are baselined. When the baseline creation completes, a notification is sent to the client.

2. User selects an ItemRevision in non ACE view and in Tool and Info command bar clicks on 'Save As or Revise' option. This will show up a panel with tab options as "Revision" and "New". After selecting this checkbox, 'Baseline Template' dropdown box appears. In Revision tab, 'Save as Baseline' checkbox is present. The user selects a baseline template from dropdown followed by a click on "Save" button, resulting into baseline creation for this item revision. When the baseline creation completes, a notification is sent to the client.

ParameterInfo.description: The input BaselineInputDataAsync represents the data required to baseline selected object.

Operation.description: This operation creates a FND_TraceLink object between the primary and secondary business objects.
Operation.name: createTracelinks
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of CreateTracelinksResponseData structures, one for each successfully created FND_TraceLink object corresponding to each input and the ServiceData. Any failure will be returned with clientId mapped to error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors. Following error codes are returned in the ServiceData.

    • 141300 -The trace link was not created because both start and end items must be occurrences.
    • 141301 -The trace link was not created because either the start or end item is a context root element.
    • 141302 - The trace link was not created because either the start or end item is missing.
    • 141303 - The "trace link relation" cannot be created between a "object type" and a "object type".
    • 141304 - The trace link was not created because the relation "trace link relation" already exists between the start and end items.
    • 141305 - The trace link was not created because the end item needs to be an occurrence.
    • 141306 - The trace link was not created because the start item needs to be an occurrence.
Operation.useCase:
In ACE perspective, user select an Awb0Element element and clicks on the “Create TraceLink” button. The selected element will be in the Create Trace Link panel start section, user chooses another Awb0Element element in the Create Trace Link panel end section.

    • If createTracelinkWithOccurrences mode is true, the trace link between the Occurrences will be created.
    • If createDefiningTracelinkWithOccurrence is true, then the trace link between the defining Occurrence and the complying underlying workspace object will be created.
    • If createComplyingTracelinkWithOccurrence is true, then the trace link between the defining underlying workspace object and the complying Occurrence will be created.

ParameterInfo.description: Structures which hold the required information to create tracelinks between the given business objects.

Operation.description:
This operation exports the selected occurrences in the structure asynchronously to an application such as MSExcel. The behavior of export operation is controlled by applicationFormat argument specified in ExportInputDataAsync structure. The objects may be checked out during the export.

Following are supported application formats from input.

    • MSExcelLive - This mode provides the capability of editing of properties of underlying ItemRevision in MSExcel and save the changes to Teamcenter. The generated sheet allows user to login and change the properties from MSExcel application. The changes will be saved to Teamcenter when user exits out of the cell in MSExcel application. Teamcenter extensions for Microsoft Office should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSExcel - This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to static MSExcel application.
    • MSExcelReimport - This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to MSExcel application for reimport purpose. The generated sheet can be used to add/remove structure elements or to update the properties on the SpecElementRevision. The generated sheet should be reimported back to Teamcenter. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format
Operation.name: exportAsync
Operation.returnDescription: This is an asynchronous method, there is no return value.
Operation.useCase:
• User loads a structure in ACE (Active Content Experience) panel. The ACE panel is used for smart navigation of occurrences in a structure.User selects an occurrence and clicks on the Export to Excel button in the toolbar. This will show a panel with options to "View", "Live Edit" and "Edit and Import". This panel allows user to select a template and if user clicks on Export button, an Excel sheet will be generated. If user has selected a single occurrence and clicks on export, then the occurrence and all its children are exported to MSExcel. If user has selected multiple occurrences and clicks on export, then the selected occurrences are exported to MSExcel.
    • User selects single or multiple objects in Active Workspace Client. User clicks on the Export to Excel button in the toolbar. User can select View, Edit or Reimport option. Depending upon the option selected, a static MSExcel report or a Live MSExcel sheet or a sheet is generated that can be reimported back to Teamcenter.
    • User selects an ItemRevision and clicks on the Export to Excel button on the toolbar. If user selects "Check out" option then selected ItemRevision and its children will be checked out and exported to MSExcel.
    • User selects single or multiple objects in ActiveWorkspace Client. User selects the background checkbox in the export panel and clicks on the Export to Excel button in the toolbar. This will invoke the Export to Excel using the async service options. When the Export to Excel completes, a notification is sent to the client to download the Excel file. The generated file is also attached to the MSExcelX dataset.
    • User selects the "apply_bom_crawling" LOV value on the ExcelTemplate and selects an occurrence in ACE and clicks on Export to Excel button in the toolbar. This will crawlback from the selected object to its parent's recursively till its top line and the exported structure will export the selected line along with its parents.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and replaced by Awp0::Soa::Internal::AWS2::_2017_06::RequirementsManagement::exportAsync2

ParameterInfo.description: Input for the operation to export the selected objects to MSExcel.

Operation.description:
This operation exports the selected occurrences in the structure asynchronously to an application such as MSExcel and MSWord. The behavior of export operation is controlled by applicationFormat and objectTemplateInputs arguments specified in ExportInputDataAsync2 structure. If user selects the "include attachments" option, then this operation can export a .zip file that will include all the attachments associated with the selected object along with the document. The objects may be checked out during the export.

Following are supported application formats from input.

    • MSExcelLive - This mode provides the capability of editing of properties of underlying ItemRevision in MSExcel and save the changes to Teamcenter. The generated sheet allows user to login and change the properties from MSExcel application. The changes will be saved to Teamcenter when user exits out of the cell in MSExcel application. Teamcenter extensions for Microsoft Office should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSExcel - This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to static MSExcel application.
    • MSExcelReimport - This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to MSExcel application for reimport purpose. The generated sheet can be used to add/remove structure elements or to update the properties on the SpecElementRevision. The generated sheet should be reimported back to Teamcenter. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordXMLLive - This mode provides the capability of structural editing of SpecElementRevision in MSWord. Users can edit the rich text of Requirements and perform structural changes to the exported Requirements in the word document. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
Operation.name: exportAsync2
Operation.returnDescription: This is an asynchronous method, there is no return value.
Operation.useCase:
• User loads a structure in ACE (Active Content Experience) panel. The ACE panel is used for smart navigation of occurrences in a structure. User selects an occurrence and clicks on the Export to Excel button in the toolbar. This will show a panel with options to "View", "Live Edit" and "Edit and Import". This panel allows user to select a template and if user clicks on Export button, an Excel sheet will be generated. If user has selected a single occurrence and clicks on export, then the occurrence and all its children are exported to MSExcel. If user has selected multiple occurrences and clicks on export, then the selected occurrences are exported to MSExcel.
    • User selects single or multiple objects in Active Workspace Client. User clicks on the Export to Excel button in the toolbar. User can select View, Edit or Reimport option. Depending upon the option selected, a static MSExcel report or a Live MSExcel sheet or a sheet is generated that can be reimported back to Teamcenter.
    • User selects an ItemRevision and clicks on the Export to Excel button on the toolbar. If user selects "Check out" option then selected ItemRevision and its children will be checked out and exported to MSExcel.
    • User selects single or multiple objects in ActiveWorkspace Client. User selects the background checkbox in the export panel and clicks on the Export to Excel button in the toolbar. This will invoke the Export to Excel using the async service options. When the Export to Excel completes, a notification is sent to the client to download the Excel file. The generated file is also attached to the MSExcelX dataset.
    • User selects the "apply_bom_crawling" LOV value on the ExcelTemplate and selects an occurrence in ACE and clicks on Export to Excel button in the toolbar. This will crawlback from the selected object to its parent's recursively till its top line and the exported structure will export the selected line along with its parents.
    • User selects single or multiple objects in ActiveWorkspace Client. User selects the background checkbox in the export panel and clicks on the Export to Word button in the toolbar. This will invoke the Export to MSWord using the async service options. When the Export to MSWord completes, a notification is sent to the client to download the file.
    • User selects single or multiple objects in Active Workspace Client, and clicks on Export to Word button on the toolbar. User may select the Object Template that will be applied on the exported document.
    • User selects single or multiple objects in Active workspace client and clicks on Export to Word button on the toolbar. If the user selects "Include attachments"option, then a zip file will be exported that includes the Word document along with all the attachments associated with the selected object.

ParameterInfo.description: Input for the operation to export the selected objects to MSExcel and MSWord

Operation.description:
This operation will exports the selected occurrences in the structure to the application such as MSWord and MSExcel. The behavior of export operation is controlled by applicationFormat argument specified in ExportToApplicationInput2 structure.
Following are supported application formats from input.

    • MSExcelLive - This mode provides the capability of editing of properties of underlying ItemRevision in MSExcel and save the changes to Teamcenter. The generated sheet allows user to login and change the properties from MSExcel application. The changes will be saved to Teamcenter when user exits out of the cell in MSExcel application. Teamcenter extensions for Microsoft Office should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordXMLLive - This mode provides the capability of structural editing of SpecElementRevisions in MSWord. Users can edit the rich text of Requirement and perform structural changes to the exported Requirement(s) in the word document. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSExcel - This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to static MSExcel application.
    • MSExcelReimport- This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to MSExcel application for reimport purpose. The generated sheet can be used to for add/remove structure elements or to update the properties on the SpecElement revision. The generated sheet should be reimported back to Teamcenter. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordCompare - This mode provides the capability of comparing the contents of source and target objects using MSWord application. The comparison document is generated asynchonously in the background and user is notified when the comparison document is generated. Dispatcher and notification services should be running to support this application format.
    • HTML- This mode provides the capability of fetching the HTML contents of input SpecElement objects.
Operation.name: exportToApplication
Operation.returnDescription:
The contents of the input SpecElements and the transient file read tickets of the exported file. The following partial errors may be returned.
    • 126001:An internal error has occurred in the Occurrence Management module.
    • 126002:No Adapter could be found to handle the Product. The system has not been adequately enhanced or customised to deal with the data given to it as input.
    • 126003:The selected input object is not an BusinessObject of type Awb0Element.
    • 126004:The supported application formats are MSExcel, MSWordXMLLive, MSExcelLive, MSExcelReimport, MSWordCompare and HTML.
Operation.useCase:
• User loads a structure in ACE (Active Content Experience) panel. The ACE panel is used for smart navigation of occurrences in a structure. User selects an occurrence and clicks on the Export To Word or Export to Excel button in the toolbar. This action will allow users to select a template that will be used for export purpose. If user has selected a single occurrence and clicks on export, then the occurrence and all its children are exported to MSWord or MSExcel. If user has selected multiple occurrences and clicks on export, then the selected occurrences are exported to MSWord or MSExcel.
    • User selects single or multiple objects in Active Workspace Client. User clicks on the Export to Excel button in the toolbar. User can select View, Edit or Reimport option. Depending upon the option selected, a static MSExcel report or a Live MSExcel sheet or a sheet is generated that can be reimported back to Teamcenter.
    • User select s single or multiple objects in Active Workspace Client and sets them as source objects to compare. Similarly user selects single or multiple target objects to compare. User clicks on the Export to Word button in the toolbar along with the checkbox for compare contents. User selects the compare contents checkbox that allows user to compare the MSWord contents of source and target objects. User is notified when the comparison document is generated and attached to a dataset.
    • User selects a SpecElement created from Active Workspace client and clicks on the Viewer tab. The HTML contents of the selected SpecElement is shown in the Viewer tab.

ParameterInfo.description: Input for the operation to export the selected occurrences to MSWord or MSExcel.

Operation.description:
This operation exports the selected occurrences in the structure to an application such as MSWord and MSExcel. The behavior of export operation is controlled by applicationFormat argument specified in ExportToApplicationInput structure. Additionlly this operation allows callers of the SOA to supply a parameter to let the objects be checked out during export.will allow Teamcenter objects to be checked out. The objects may be checked out during the export.

Following are supported application formats from input.

    • MSExcelLive - This mode provides the capability of editing of properties of underlying ItemRevision in MSExcel and save the changes to Teamcenter. The generated sheet allows user to login and change the properties from MSExcel application. The changes will be saved to Teamcenter when user exits out of the cell in MSExcel application. Teamcenter extensions for Microsoft Office should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordXMLLive - This mode provides the capability of structural editing of SpecElementRevisions in MSWord. Users can edit the rich text of Requirement and perform structural changes to the exported Requirement(s) in the word document. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSExcel - This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to static MSExcel application.
    • MSExcelReimport- This mode provides the capability of exporting objects to MSExcel application for reimport purpose. The generated sheet can be used to for add/remove structure elements or to update the properties on the SpecElement revision. The generated sheet should be reimported back to Teamcenter. Office Client should be installed on the client machine to support this application format.
    • MSWordCompare - This mode provides the capability of comparing the contents of source and target objects using MSWord application. The comparison document is generated asynchonously in the background and user is notified when the comparison document is generated. Dispatcher and notification services should be running to support this application format.
    • HTML- This mode provides the capability of fetching the HTML contents of input SpecElement objects.


This operation is for Teamcenter internal use and is unpublished.
Operation.name: exportToApplication2
Operation.returnDescription:
ExportToApplicationResponse2
The contents of the input SpecElements and the transient file read tickets of the exported file.

The following partial errors may be returned:
126001 An internal error has occurred in the Occurrence Management module.
126002 No Adapter could be found to handle the Product. The system has not been adequately enhanced or customised to deal with the data given to it as input.
126012 The selected input object is not an BusinessObject of type Awb0Element.
126013 The supported application formats are MSExcel, MSWordXMLLive, MSExcelLive, MSExcelReimport, MSWordCompare and HTML.
515024 Invalid object for checkout.
Operation.useCase:
1) User loads a structure in ACE (Active Content Experience) panel. The ACE panel is used for smart navigation of occurrences in a structure.
User selects an occurrence and clicks on the Export To Word or Export to Excel button in the toolbar. This action will allow users to select a template that will be used for export purpose. If user has selected a single occurrence and clicks on export, then the occurrence and all its children are exported to MSWord or MSExcel. If user has selected multiple occurrences and clicks on export, then the selected occurrences are exported to MSWord or MSExcel.

2) User selects single or multiple objects in Active Workspace Client. User clicks on the Export to Excel button in the toolbar. User can select View, Edit or Reimport option. Depending upon the option selected, a static MSExcel report or a Live MSExcel sheet or a sheet is generated that can be reimported back to Teamcenter.
3) User selects single or multiple objects in Active Workspace Client and sets them as source objects to compare. Similarly user selects single or multiple target objects to compare. User clicks on the Export to Word button in the toolbar along with the checkbox for compare contents. User selects the compare contents checkbox that allows user to compare the MSWord contents of source and target objects. User is notified when the comparison document is generated and attached to a dataset.
4) User selects a SpecElement created from Active Workspace client and clicks on the Viewer tab. The HTML contents of the selected SpecElement is shown in the Viewer tab.
5) User selects an ItemRevision and clicks on the Export To Word or Export to Excel button in on the toolbar. If user selects "Check out" option then selected occurrences ItemRevision and its children will be checked out and exported to MSWord or MSExcel.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and replaced by Awp0::Soa::Internal::AWS2::_2017_06::RequirementsManagement::exportToApplication3

Operation.returnDescription:
The contents of the input SpecElements and the transient file read tickets of the exported file.

The following partial errors may be returned:

126001 - An internal error has occurred in the Occurrence Management module.
126002 - No Adapter could be found to handle the Product. The system has not been adequately enhanced or customised to deal with the data given to it as input.

Operation.description: This operation retrieves export templates from database.These export templates are of type SpecTemplate and ExcelTemplate that are used to exporting Teamcenter objects to Office applications using the template option. The templates are retrieved based on the input filter.
Operation.name: getExportTemplates
Operation.returnDescription: The GetExportTemplateResponse structure contains the information about type of template and the display name of the template. The type of template can be "SpecTemplate" or "ExcelTemplate".

ParameterInfo.description: The filter to determine the type of export templates to fetch based on the input Teamcenter objects like Item and ItemRevision. Valid values are "SpecTemplate", "ExcelTemplate" or both.

Operation.description: This SOA operation sets the body text property of a FullText object to the supplied html or pain text content. The SOA operation is called when a user modifies requirements in the active workspace client. It accepts SpecElement Revision or FullText objects to process. All modified objects and exceptions are added to the returned service data.
Operation.name: setRichContent
Operation.returnDescription: The objecs will be returned in the 'plain' slot of the ServiceData with partial errors for any UID that is not valid or references an object the user does not have asscess to.

ParameterInfo.description: A vecrtor of setContentInputs

Operation.description: This operation sets the contents of the FullText or SpecElementRevision object. The input content type can be 'HTML', 'Plain' or 'RichText' type. All modified objects and exceptions are added to the returned service data. Additionally this operation will prevent the user from overwriting the contents of FullText or SpecElementRevision object, when multiple users are trying to update contents of same object by comparing last saved date of FullText object.
Operation.name: setRichContent2
Operation.returnDescription:
The objects will be returned in the 'plain' slot of the ServiceData with partial errors for any UID that is not valid or references an object the user does not have access to. Additionally following possible error returned in Service Data.
141023 The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user
Operation.useCase:
1. User selects a object of type SpecElement created from Active Workspace client and clicks on the Viewer tab. The HTML contents of the selected SpecElement type is shown in the Viewer tab. User can set rich text contents of Requirement object by using setRichContent2 operation.

2. When multiple users edit a requirement's content concurrently and try to save using setRichContent2 operation. It prevent user from overwriting changes of another user for the same requirement by comparing last saved date of FullText object.

ParameterInfo.description: A vector of setContentInputs

ServiceInterface.description: This service provides a variety of operations for advanced saved searches. Operations include creating and updating advanced saved searches.
ServiceInterface.name: AdvancedSavedSearch

Struct.description: Contians a list of newly created saved searches and the service data containing partial errors if any.
Struct.name: Awp0AdvancedSavedSearchResponse

StructElement.description: A List of SavedSearch objects created or modified by a service operation.
StructElement.name: savedSearchList

StructElement.description: Returned service data.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: Input structure for createAdvancedSavedSearch operation.
Struct.name: Awp0CreateAdvancedSavedSearchInput

StructElement.description:
A map (string, string) to hold string value inputs, valid keys are followings:
    • “savedSearchName” The name of saved search.
    • “referencingSavedQuery” The saved query this saved search is created based off.
    • “targetFolder” The target Folder the saved search will be created in.
    • “clientId” This unique ID is used to identify return data elements and partial errors associated with this input structure.
StructElement.name: stringValueInputKeyValuePairs

StructElement.description:
A map (string, bool) to hold bool value inputs, valid keys are followings:
    • “shareSavedSearch” Allow other users to view and execute the saved search. If true, other users can see and execute the saved search; otherwise not visible to other users.
    • “favorite” Favorite saved search of current user. If true, it’s a favorite saved search of current user; otherwise a regular one.
    • “pinToHome” Pin to home for current user. Valid values are:If true, pin the saved search to home; otherwise not pin to home.
    • “override” Valid values are: True or False. If false and a SavedSearch object having same name owned by current user already exists, then partial error returned. If true and a SavedSearch object having same name owned by current user already exists then delete the existing SavedSearch object and create a new one.
StructElement.name: boolValueInputKeyValuePairs

StructElement.description: The search critiera (user inputs) used to create the saved search, which will be used when executing the saved search.
StructElement.name: savedSearchCriteria

Struct.description: Input structure for updateAdvancedSavedSearch operation.
Struct.name: Awp0UpdateAdvancedSavedSearchInput

StructElement.description:
A map (string, string) to hold string value nputs. Valid keys are followings:
    • "savedSearchUid" The uid of saved search to update.
    • “savedSearchName” The saved search name.
    • “clientId” This unique ID is used to identify return data elements and partial errors associated with this input structure.
StructElement.name: stringValueInputKeyValuePairs

StructElement.description:
A map (string, bool) to hold bool value inputs. Valid keys are followings:
    • “shareSavedSearch” Allow other users to view and execute the saved search. If true, other users can see and execute the saved search; otherwise not visible to other users. Only applicable for owning user.
    • “favorite” Favorite saved search of current user. If true, it’s a favorite saved search of current user; otherwise a regular one.
    • “pinToHome” Pin to home for current user. If true, pin the saved search to home; otherwise not pin to home.
    • “override” If false and a SavedSearch object having same name owned by current user already exists, then partial error returned. If true and a SavedSearch object having same name owned by current user already exists then delete the existing SavedSearch object and create a new one. Only applicable for owning user.
StructElement.name: boolValueInputKeyValuePairs

Typedef.description: Key value pair represents bool value input.
Typedef.name: BoolValueInputKeyValueMap

Struct.description: A strucuture represents a saved search critieria.
Struct.name: SavedSearchCriteria

StructElement.description: Name of critiera. e.g. “fnd0CurrentLocationCode”
StructElement.name: criteriaName

StructElement.description: Value of criteria. e.g. “us”
StructElement.name: criteriaValue

StructElement.description: Display value of critiera. e.g. “United States”
StructElement.name: criteriaDisplayValue

Struct.description:
Input structure for the getSearchSettings service which is used to set the inputs for which values are needed from server.

This input structure uses a map to provide a way for the client to request specific display values for multiple preference in bulk. The Key for this map is the dynamic set of preference names to request display values for. The Value is the specific list of internal values to translate to display values.
Struct.name: GetSearchSettingsInput

StructElement.description:
Input map(string, list<string>) for getting the search settings. Supported keys and values are (this set will be expanded in future releases)
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Key                                                          |                Values
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
AWC_Limited_Filter_Categories_Expanded | List of internal property names
| <type_name>.<property name>] Ex:
| WorkspaceObject.object_type
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Default_Quick_Access_Query | Internal name of the quick access query
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
StructElement.name: inputSettings

Struct.description: The input key and its corrosponding output values.
Struct.name: GetSearchSettingsResponse

StructElement.description:
Output values map(string, list of<string>) that contain the input key and its corresponding outputs.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Key                                                                     | Values
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
AWC_Limited_Filter_Categories_Expanded | A List of [display names of the properties] Ex: For
| WorkspaceObject.object_type as input the output
| would be “Type”
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Default_Quick_Access_Query | Display name of the quick access query
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
StructElement.name: outputValues

Typedef.description: Key value pair represents string value input.
Typedef.name: StringValueInputKeyValueMap

Typedef.description: A map of string to list of strings.
Typedef.name: StringVectorMap

OperationTemplate.description: This operation creates advanced saved searches for given inputs.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::AdvancedSavedSearch::createAdvancedSavedSearch
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Advanced saved searches created by this service operation. The following partial error may be returned:
    • 141152: The new saved search could not be created because a saved search already exists with the same name.
    • 141325: The input key is invalid. The valid input keys are "savedSearchName", "referencingSavedQuery", "targetFolder" and "clientId".
    • 141326: The input key is invalid. The valid input keys are "shareSavedSearch", "favorite", "pinToHome" and "override".
    • 141329: The required input is missing. Please contact your system administrator.

OperationParameter.description: Information required to create a list of new Teamcenter SavedSearch objects.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation updates advanced saved searches for given inputs.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::AdvancedSavedSearch::updateAdvancedSavedSearch
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Advanced saved searches updated by this service operation. The following partial error may be returned:
    • 141326: The input key is invalid. The valid input keys are "shareSavedSearch", "favorite", "pinToHome" and "override".
    • 141327: The saved search cannot be unshared because it is either pinned to "Home" or marked as favorite by other users.
    • 141328: The input key is invalid. The valid input keys are "savedSearchNameUid", "savedSearchName", and "clientId".
    • 141329: The required input is missing. Please contact your system administrator.

OperationParameter.description: Information required to update a list of Teamcenter SavedSearch objects.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation is used to get the search setting values from the server. These search settings are displayed at the client side to make search more configurable and convenient for user. Client needs to render these setting in user undersandable formate so that users can customize search based on their requirement.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::getSearchSettings
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: Returns the search setting values to the client based on input criteria.

OperationParameter.description: Input structure to set the setting names for which the values are required.

Advanced saved searches updated by this service operation. The following partial error may be returned:
    • 141326: The input key is invalid. The valid input keys are "shareSavedSearch", "favorite", "pinToHome" and "override".
    • 141327: The saved search cannot be unshared because it is either pinned to "Home" or marked as favorite by other users.

ParameterInfo.description: Information required to update a list of Teamcenter SavedSearch objects.

Operation.description: This operation is used to get the search setting values from the server. These search settings are displayed at the client side to make search more configurable and convenient for user. Client needs to render these setting in user undersandable formate so that users can customize search based on their requirement.
Operation.name: getSearchSettings
Operation.returnDescription: Returns the search setting values to the client based on input criteria.
Operation.useCase:
Search setting has one of the attributes which is used to configure the category names for which the filters are expanded by default after every search.
Right now these values are configured using preference AWC_Limited_Filter_Categories_Expanded this preference takes <typename>.<property name> as input. For example, user needs to set value as WorkspaceObject.object_type if only object_type filter category needs to be expanded.

When we are giving an option to configure this value from client, we want user to use display names instead of internal names of the type and property to make it more user understandable. Display values in this case will be fetched by this new service.

ParameterInfo.description: Input structure to set the setting names for which the values are required.

ServiceInterface.description:
The Advanced Search service contains operations that expose the SavedQuery functionality in Active Workspace (AW). AW already provides the full text search capability. This functionality provides the advanced search capabilities provided by SavedQuery in Teamcenter
This service supports the following use-cases.
    • Creation of the AdvancedSearch input object for initial input of quick search or advanced query fields
    • Creation of the AdvancedCriteria object to collect user input for Advanced Query Criteria
ServiceInterface.name: AdvancedSearch

This value must match a value of the fnd0ClientName property. For example, if Client A is integrated with Client B and the user can invoke Client B commands from within Client A, the input to getUiConfigs would specify Client A as hosting Client and Client B as the Client. If the caller wanted native commands for Client A, Client A would be specified as Client and hosting Client would be empty.

StructElement.description: The query scope that is used to retrieve the UI configurations. Valid values are Site, Group, Role, User, LoginUser, and AvailableForLoginUser. Site returns the configuration defined for the site. Group returns the configuration defined for a specific Teamcenter Group. Role returns the configuration defined for a specific Teamcenter Role. User returns the configurations defined for a specific Teamcenter User. LoginUser returns the current configuration defined for the current login user. AvailableForLoginUser returns all the configurations available for the current login user. The value for scopeName should be empty when scopeQueryParam is set to: "Site", "LoginUser" or "AvailableForLoginUser".

Struct.description: Return structure containing Gateway information for the current logged in user.
Struct.name: GetUserGatewayXMLsResponse

StructElement.description: Output strings for the user's Site, current GroupMember, and User Gateways. The order of the strings will be the Site Gateways, the GroupMember Gateways and the User Gateway. Preferences will be used to locate the Gateway information. The preference for the Site Gateway is gateway_site. The preference for the GroupMember Gateway is the concatentation of gateway_ and the users current group and role. The preference for the Users Gateway is gateway_ with the user identification appended. At install time a default set of Preferences will be created. The admin can build on that to add more. The users may also set their own Preference for their personal Gateway. One Preference will be gateway_site, this will point to the site Gateway. The other Preferences will be based on the Users properties. There will be Preferences based on the Users GroupMember, one such case is there will be a Preference named gateway_dbaDBA. The Users Gateway Preference will be based on the Users Identification, for example gateway_infodba. For more information, please reference the AWC Deployment Guide.
StructElement.name: fileDatas

StructElement.description: Flag indicating object is pessimistically locked or not. If value is true, then object is locked while startEdit(), else object is not locked in startEdit() operation.
StructElement.name: isPessimisticLock

StructElement.description: The workflow information that the input object needs to submit to a workflow or not.Workflow information is stored in a name and value string map that can contain property name as string and value will be also be string representation. Supported properties are submitToWorkflow, processName, processDescription, processTemplate, processAssignmentList. submitToWorkflow- Boolean Property to define that input object need to submit to workflow process or not. It can contain true or false as value. processName- Process name string. processDescription- Process description string. processTemplate- Name of the process template to be used to create new workflow process. processAssignmentList- Name of the process assignment list to use while creating new workflow process. Note- If the above property submitToWorkflow contains true value and process template value is empty, thenworkflow process template to be used for workflow creation should be specified in the preference (<TypeName>_default_workflow_template) defined for the submitted obejct type.

Struct.description: Initial LOV Data sent to the server during an LOV query.
Struct.name: InitialLovData

StructElement.description: The ListOfValues that is being evaluated;Use this when the lovInput is not possible to construct and need to get the values of specified Lov, otherwise pass as null.
StructElement.name: lov

StructElement.description: This is a container of key-value pairs representing the desired entries for different property fields for different operations (Create, SaveAs, Revise, etc.). It is used for context-based evaluation of the LOV values where the property values are substituted into query criteria. It is also used for interdependent LOV evaluation e.g to evaluate interdependent LOV values at dependent levels given the values at the higher levels that are populated on the lovInput
StructElement.name: lovInput

StructElement.description: The name of the Property for which LOV is being evaluated.
StructElement.name: propertyName

StructElement.description: Filter critieria and other search data.
StructElement.name: filterData

Struct.description: Container of data such as LOV usage, Style, Lov Column Names. Additionally it contains interdependent properties that can be used for optimization by the client
Struct.name: LOVBehaviorData

StructElement.description: Indicates if LOV is exhaustive (=1) or suggestive(=2) or Range (=3)
StructElement.name: lovUsage

StructElement.description: Possible values are Standard, Range, Hierarchical, Interdependent and Coordinated Standard - A simple list of values Interdependent - An interdependent list of values, where each value has a nested list of values. A list of States would have a list of Cities for each State. For this style of LOV the dependentProps will have a list of property names that are associated with each level of the LOV hierarchy Hierarchical - Same as the Interdependent, but only the last level of values is associated with a property Coordinated - This is similar to Interdependent; however levels 2-N will only have a single value. When the user selects a value from the first level LOV, the system can then fill property values for all levels Range - Subset (ranges) of valid values in terms of upper and lower ranges
StructElement.name: style

StructElement.description: Names of the columns when displayed in clients
StructElement.name: columnNames

StructElement.description: This is a list of Boolean values that indicates if the description for each of the column properties is attached
StructElement.name: descriptionsAttached

StructElement.description: Names of interdependent properties. If the LOV is not an interdependent or coordinated LOV, this list will be empty
StructElement.name: dependendProps

StructElement.description: Upper limit for Range LOV. This is not applicable to any other style of LOV
StructElement.name: rangeUpperLimit

StructElement.description: Lower limit for Range LOV. This is not applicable to any other style of LOV
StructElement.name: rangeLowerLimit

Struct.description: Structure containing column names for the LOV value property, LOV description property and the filter attributes
Struct.name: LOVColumnNames

StructElement.description: The attribute on the object to be used as the LOV value. When the user selects a row from the list of values in the dynamic LOV widget (an item for example), this configuration point tells the system which attribute to use as the LOV value. In case of Static LOVs, the name of the property is returned as "lov_value". In case of Dynamic LOVs, it is a name as specified in BMIDE.
StructElement.name: lovValueProp

StructElement.description: The attribute on the object to be used as the LOV value description. When the user selects a row from the list of values in the dynamic LOV widget (an item for example), this configuration point tells the system which attribute to use as the LOV value description. In case of Static LOVs, the name of the property is returned as "lov_value_description". In case of Dynamic LOVs, it is a name as specified in BMIDE. It can be have empty value if it is not specified by BMIDE administrator.
StructElement.name: lovDescrProp

StructElement.description: The filter properties would appear as additional columns along with the LOV Value and LOV description in the Dynamic LOV
StructElement.name: filterProperties

StructElement.description: Displayable names for each of lovValueProp, lovDescrProp, filterProperties that clients can use to display the same
StructElement.name: displayNames

Struct.description: This data structure is not for end user consumption. Data in this structure will be used by server for returning the next set of LOV values
Struct.name: LOVData

StructElement.description: Possible values are Standard, Dynamic, Range, Hierarchical, Interdependent and Coordinated
StructElement.name: style

StructElement.description: Filter critieria and other search data.
StructElement.name: filterData

StructElement.description: These are the list of UIDs that will be processed by the server in subsequent calls to get next set of LOV values
StructElement.name: unProcessedObjects

StructElement.description: Boolean flag to indicate if additional UIDs (Values in static LOV) are skipped or not
StructElement.name: additionalValuesSkipped

StructElement.description: Current index of the LOV results that have been processed.
StructElement.name: currentIndex

StructElement.description: LOVs of Dynamic LOV which is being evaluated
StructElement.name: lovs

Struct.description: Filter Data used in InitialLOVData.
Struct.name: LovFilterData

StructElement.description: The desired string used to filter the search results. For example, if "Green" is entered as a filter string, the results returned for LOV values will include the LOV values that match the query criteria AND contain the string "Green" in the LOV Description or any of the filter attributes. Case sensitive nature is honoured based on TC_ignore_case_on_search preference.
StructElement.name: filterString

StructElement.description: Maximum number of LOV results that server should retrieve from the database
StructElement.name: maxResults

StructElement.description: Number of objects to be processed in case of dynamic LOVs to return LOV values and in other LOV cases it is to return the number of LOV values from the LOV results. This number must be less than or equal to maxResults
StructElement.name: numberToReturn

StructElement.description: Property name on which to sort the results. This is optional
StructElement.name: sortPropertyName

StructElement.description: 1=sort in ascending order, 2=sort in descending order. Ignored if sortPropertyName is null.
StructElement.name: order

Struct.description: This represents the operation data. Operations such as Create, Edit, Revise, Save As, Search or any other operation that requires the data to be passed generically to the LOV service operations have the property values represented through the LOVInput for computing a LOV.
Struct.name: LOVInput

StructElement.description: Owning object for the operation in context. a. Edit operation - Object being edited. b. Save operation - Object being saved. c. Revise operation - Object being revised. d. SaveAs operation - Object being copied. e. Search operation - Saved Query Object for searching. f. If an operation does not have an object, specify the value as null and ensure boName is passed for the same. For example, during creation, client does not have an object. Therefore specify the business object name of the object being created. For example, if Item object is being created, specify the boName as "Item" and operationName as "Create".
StructElement.name: owningObject

StructElement.description: Name of the source business object. For example, Item is the source business object for Item Descriptors. If the owningObject is not null, then it can be empty. Server can determine the business object name from the owningObject. It is mandatory for Create operation where owningObject is null
StructElement.name: boName

StructElement.description: Name of the operation being performed. Valid names are Create, Revise, SaveAs, Edit, Search, Save
StructElement.name: operationName

StructElement.description: A map of property names and values (string, vector<string>). The client is responsible for converting the values of the different property types (int, float, date .etc) to a string using the appropriate toXXXString functions in the SOA client framework's Property class. Single valued properties will have a single value in the value vector, while Multi-valued properties will have multiple values in the value vector.
StructElement.name: propertyValues

Struct.description: This structure contains the LOV results from the getInitialLOVValues or getNextLOVValues operations
Struct.name: LOVSearchResults

StructElement.description: This is a list of LOVValueRow objects. Each LOVValueRow object represents a single row of the LOV results. It includes the LOV value property, the description property and all the filter properties (the filter properties are the ones whose values are used for filtering the search results based on user input)
StructElement.name: lovValues

StructElement.description: true indicates there are more values available which will can be retrieved by a call to the getNextValues operation
StructElement.name: moreValuesExist

StructElement.description: LOV data used to define the UI component behavior. This includes data such as LOV usage, Style, Lov Column Names. Additionally it contains interdependent properties that can be used for optimization by the client
StructElement.name: behaviorData

StructElement.description: If moreValuesExist is true, this object is passed as input to the getNextValues operation to get the next list of LOV search results
StructElement.name: lovData

StructElement.description: The ServiceData
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: This represents a row of LOV values. It includes the internal and display values for the various columns for each LOV value
Struct.name: LOVValueRow

StructElement.description: UID of the object. This applies to dynamic LOVs. Server sends valid UID for dynamic LOV and empty in other LOV cases.. Client can send the same UID when a value is selected to validateLOVValueSelection operation for effective validation. This is empty for for non dynamic LOVs
StructElement.name: uid

StructElement.description: The internal values of all the properties on a single row of the LOV search results. The parseXXX functions in the SOA framework class can be used to retrieve the values for the specific property types
StructElement.name: propInternalValues

StructElement.description: The display values of all the properties on a single row of the LOV search results

StructElement.description: Next level of row values in case of hierarchical LOV. This is recursive and can go down multiple levels in the hierarchy

Struct.description: A structure containing input to retrieve group membership information.
Struct.name: GroupMembershipInput2

StructElement.description: The string specifies the user_id to search for within the organization. An example is: User wants to search for GroupMember objects which have a User with user_id equal to this input. Partial string supported. This is an optional input.
StructElement.name: userId

StructElement.description: The string specifies the user_name to search for within the organization. An example is: User wants to search for GroupMember objects which have a User with user_name equal to this input. Partial string supported. This is an optional input.
StructElement.name: userName

StructElement.description: The string specifies the Group name to search within the organization. An example is: User wants to search for GroupMember objects which have a Group with name equal to this input. Partial string supported. This is an optional input.
StructElement.name: groupName

StructElement.description: The string specifies the Role name to search within the organization. An example is: User wants to search for GroupMember objects which have a Role with role_name equal to this input. Partial string supported. This is an optional input.
StructElement.name: roleName

StructElement.description: A flag input to specify whether to search for sub-group of given group in groupName input. If the groupName is empty or contains wild card( "*" ), then this input will be ignored. This is an optional input.
StructElement.name: searchForSubGroup

StructElement.description:
This input is used for pagination. User can specify the the start index of the next chunk of objects to return. An example of this input is: This operation finds 100 GroupMember objects. User want to get first 50 searched objects. So here the startIndex would be 0. For next chunk of searched objects this input would be 51.
Note: Value for this input should be a positive integer. If the value is negative number then it is considered as 0.
StructElement.name: startIndex

StructElement.description:
This input is used for pagination. This input specifies the maximum number of found objects to return.
Note: Value for this input should be a positive integer. If the value is 0 or negative number then this input will be ignored and all the found objects will be returned.
StructElement.name: maxToReturn

StructElement.description:
This input is used for pagination. This input specifies the maximum number of found objects to load.
Note: Value for this input should be a positive integer. If the value is 0 or negative number then this input will be ignored and all the found objects will be loaded.
StructElement.name: maxToLoad

Struct.description: Input for the getStyleSheet operation.
Struct.name: GetStyleSheetIn

StructElement.description: The page in the XRT stylesheet to process. This field is ignored if the parameter processEntireXRT is set to true. This value may be an empty string which would cause the server to process the first page in the XRT, or it may be a titleKey for a page in the XRT, for example web_xrt_Overview. If the target page is not found, then the first page in the XRT is processed.
StructElement.name: targetPage

StructElement.description: The businessObject for which to retrieve a stylesheet. This field may be NULL. Typically it would only be NULL in the case of CREATE.
StructElement.name: businessObject

StructElement.description: The Teamcenter data type for which to retrieve a stylesheet, if the businessObject parameter is NULL, then this field must be populated, otherwise it is ignored.
StructElement.name: businessObjectType

StructElement.description: The type of stylesheet to return. Legal values are: SUMMARY, CREATE, RENDERING, or INFO.
StructElement.name: styleSheetType

StructElement.description: The last save date of the stylesheet.
StructElement.name: styleSheetLastModDate

StructElement.description:
The map of client context key value entries, where the key is the client and the location in the client, and the value is the unique id for the data being presented in that panel. These values are used to process visibleWhen clasuses in the XRT, pages may be enabled or disabled based on where it is being presented in the client.

For example valid entries for active workspace may be:
Key: ActiveWorkspace:Location
Value: com.siemens.splm.client.search.SearchLocation

Or

Key: ActiveWorkspace:SubLocation
Value: com.siemens.splm.client.search:SavedSearchSubLocation
StructElement.name: clientContext

Struct.description: Output from getStyleSheet operation.
Struct.name: GetStyleSheetOutput

StructElement.description: The name of the page that was processed. If the operation was invoked with processEntireXRT set to true, the this field is empty. If the operation was invoked with processEntireXRT set to false, this this field is populated with the page that was processed. Typically the value of the processedPage would be the same as the targetPage, except when the targetPage value is empty or not found in the stylesheet. In that case, then the first page in the stylesheet is processed.
StructElement.name: processedPage

StructElement.description: The information about the stylesheet.
StructElement.name: datasetInfo

StructElement.name: visiblePages

Struct.description: Input structure for createFullTextSavedSearch service operation.
Struct.name: Awp0FullTextSavedSearchInputObject

StructElement.description:
Should the saved search object be pinned? Supported values are:
-1 = Do no pin or unpin the saved search.
0 = Unpin the saved search
1 = Pin the saved search
StructElement.name: pinSearch

StructElement.description:
Should client receive notification if saved-search result changes? Supported values are:
-1 = Do no set or remove notification for the saved search.
0 = Remove notification.
1 = Set notification.
StructElement.name: receiveNotification

StructElement.description:
Should the saved search be available to all users? The awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object indicates if the search is shared or not.
-1 = Do not change the value of set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object.
0 = set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object to false
1 = set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object to true
StructElement.name: shareSavedSearch

StructElement.description: The saved search name. Alphanumeric and special characters are allowed.
StructElement.name: savedSearchName

StructElement.description: The search string. Alphanumeric and special characters are allowed.
StructElement.name: searchString

StructElement.description: A map of category internal names and list of filters in each category. (string/list of SearchFilter).
StructElement.name: searchFilterMap

StructElement.description: If false and if a Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object already exists for the user having same name, then this operation should return a partial error. If true and if a Awp0FullTextSavedsearch object already exists for the user having same name then this operation deletes the existing.
StructElement.name: override

Struct.description: Input structure for modifySavedSearchProperties service operation.
Struct.name: Awp0FullTextSavedSearchInputObject2

StructElement.description:
Should the saved-search object be pinned? Supported values are:
-1 = Do not pin or unpin the saved-search
0 = Unpin the saved-search
1 = Pin the saved-search
StructElement.name: pinSearch

StructElement.description:
Should user receive notification if saved-search results change? Supported values are:
-1 = Do not remove or set notification
0 = Remove notification
1 = Set Notification
StructElement.name: receiveNotification

StructElement.description:
Should the saved search be available to all users. The awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object indicates if the search is shared or not.
-1 = Do not change the value of set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object.
0 = set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object to false
1 = set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object to true
StructElement.name: shareSavedSearch
