Struct.description: This structure contains information for a column configuration within a client scope URI. It contains a unique column config id, a list of column definition information, and the operation type used to finalize the columns.
Struct.name: ColumnConfig

StructElement.description: The unique identifier of the column configuration.
StructElement.name: columnConfigId

StructElement.description:
The operation that was used to finalize the columns to be returned back.
Supported values are:
"Intersection", "Union" and "Configured".
StructElement.name: operationType

StructElement.description: List of column details.
StructElement.name: columns

Struct.description: Contains input information required to retrieve UI column configurations from the Teamcenter database.
Struct.name: ColumnConfigInput

StructElement.description:
The name of a client application, as represented by an instance of Fnd0Client in the Teamcenter database. This value must match the value of fnd0ClientName property.
For example: The client name for Active Workspace is "AWClient".
StructElement.name: clientName

StructElement.description:
Specifies the name of a hosting client application, as represented by an instance of Fnd0Client, in the Teamcenter databases. This value must match a value of the fnd0ClientName property.

For example: If client A is integrated with client B and the user can invoke client B commands from within client A, the input to getUiConfigs would specify client A as hosting client and client B as the client. If the caller wanted native commands for client A, client A would be specified as client and hosting client would be empty.
StructElement.name: hostingClientName

StructElement.description:
The unique name of the client scope containing column configurations.
For example: "Awp0SearchResults" is the client scope URI for search location.
StructElement.name: clientScopeURI

StructElement.description:
The operation that needs to be applied to finalize the columns to be returned back.
Valid values are:
"Intersection" - Gets the intersection of the columns for the types found in search results.
"Union" - Gets all the columns for the types found in search results.
"Configured" - Gets all the columns defined for requested scope irrespective of types passed in. If it does not find any configuration at the specified scope it will search up in the order of scopes User, Role, Group and Site. No need to pass type names if need to fetch all columns.
StructElement.name: operationType

StructElement.description:
List of columns which should be excluded from the final list being returned. The value provided should be in the format "TypeName.PropertyName". Both type name and property name should be internal values.
For example: ItemRevision.sequence_id, where '.' is the delimiter
StructElement.name: columnsToExclude

Struct.description: Contains details about a specific column. This includes the type of object for which the column is applicable, the name of the property displayed in the column, a flag indicating if the column should be used to order information displayed in the client, pixel width of the column, a flag indicating if the column should be hidden and the column sort order.
Struct.name: ColumnDefInfo

StructElement.description: The business object type for the value displayed in the column. This can be any valid Teamcenter business object type.
StructElement.name: typeName

StructElement.description: The property name for the value displayed in the column.
StructElement.name: propertyName

StructElement.description: The pixel width for the column. Valid pixel widths are integer values between 1 and 500.
StructElement.name: pixelWidth

StructElement.description: The column order value is used to arrange the columns in order.
StructElement.name: columnOrder

StructElement.description: If true, the column should be hidden on the client user interface.
StructElement.name: hiddenFlag

StructElement.description:
Sort priority set on column helps identify the order in which the columns should be used during sort.
Sort priority value will be zero for columns not marked for sorting.
StructElement.name: sortPriority

StructElement.description: How the columns are sorted. Supported values are: "Ascending" and "Descending". This value will be empty if the column is not marked for sorting.
StructElement.name: sortDirection

Struct.description: Holds the classification properties details returned by the getClassificationProps() operation.
Struct.name: GetClassificationPropsResponse

StructElement.description: A map (string, ClsObjectDetails )of WorkspaceObject UID and the classification object details.
StructElement.name: wsoClsPropDetailsMap

StructElement.description: A map (int, ClsAttrDetails) of Classification attributes ID and its corresponding metadata.
StructElement.name: clsAttrDetailsMap

StructElement.description: The Service Data.
StructElement.name: svcData

Typedef.description: A map containing a list of propertyGroupID for each BusinessObject. For multi-valued properties, a single business object may be associated with multiple property group IDs.
Typedef.name: ObjectPropertyGroupingMap

Struct.description: A structure containing an internal property name and a map of objects to the property group id. It also contains a list of unmatched objects which don't match any group.
Struct.name: ObjectsGroupedByProperty

StructElement.description: The internal name of the property used for grouping.
StructElement.name: internalPropertyName

StructElement.description: Map (BusinessObject, list of string) of business object and its associated grouping.
StructElement.name: groupedObjectsMap

StructElement.description: List of unmatched business objects.
StructElement.name: unmatchedObjectList

Struct.description: This structure contains column configuration details and a list of column definitions information.
Struct.name: SaveColumnConfigData

StructElement.description:
The scope value is used to apply the UI configurations for that scope. Supported values are :
"LoginUser" - Returns the current configuration defined for the current login user.
Note: Other scope values "Site", "Group" and "Role" are not supported.
StructElement.name: scope

StructElement.description:
The name of a valid Teamcenter scope.
For example "Group" scope, scopeName can be "dba","Engineering".
For "LoginUser" scope, this value should be empty.
StructElement.name: scopeName

StructElement.description:
The unique name of the client scope containing configurations.
Supported values are:
"Awp0SearchResults" for global search
"fnd0Inbox" for inbox
"fnd0alltasks" for all inbox tasks
"fnd0mytasks" for my inbox tasks
"fnd0surrogatescope" for surrogate inbox tasks
"Fnd0Report" for report
"Awp0ObjectNavigation" for object navigation
"Awp0AdvancedSearch" for advanced search
StructElement.name: clientScopeURI

StructElement.description:
The unique identifier for the column configuration.
Ex: "searchResultsColConfig" for search location.
StructElement.name: columnConfigId

StructElement.description: Ordered list of column information.
StructElement.name: columns

Struct.description: A structure representing a string, date or numeric type of search filter.
Struct.name: SearchFilter

StructElement.description: The type of search filter. Supported values are "StringFilter", "DateFilter", "NumericFilter".
StructElement.name: searchFilterType

StructElement.description: The value for a string filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "StringFilter".
StructElement.name: stringValue

StructElement.description: The display value for a string filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "StringFilter".
StructElement.name: stringDisplayValue

StructElement.description: The starting value for a date filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "DateFilter"
StructElement.name: startDateValue

StructElement.description: The ending value for a date filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "DateFilter"
StructElement.name: endDateValue

StructElement.description: The starting value for a numeric filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "NumericFilter".
StructElement.name: startNumericValue

StructElement.description: The ending value for a numeric filter. This field is applicable only if the searchFilterType is set to "NumericFilter".
StructElement.name: endNumericValue

StructElement.description: The number of values in the filter. This field is populated on the service response and is ignored on the service input.
StructElement.name: count

StructElement.description: A flag that indicates if the filter was previously selected and used to filter the results.
StructElement.name: selected

StructElement.description:
The interval used to generate a range facets. E.g for Date range facets, +1DAY, +1WEEK, +1MONTH , +1YEAR are acceptable values.
Note: Currently this value is not being used. This is added for future.
StructElement.name: startEndRange

Struct.description: A structure containing details about a search filter field.
Struct.name: SearchFilterField

StructElement.description: The internal name for the search filter field.
StructElement.name: internalName

StructElement.description: The display name for the search filter field.
StructElement.name: displayName

StructElement.description: The default number of search filter values to display within the search filter field.
StructElement.name: defaultFilterValueDisplayCount

Typedef.description: A map containing a list of search filters for each search filter field.
Typedef.name: SearchFilterMap

Struct.description: A structure containing input search criteria.
Struct.name: SearchInput

StructElement.description: The name of the search provider. This is the RuntimeBusinessObject type name.
StructElement.name: providerName

StructElement.description:
A map (string, string) used to perform the search.
For full text search, the key is "searchString", the value is "*".
For advanced search, the key can be
"queryID" ,
"quickSearchAttributeValue",
"searchID",
"typeOfSearch", "QUICK_SEARCH" or "ADVANCED_SEARCH", the value is unique identifier.
StructElement.name: searchCriteria

StructElement.description: The start index to return the search results.
StructElement.name: startIndex

StructElement.description: The maximum number of search results to return.If zero, no search results are returned; however, other information such as total results found and filters details are returned.
StructElement.name: maxToReturn

StructElement.description: The maximum number of search results to load.
StructElement.name: maxToLoad

StructElement.description: A map (string, list of SearchFilter) containing the list of search filters for each search filter field. The key in the map is the property name that represents the filter category. It is in the format "TypeName.PropertyName". e.g WorkspaceObject.object_type, the value in the map is the value of the search filter.
StructElement.name: searchFilterMap

StructElement.description: The criteria to use to sort the results.
StructElement.name: searchSortCriteria

StructElement.description: The sorting type to use to order the search filter categories in the response. Supported values are: "Alphabetical","Priority".
StructElement.name: searchFilterFieldSortType

StructElement.description: A list of attributes to inflate (extract the details).
StructElement.name: attributesToInflate

StructElement.description: The internal name of the property used for grouping.
StructElement.name: internalPropertyName

Struct.description: A service response structure containing search results and column configurations.
Struct.name: SearchResponse

StructElement.description: List of business objects obtained after performing a search.
StructElement.name: searchResults

StructElement.description: Total number of business objects found.
StructElement.name: totalFound

StructElement.description: Total number of business objects loaded.
StructElement.name: totalLoaded

StructElement.description: A map (string, list of SearchFilter) containing the list of search filters for each search filter field based on the search results.
StructElement.name: searchFilterMap

StructElement.description: A list of search filter categories ordered by filter priority.
StructElement.name: searchFilterCategories

StructElement.description: The default number of search filter categories to display.
StructElement.name: defaultFilterFieldDisplayCount

StructElement.description: The structure containing an internal property name and a map of objects to the property group id. It also contains a list of unmatched objects which do not match any group.
StructElement.name: objectsGroupedByProperty

StructElement.description: Effective column configuration for the client scope URI.
StructElement.name: columnConfig

StructElement.description: The service data object.
StructElement.name: serviceData

StructElement.description: Cursor end position for the results returned so far.
StructElement.name: endIndex

Struct.description: The criteria to use to sort the results.
Struct.name: SearchSortCriteria

StructElement.description: The name of the field on which to perform the sorting.
StructElement.name: fieldName

StructElement.description: The direction in which the sorting needs to be performed - 'ASC' or 'DESC'.
StructElement.name: sortDirection

MetaEnum.description: An enumeration indicating whether the sorting needs to be performed in ascending or descending order.
MetaEnum.name: SortDirection

Typedef.description: Map from string to string.
Typedef.name: StringMap

Typedef.description:
The map of workspace object(WSO) to its classification properties.

    • Primary key : Reference of the classified workspace object(WorkspaceObject) that was used to get the classification properties.
    • Values : Details of classification object references associated with the classified workspace object(WorkspaceObject) referenced in the primary key.
Typedef.name: WsoClsPropDetailsMap

Struct.description: This structure contains information for a column configuration within a client scope URI. It contains a unique column config id, a list of column definition information, and the operation type used to finalize the columns.
Struct.name: ColumnConfig

StructElement.description: The unique identifier of the column configuration.
StructElement.name: columnConfigId

StructElement.description:
The operation that was used to finalize the columns to be returned back.
Valid values are:
"Intersection", "Union" and "Configured"
StructElement.name: operationType

StructElement.description: Ordered list of column details. The columns will be listed in ascending order of priority.
StructElement.name: columns

Struct.description: This structure returns information about the column configuration definitions for a scope, hosting client and client scope.
Struct.name: ColumnConfigData

StructElement.description: The scope that is used to retrieve the UI configurations.
StructElement.name: scope

StructElement.description: The scope name for which the column data is applicable.
StructElement.name: scopeName

StructElement.description: The name of hosting client for which the list of column configurations is applicable. This value must correspond to the value of the property fnd0ClientName for an Fnd0Client object in the Teamcenter database.
StructElement.name: hostingClient

StructElement.description: The client scope for which the list of column configurations is applicable. This must match a value of fnd0ClientScopeURI which is the unique identifier of a client scope (Fnd0ClientScope).
StructElement.name: clientScopeURI

StructElement.description: List of column configuration details.
StructElement.name: columnConfigurations

Struct.description: This structure contains the client scope URI to be used and query for its associated column configurations. The type names and operation type are used to identify the final list of columns to be returned back.
Struct.name: ColumnConfigQueryInfo

StructElement.description:
The unique name of the client scope containing column configurations.
Ex: "Awp0SearchResults" for global search.
StructElement.name: clientScopeURI

StructElement.description:
The operation that needs to be applied to finalize the columns to be returned back.
Valid values are:
"Intersection" - Gets the intersection of the columns for the types passed in.
"Union" - Gets all the columns of the types passed in.
"Configured" - Gets all the columns defined for requested scope irrespective of types passed in. If it does not find any configuration at the specified scope it will search up in the order of scopes User, Role, Group and then Site. No need to pass type names if need to fetch all configured columns.
StructElement.name: operationType

StructElement.description: List of type names(internal names) for which the columns needs to be fetched. In search case these will the type names of the results found.
StructElement.name: typeNames

StructElement.description:
List of columns which should be excluded from the final list being returned. The value provided should be in the format "typeName.propertyName" . Both type name and property name should be internal values.
Ex: ItemRevision.sequence_id , where '.' Is the delimiter
StructElement.name: columnsToExclude

Struct.description: Contains details about a specific column. This includes the type of object for which the column is applicable, the name of the property displayed in the column, a flag indicating if the column should be used to order information displayed in the client, pixel width of the column, a flag indicating if the column should be hidden and the column sort priority and direction.
Struct.name: ColumnDefInfo

StructElement.description: The business object type for the value displayed in the column.
StructElement.name: typeName

StructElement.description: The name of the property corresponding to the values displayed in the column.
StructElement.name: propertyName

StructElement.description: The pixel width for the column. Valid pixel widths are integer values between 1 and 500.
StructElement.name: pixelWidth

StructElement.description: The column order value is used to arrange the columns in order.
StructElement.name: columnOrder

StructElement.description: True if the column should be hidden on the client user interface.
StructElement.name: hiddenFlag

StructElement.description: Sort priority set on column helps identify the order in which the columns should be used during sort. Sort priority value will be zero for columns not marked for sorting.
StructElement.name: sortPriority

StructElement.description: How the columns are sorted. Valid values are: "Ascending" and "Descending". This value will be empty if the column is not marked for sorting.
StructElement.name: sortDirection

Struct.description: This structure contains the command context name and value
Struct.name: CommandContextInfo

StructElement.description: Context Name which is to be used to evaluate visibility of the command
StructElement.name: contextName

StructElement.description: Context value that forms a valid pair with the contextName.
StructElement.name: contextValue

Struct.description: This structure contains the Ids of command and command collection that are visible for the indicated client.
Struct.name: CommandInfo

StructElement.description: The command collection Id.
StructElement.name: commandCollectionId

StructElement.description: The command Id.
StructElement.name: commandId

Struct.description: Contains input information required to retrieve or reset UI column configurations from the Teamcenter database.
Struct.name: GetOrResetUIColumnConfigInput

StructElement.description:
The scope value is used to apply the UI configurations for that scope. The valid values are :
"Site" - Returns the configuration defined for the site.
"Group" - Returns the configuration defined for a specific Teamcenter Group.
"Role" - Returns the configuration defined for a specific Teamcenter Role.
"User" - Returns the configurations defined for a specific Teamcenter User.
"LoginUser" - Returns the configurations defined for the current login user.
StructElement.name: scope

StructElement.description:
The name of a valid Teamcenter scope. Valid scopes are "Site", "Group", "Role", "User", "LoginUser". ScopeName should be empty when scope is set for "Site" or "LoginUser". For other scopes use as follows

User - User name as per the user's profile
Group - Valid group defined in Organization
Role - Valid role defined in Organization
StructElement.name: scopeName

StructElement.description:
The name of a client application, as represented by an instance of Fnd0Client in the Teamcenter database. This value must match the value of fnd0ClientName property.

Ex: The client name for Active Workspace is "AWClient".
StructElement.name: clientName

StructElement.description:
Specifies the name of a hosting client application, as represented by an instance of Fnd0Client, in the Teamcenter databases. This value must match a value of the fnd0ClientName property.

For example, if client A is integrated with client B and the user can invoke client B commands from within client A, the input to getUiConfigs would specify client A as hosting client and client B as the client. If the caller wanted native commands for client A, client A would be specified as client and hosting client would be empty.
StructElement.name: hostingClientName

StructElement.description: If True, it will reset the column configurations at the "LoginUser" scope. Reset action is valid only for "LoginUser" scope.
StructElement.name: resetColumnConfig

StructElement.description: List of column config query information. This has the client scope URI, type names and operation type to be used and query for the valid columns.
StructElement.name: columnConfigQueryInfos

StructElement.description: List of business objects for which the additional properties found as new columns need to be loaded.
StructElement.name: businessObjects

Struct.description: This structure returns information to the client about column configurations. The ServiceData contains information about errors encountered during processing.
Struct.name: GetOrResetUIColumnConfigResponse

StructElement.description: The client for which the configurations are applicable.
StructElement.name: clientName

StructElement.description: List of column configurations data.
StructElement.name: columnConfigurations

StructElement.description: ServiceData structure containing errors and command, command collection and icon objects. If there is an error retrieving the configuration information, the error added to the ServiceData as a partial error.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: Contains input information required to retrieve the commands that are visible from the Teamcenter database.
Struct.name: GetVisibleCommandsInfo

StructElement.description: The client scope URI represents location.sublocation in Active Workspace. For example, Fnd0ClientScope::fnd0ClientScopeURI. If empty, the UI Configuration for all client scopes are returned.
StructElement.name: clientScopeURI

StructElement.description: List of objects selected by the user in the client.
StructElement.name: selectionInfo

StructElement.description: List of commands.
StructElement.name: commandInfo

StructElement.description: List of command context name value pairs, for example: "isHosted"="true", "productContext"=productContextUid
StructElement.name: commandContextInfo

Struct.description: This structure returns information to the client about the commands that are visible. The ServiceData contains information about errors encountered during processing.
Struct.name: GetVisibleCommandsResponse

StructElement.description: ServiceData structure containing errors and command, command collection and icon objects. If there is an error retrieving the configuration information, the error added to the ServiceData as a partial error.
StructElement.name: serviceData

StructElement.description: List of visible commands.
StructElement.name: visibleCommandsInfo

Struct.description: This structure contains column configuration details and a list of column definition information.
Struct.name: SaveColumnConfigData

StructElement.description:
The scope value is used to apply the UI configurations for that scope.
The Valid values are :
"LoginUser" - Returns the current configuration defined for the current login user.
"scopeName" should be empty when scope is set for LoginUser.
Note: Other scope values "Site", "Group" and "Role" are not supported.
StructElement.name: scope

StructElement.description:
The name of a valid Teamcneter scope. For "Site" and "LoginUser" scope, this value should be empty.
Note: Added this for future. To be used when code starts supporting saving of column configurations for "Site", "Group" and "Role" scopes.
StructElement.name: scopeName

StructElement.description: The unique name of the client scope containing configurations.
StructElement.name: clientScopeURI

StructElement.description: The unique identifier for the column configuration.
StructElement.name: columnConfigId

StructElement.description: Ordered list of column information.
StructElement.name: columns

Struct.description: This structure contains the list of objects selected by the user in the client.
Struct.name: SelectionInfo

StructElement.description: The objects selected by the user in the client.
StructElement.name: selectedObjects

StructElement.description: Parent selection for the object. For example, for cut operation, it is the selected parent object.
StructElement.name: parentSelectionIndex

StructElement.description: Optional context name, for example, for cut operation, it is the relation name between parent object and child object.
StructElement.name: contextName

Struct.description: Structure containing list of rows on which all proposed property values are populated. This information can be used finally to create a row to the table property.
Struct.name: GetInitialTableRowDataResponse

StructElement.description: List of property information which will have property values pre-populated.
StructElement.name: tableRows

Struct.description: Input for the getStyleSheet operation.
Struct.name: GetStyleSheetIn

StructElement.description: The page in the XRT stylesheet to process. This field is ignored if the parameter processEntireXRT is set to true. This value may be an empty string which would cause the server to process the first page in the XRT, or it may be a titleKey for a page in the XRT, for example web_xrt_Overview. If the target page is not found, then the first page in the XRT is processed.
StructElement.name: targetPage

StructElement.description: The businessObject for which to retrieve a stylesheet. This field may be NULL. Typically it would only be NULL in the case of CREATE.
StructElement.name: businessObject

StructElement.description: The Teamcenter data type for which to retrieve a stylesheet, if the businessObject parameter is NULL, then this field must be populated, otherwise it is ignored.
StructElement.name: businessObjectType

StructElement.description: The type of stylesheet to return. Legal values are: SUMMARY, CREATE, RENDERING, or INFO.
StructElement.name: styleSheetType

StructElement.description: The last save date of the stylesheet.
StructElement.name: styleSheetLastModDate

StructElement.description:
The map of client context key value entries, where the key is the client and the location in the client, and the value is the unique id for the data being presented in that panel. These values are used to process visibleWhen clasuses in the XRT, pages may be enabled or disabled based on where it is being presented in the client. If the isRedLineMode key value is true and source object is of type ItemRevision then it is compared against configured revision. If configured revision is not found then source object is compared to previous revision.

For example valid entries for active workspace may be:
Key: ActiveWorkspace:Location
Value: com.siemens.splm.client.search.SearchLocation

Or

Key: ActiveWorkspace:SubLocation
Value: com.siemens.splm.client.search:SavedSearchSubLocation


Or

Key: isRedLineMode
Value: true or false
StructElement.name: clientContext

Struct.description: Output from getStyleSheet operation.
Struct.name: GetStyleSheetOutput

StructElement.description: The name of the page that was processed. If the operation was invoked with processEntireXRT set to true, the this field is empty. If the operation was invoked with processEntireXRT set to false, this this field is populated with the page that was processed. Typically the value of the processedPage would be the same as the targetPage, except when the targetPage value is empty or not found in the stylesheet. In that case, then the first page in the stylesheet is processed.
StructElement.name: processedPage

StructElement.description: The information about the stylesheet.
StructElement.name: datasetInfo

StructElement.description: A Map (string/Teamcenter::Awp0XRTObjectSet) where key is the source field from the stylesheet and the value is the data to present inside that objectSet in the application.
StructElement.name: objectSetMap

StructElement.description: A map(string/vector of POM_object) where key is the name of the table property and the value is a vector of Table Row objects which represents the table row data for that property.
StructElement.name: tablePropObjectMap

StructElement.description: Map (string/string) where the key is the text, title, or titleKey string from the stylesheet and the value is the localized string.
StructElement.name: localeMap

StructElement.description: Map (BusinessObject/string) where the key is the business object to render, and the value is the thumbnail ticket for the image to download.
StructElement.name: jtFileMap

StructElement.description: The visible pages in the XRT. Each index in the array indicates whether that page can be displayed.
StructElement.name: visiblePages

StructElement.description: The classification data for the object to be rendered.
StructElement.name: classificationData

StructElement.description: The object to render. It could be the input object itself in the case of viewing a stylesheet, or the revise descriptor object in the case of the revise operation.
StructElement.name: objectToRender

StructElement.description: Map containing the patterns used for auto-assignable properties. The key is the property name, and the value is the patterns to use. Only auto assignable properties exist in the map.
StructElement.name: patternMap

Struct.description: Response sent to client from the getStyleSheet operation.
Struct.name: GetStyleSheetResponse

StructElement.description: The vector of output information. One for each input object.
StructElement.name: output

StructElement.description: The SOA service data.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: Structure represents the parameters required to save the edits on the input objects and submit them to a workflow process.
Struct.name: LoadDataForEditingInfo

StructElement.description: Input object
StructElement.name: obj

StructElement.description: Property names
StructElement.name: propertyNames

StructElement.description: If true, the object needs to be checked out before making any edits (pessimistic locking). The locking of object is done during loadDataForEditing() call.If false, the operation takes optimistic lock on the object. In optimistic locking the object is locked (based on object last set date “lsd” property) before performing the actual save and lock is released after save is complete.
StructElement.name: isPessimisticLock

Struct.description: Output structure of LoadDataForEditing operation
Struct.name: LoadDataForEditingOutput

StructElement.description: Object to start edit or its dependent objects
StructElement.name: obj

StructElement.description: List of last save date of object or dependent objects.
StructElement.name: objLsds

StructElement.description: A map(string/list of POM_object) where key is the name of the table property and the value is a vector of Table Row objects which represents the table row data for that property.
StructElement.name: tableProperties

Struct.description: Response of LoadDataForEditing SOA
Struct.name: LoadDataForEditingResponse

StructElement.description: A list of LoadDataForEditingOutput strutures which provide information about the editable status of the properties passed in the input. This information can be used by client to show which properties as editable.
StructElement.name: outputs

StructElement.description:
Partial errors are returned in the Service Data. The following partial errors may be returned:

302021: The input object is not modifiable.
302022: The property is not modifiable.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Typedef.description: Maps the object set source in the xml rendering style sheet to the business objects.
Typedef.name: ObjectSetMap4

Struct.description: Structure defining Pattern information.
Struct.name: PatternInfo

StructElement.description: List of naming rule patterns.
StructElement.name: patterns

StructElement.description: The preferred pattern to use.
StructElement.name: preferredPattern

StructElement.description: The condition value.
StructElement.name: condition

Typedef.description: Map of string to vector of strings. This map is used to return the auto assignable property name patterns to the client. The key is the property name and the value is the list of patterns.
Typedef.name: PatternMap

Struct.description:
Input Structure containing information about what properties are to be populated.
For normal (non-Table )Properties, user has to populate values.
For Table Properties, user has to fill the rowValues structure
Struct.name: PropertyNameValue

StructElement.description: Property name string that needs to be modified.
StructElement.name: name

StructElement.description: Property values string vector that will be used to update the input object with corresponding values. This vector contains string representation of the property value. The calling client is responsible for converting the different property types (int, float, date .etc) to a string using the appropriate toXXXString functions in the SOA client framework's Property class.
StructElement.name: values

StructElement.description: A list to hold child object structures. Child structure will be populated in case the property contains a collection of sub objects. E.g. table properties. For other properties, the list needs to be empty.
StructElement.name: rowValues

Typedef.description: Map (string, vector) that is a generic container that represents property values. The key is the property name and the value is the string representation of the property value.
Typedef.name: PropertyValues1

Struct.description:
A structure to hold child information associated with the main object.
It contains uid of the child, and its name value pairs for different properties.
Struct.name: RowDataStruct

StructElement.description: UID for the child object. If the UID is blank / NULL UID, a new object is created with details as populated in nameValues.
StructElement.name: uid

StructElement.description: List of structure containing Information which needs to be saved. If UID is not blank then the properties populated in this structure will be updated. If UID is blank, then a new child object is created based on the name values input.
StructElement.name: nameValues

Struct.description: Structure represents the parameters required to save the edits on the input objects and submit them to a workflow process.
Struct.name: SaveEditAndSubmitInfo

StructElement.description: Object to save edit and submit to a workflow process.
StructElement.name: object

StructElement.description: Property name and values structure that will contain all property names and corresponding values that needs to be saved.
StructElement.name: propertyNameValues

StructElement.description: The last set date information for the object.
StructElement.name: objLsds

StructElement.description:
The flag to control whether this method call performs optimistic locking or not.
A false value means the operation takes optimistic lock on the object. In optimistic locking the object is locked (based on the object last saved date) before performing the actual save and lock is released after save is complete.
A true value means the object needs to be checked out before making any edits (pessimistic locking). The locking of object is done during loadDataForEditing operation.
StructElement.name: isPessimisticLock

StructElement.description:
The workflow information that the input object needs to submit to a workflow. Workflow information is stored in a name and value string map (string/list of strings). If workflowData map is empty, objects will not be submitted to any workflow.
Supported keys:

• submitToWorkflow: Boolean Property to define that input object need to submit to workflow process or not. It can contain true or false as value.
• processName: Process name string.
• processDescription: Process description string.
• processTemplate: Name of the process template to be used to create new workflow process.
• processAssignmentList: Name of the process assignment list to use while creating new workflow process.

If property submitToWorkflow value is true and processTemplate value is empty, then workflow process template to be used for workflow creation should be specified in the preference (<TypeName>_default_workflow_template) defined for the submitted object type.
StructElement.name: workflowData

Typedef.description: String map.
Typedef.name: StringMap5

Typedef.description: Maps the table property in the xml rendering style sheet to the Table Row objects.
Typedef.name: TablePropObjectMap

Struct.description: Structure containing pre-filled values of row information. The values can then be modified, and a subsequent SOA call to Save operation (saveEdits() SOA) will persist the row object in database.
Struct.name: TableRow

StructElement.description: The business object type name of the table row. This can be Fnd0TableRow or any subtype.
StructElement.name: tableRowTypeName

StructElement.description: A list of property values, where name is the column name (sub property name) of the table property. “dbValues” and “uiValues” are the list of database value and list of display values respectively.
StructElement.name: tableRowData

Struct.description: Structure containing pre-populated property values for columns of the row object.
Struct.name: TableRowProperty

StructElement.description: The name of the property. Caller can look up the property descriptor to get metadata about the property.
StructElement.name: name

Struct.description: This structure hold property name and list of property values. This is a generic container that contains the property name as string and the value is the string representation of the property value.
Struct.name: NameValue

StructElement.description: Property name string that needs to be modified.
StructElement.name: name

StructElement.description: A list of property values that will be used to update the input object with corresponding values. This list contains string representation of property value. The calling client is responsible for converting the different property types (int, float, date .etc) to a string using the appropriate to XXXString functions in the SOA client framework's Property class.
StructElement.name: values

Struct.description:
Input Structure containing information about what properties are to be populated.
For normal (non-Table )Properties, user has to populate values.
For Table Properties, user has to fill the rowValues structure
Struct.name: PropertyNameValue

StructElement.description: Property name that needs to be modified.
StructElement.name: name

StructElement.description: Property values to update object with. This list contains string representation of the property value. The calling client is responsible for converting the different property types (int, float, date .etc) to a string using the appropriate toXXXString functions in the SOA client framework's Property class.
StructElement.name: values

StructElement.description: A list of child object structures. Child structures are populated in case the property contains a collection of sub objects. E.g. table properties. For other properties, the list needs to be empty.
StructElement.name: rowValues

Typedef.description: Map (string, list of strings) that is a generic container that represents property values. The key is the property name and the value is the string representation of the property value.
Typedef.name: PropertyValues2

Struct.description:
A structure to hold child information associated with the main object.
It contains uid of the child, NameValue type of row and its name value pairs for different properties.
Struct.name: RowData

StructElement.description: The child object UID. If the UID is empty or a NULL UID, a new object is created with details as populated in nameValues.
StructElement.name: uid

StructElement.description:
The subtype of Fnd0NameValue business object. Valid value can only be one from below mentioned list of values :
Fnd0NameValueDate,
Fnd0NameValueDouble,
Fnd0NameValueInt,
Fnd0NameValueLogical,
Fnd0NameValueString.
StructElement.name: rowType

StructElement.description: List of named property values to be saved. If UID is not blank then the properties populated in this structure will be updated. If UID is blank, then a new child object is created based on the name values input.
StructElement.name: nameValues

Struct.description: Structure represents the parameters required to save the edits on the input objects and submit them to a workflow process.
Struct.name: SaveEditAndSubmitInfo

StructElement.description: Teamcenter object (POM_object) to save edit and submit to a workflow process.
StructElement.name: tcobject

StructElement.description: Property name and values structure that will contain all property names and corresponding values that needs to be saved.
StructElement.name: propertyNameValues

StructElement.description: The last set date information for the object.
StructElement.name: objLsds

StructElement.description:
The flag to control whether this method call performs optimistic locking or not.
If false, operation takes optimistic lock on the object. In optimistic locking the object is locked (based on the object last saved date) before performing the actual save and lock is released after save is complete.
If true, object needs to be checked out before making any edits (pessimistic locking). The locking of object is done during loadDataForEditing operation.
StructElement.name: isPessimisticLock

StructElement.description:
The workflow information that the input object needs to submit to a workflow. Workflow information is stored in a name and value string map (string/list of strings). If workflowData map is empty, objects will not be submitted to any workflow.
Supported keys:

• submitToWorkflow: Boolean Property to define that input object need to submit to workflow process or not. It can contain true or false as value.
• processName: Process name string.
• processDescription: Process description string.
• processTemplate: Name of the process template to be used to create new workflow process.
• processAssignmentList: Name of the process assignment list to use while creating new workflow process.

If property submitToWorkflow value is true and processTemplate value is empty, then workflow process template to be used for workflow creation should be specified in the preference (<TypeName>_default_workflow_template) defined for the submitted object type.
StructElement.name: workflowData

StructElement.description: The name of the page that was processed. If the operation was invoked with processEntireXRT set to true, the this field is empty. If the operation was invoked with processEntireXRT set to false, this this field is populated with the page that was processed. Typically the value of the processedPage would be the same as the targetPage, except when the targetPage value is empty or not found in the stylesheet. In that case, then the first page in the stylesheet is processed.

StructElement.description: Map (string/string) where the key is the image resolution type from the stylesheet and value is the FMS ticket of the image for that resolution type.When resolution is not specified in the stylesheet or is invalid, FMS ticket mentioned in the default key will be populated.If the styesheet being rendered is SUMMARY, default value will be FMS ticket of the High resolution derived Dataset else default value would be FMS ticket of the Medium resolution derived Dataset.If derived Dataset does not exist,default value will be FMS ticket of the original Dataset.

StructElement.description:
The input object for which associated dataset and relevant viewer
needs to be fetched.
StructElement.name: obj

StructElement.description: The dataset object which is currently displayed in the viewer. Sending dataset object as empty results in fetching the default viewer associated with the input object.
StructElement.name: dataset

StructElement.description: Indicates the direction for dataset retrieval from input object based on dataset currently displayed in the viewer. If direction is null or empty, then the dataset input argument is ignored and input object is processed to get the associated dataset and relevant viewer. If direction is 'next', then the input object is processed to find the dataset and relevant viewer that is next in line to the received dataset argument. If direction is 'previous', then the input object is processed to find the dataset and relevant viewer that is previous to the received dataset argument. Valid values for direction are "", next, previous.
StructElement.name: direction

StructElement.description:
Indicates the value type for the property, valid values are:
value - type
0 . PROP_unknown - Property type is Unknown
1 . PROP_attribute - Based on a POM Attribute (int, string, ...)
2 . PROP_reference - Based on a POM Reference
3 . PROP_relation - Based on an ImanRelation
4 . PROP_compound - Based on a property from another Type
5 . PROP_runtime - Based on a computed value
6 . PROP_operationinput - Based on the source property on a BO
This is from the source object property descriptor.
StructElement.name: propertyType

StructElement.description:
Indicates the value type for the property, valid values are:
value - type
0 . PROP_untyped - No Value type
1 . PROP_char - Value is a single character *
2 . PROP_date - Value is a date
3 . PROP_double - Value is a double
4 . PROP_float - Value is a float
5 . PROP_int - Value is an integer
6 . PROP_logical - Value is a logical
7 . PROP_short - Value is a short
8 . PROP_string - Value is a character string
9 . PROP_typed_reference - Value is a typed reference
10 . PROP_untyped_reference - Value is an untyped reference
11 . PROP_external_reference - Value is an external reference
12 . PROP_note - Value is a note
13 . PROP_typed_relation - Value is a typed relation
14 . PROP_untyped_relation - Value is an untyped relation etc.
This is from the source object property descriptor.
StructElement.name: valueType

Typedef.description: Map of key\value pairs (string, string). These are optional fields returned to the client for the purpose of forwarding to the analytics site. There is no guarantee as to the contents or ordering of this map. The contents may vary across platforms or Teamcenter versions. The values in the map should NOT be interpreted by the client or used for client side logic since there is no guarantee on the content.

Struct.description: The column configuration data.
Struct.name: ColumnConfig

StructElement.description: Column configuration ID.
StructElement.name: columnConfigId

StructElement.description: Operation type used for determining columns. Supported values are: "Union" and "Intersection".
StructElement.name: operationType

StructElement.description: List of available columns.
StructElement.name: columns

StructElement.description: The valid Teamcenter types used for fetching the columns.
StructElement.name: typesForArrange

Struct.description: Contains input information required to retrieve UI column configurations from the Teamcenter database.
Struct.name: ColumnConfigInput

StructElement.description:
The name of a client application, as represented by an instance of Fnd0Client in the Teamcenter database. This value must match the value of fnd0ClientName property.
For example: The client name for Active Workspace is "AWClient".
StructElement.name: clientName

StructElement.description:
Specifies the name of a hosting client application, as represented by an instance of Fnd0Client, in the Teamcenter databases. This value must match a value of the fnd0ClientName property.

For example: If client A is integrated with client B and the user can invoke client B commands from within client A, the input to getUiConfigs would specify client A as hosting client and client B as the client. If the caller wanted native commands for client A, client A would be specified as client and hosting client would be empty.
StructElement.name: hostingClientName

StructElement.description:
The unique name of the client scope containing column configurations.
For example: "Awp0SearchResults" is the client scope URI for search location.
StructElement.name: clientScopeURI

StructElement.description:
The operation that needs to be applied to finalize the columns to be returned back.
Valid values are:
"Intersection" - Gets the intersection of the columns for the types found in search results.
"Union" - Gets all the columns for the types found in search results.
"Configured" - Gets all the columns defined for requested scope irrespective of types passed in. If it does not find any configuration at the specified scope it will search up in the order of scopes User, Role, Group and Site. No need to pass type names if need to fetch all columns.
StructElement.name: operationType

StructElement.description:
List of columns which should be excluded from the final list being returned. The value provided should be in the format "TypeName.PropertyName". Both type name and property name should be internal values.
For example: ItemRevision.sequence_id, where '.' is the delimiter.
StructElement.name: columnsToExclude

Struct.description: Column Definition
Struct.name: ColumnDefInfo

StructElement.description: The display name for the value displayed in the column header.
StructElement.name: displayName

StructElement.description: The business object type for the value displayed in the column. This can be any valid Teamcenter business object type.
StructElement.name: associatedTypeName

StructElement.description: The property name for the value displayed in the column.
StructElement.name: propertyName

StructElement.description: The pixel width for the column. Valid pixel widths are integer values between 1 and 500.
StructElement.name: pixelWidth

StructElement.description: The column order value is used to arrange the columns in order.
StructElement.name: columnOrder

StructElement.description: If true, the column should be hidden on the client user interface.
StructElement.name: hiddenFlag

StructElement.description:
Sort priority set on column helps identify the order in which the columns should be used during sort.
Sort priority value will be zero for columns not marked for sorting.
StructElement.name: sortPriority

StructElement.description: How the columns are sorted. Supported values are: "Ascending" and "Descending". This value will be empty if the column is not marked for sorting.
StructElement.name: sortDirection

Typedef.description:
The map of (string, string) filter parameters.
Following are the possible values.
1. Key "scope", Value could be "session" or "all". If the value is passed as "session", only the workspaces which match other filter parameters and apply to current user session (group role combination) will be returned. If it is passed as "all", all the workspaces in the system matching other filters will be returned regardless of existing user session.
2. Key "group", Value needs to be the group ID to which associated workspaces needs to be loaded. Key "group" is optional. If it is not present in operation input, all the workspaces matching other filters will be returned.
3. Key "role", Value needs to be the role ID to which associated workspaces needs to be loaded. Key "role" is optional. If it is not present in operation input, all the workspaces matching other filters will be returned.
Typedef.name: FilterParams

Struct.description:
Input structure containing option value to query and update the objects among newly added, modified, deleted or all. It also includes a boolean dryRun flag.

The queryAndUpdateOptions value is passed to skip or process in finding and updating the newly added, modified, deleted objects. When dryRun flag is true, only queries will be executed and no updates to the records are made. This dryRun mode can be used to know the statistics about the objects that are awating sync.
Struct.name: QueryAndUpdateDataInput

StructElement.description: Bit values. Supported values are Add=1, Modified=2, Deleted=4
StructElement.name: queryAndUpdateOptions

StructElement.description: If true, in dry run mode Queries will be executed; however, no updates to records are made.
StructElement.name: dryRun

Struct.description: Response structure contains the information about what the operation has found. The partial errors are added to the service data.
Struct.name: QueryAndUpdateSyncDataResponse

StructElement.description: A map(string, list of strings) containing status counts or other information that can be used for further processing.
StructElement.name: syncInfo

StructElement.description: The service data object.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Typedef.description:
A map containing information generated during the operation execution.
This includes information like count of objects found as newly added or modified or deleted that need to be synced. It can also contain other information like logfile names etc... needed by the caller.

The syncInfo will contain "STATUSCOUNT" as key and value is a list of strings as mentioned below with the counts of the objects found for the respective queries. Additional key/value pairs can be supported in future.
ADDED:<Count>
DELETED:<Count>
MODIFIED:<Count>
MODIFIED VIA RELATION:<Count>
Typedef.name: SyncInfo

Struct.description:
Contains the action to perform when the Awp0Tile is clicked in the Gateway. If URL is populated then urlParams may optionally be populated depending on the Tile configuration. If commandId is populated, then commandArgs may optionally be populated depending on the Awp0Tile configuration.

If the Awp0TileTemplate object’s awp0ActionType property is 0, 1 or 2 then the url property is populated. If the Awp0TileTemplate object’s awp0ActionType property is 3, then the commandId property is populated.
Struct.name: Action

StructElement.description: Identifies the action type. Possible values are 0 (default), 1 (external reference), 2 (static resource), 3 (command).
StructElement.name: actionType

StructElement.description: The URL to navigate to in the client if commandId is undefined.
StructElement.name: url

StructElement.description: The command ID to execute if URL is undefined.
StructElement.name: commandId

StructElement.description:
Optional command parameters. The names and values for this field come directly from the awp0Params property on the Awp0Tile object. These params are an unconstrained list of name/value pairs.

The syntax for awp0Params on the Awp0Tile object is in the format of <name>=<value>;<name2>=<value2>;<name3>=<value3>... Where name/value pairs are delimited by semicolon.

The awp0Params entry is parsed, and each name/value pair is added to a string map, where key is the parameter name, and the value is the parameter value.

For example: awp0Params may contain an entry such as “refresh=true;filter=POM_application_object.owning_user”.

The resulting map would contain the following parsed pairs:

“refresh”:”true”,
“filter”:”POM_application_object.owning_user”
StructElement.name: actionParams

Typedef.description: Contains optional command information to execute after the url or command ID is executed.
Typedef.name: ActionParamMap

The value of “__TYPEICON__” indicates that the type hierarchy must be walked into order to determine the icon to present in the UI. The 1st icon that it finds in the type hierarchy is the one to use.

Struct.description: The FacetSearchInput is based on existing structure SearchInput of performSearchViewModel3. It contains search criteria and search filter information.
Struct.name: FacetSearchInput

StructElement.description: The name of the search provider. This is the RuntimeBusinessObject type name.
StructElement.name: providerName

StructElement.description:
A map (string, string) used to perform the search.
For full text search, the key is "searchString", the value is input text. For example, ("searchString" : "*" | "?" | "string").

For advanced search, the supported key/values are:
("typeOfSearch" : "QUICK_SEARCH" or "ADVANCED_SEARCH");
("queryUID" : UID to a WorkspaceObject);
("searchID" : UID to a WorkspaceObject);
("quickSearchAttributeValue" : search string).

For example, an advance search might be:
"typeOfSearch" : "QUICK_SEARCH";
"queryUID" : "UID";
"searchID" : "UID";
"quickSearchAttributeValue": "*"
StructElement.name: searchCriteria

StructElement.description: A map (string, list of SearchFilter) containing the list of search filters for each search filter field. The key in the map is the property name that represents the filter category. It is in the format "TypeName.PropertyName". For example: WorkspaceObject.object_type, the value in the map is the value of the search filter.
StructElement.name: searchFilterMap

StructElement.description: The start index to return the facet values. This value must be zero or positive. Error will be returned for a negative value.
StructElement.name: startIndex

StructElement.description: The maximum number of facet values to return This value must be positive i.e. greater than 0, else error will be returned.
StructElement.name: maxToReturn

Struct.description: A response structure containing facet values for the filter category in input searchFilterMap.
Struct.name: FacetSearchResponse

StructElement.description: A map (string, list of SearchFilter) containing the list of search filters for each search filter field. The key in the map is the property name that represents the filter category. It is in the format "TypeName.PropertyName". For example: WorkspaceObject.object_type, the value in the map is the value of the search filter.
StructElement.name: searchFilterMap

StructElement.description: If true, client can make subsequent call for next set of facet values.
StructElement.name: hasMoreFacetValues

StructElement.description: Cursor end position for the facet values returned so far. This value, 'endIndex' will be used as 'startIndex' in FacetSearchInput for subsequent call.
StructElement.name: endIndex

StructElement.description: The service data object.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: A structure containing cursor

StructElement.description: Indicates the Cursor end position for the search result returned so far

Struct.description: Input structure for createFullTextSavedSearch service operation.
Struct.name: Awp0CreateFTSSavedSearchInput

StructElement.description:
Should the saved search object be pinned?
Supported values are:
-1 = Do no pin or unpin the saved search.
0 = Unpin the saved search.
1 = Pin the saved search.
StructElement.name: pinSearch

StructElement.description:
Should client receive notification if saved-search result changes?
Supported values are:
-1 = Do no set or remove notification for the saved search.
0 = Remove notification.
1 = Set notification.
StructElement.name: receiveNotification

StructElement.description:
Should the saved search be available to all users?
The awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object indicates if the search is shared or not.
-1 = Do not change the value of set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object.
0 = set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object to false.
1 = set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object to true.
StructElement.name: shareSavedSearch

StructElement.description: The saved search name. Alphanumeric and special characters are allowed.
StructElement.name: savedSearchName

StructElement.description: The search string. Alphanumeric and special characters are allowed.
StructElement.name: searchString

StructElement.description: A map of category internal names and list of filters in each category. (string/list of SearchFilter). Categories are defined as typeName.propertyName For example:e.g WorkspaceObject.object_type. They can be a Teamcenter core type/property name or classification type/property name. In some cases, it can also be a non-Teamcenter type/property name constructed just for the purpose of filtering on a category that may be a composite of other categories.
StructElement.name: searchFilterMap

StructElement.description: If false and if a Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object already exists for the user having same name, then this operation should return a partial error. If true and if a Awp0FullTextSavedsearch object already exists for the user having same name then this operation deletes the existing.
StructElement.name: overwriteExistingSearch

StructElement.description:
A map <string, string> containing chart input parameters.
NOTE: Supported keys are:
    • chartOn: The current charted on category internal name (format of the value: TypeName.propertyName).


Categories are defined as typeName.propertyName For example:e.g WorkspaceObject.object_type. They can be a Teamcenter core type/property name or classification type/property name. In some cases, it can also be a non-Teamcenter type/property name constructed just for the purpose of filtering on a category that may be a composite of other categories.
StructElement.name: chartInputParameters

Struct.description: Input structure for modifySavedSearchProperties service operation.

StructElement.description:
Should the saved-search object be pinned?
Supported values are:
-1 = Do not pin or unpin the saved-search.
0 = Unpin the saved-search.
1 = Pin the saved-search.
StructElement.name: pinSearch

StructElement.description:
Should user receive notification if saved-search results change?
Supported values are:
-1 = Do not remove or set notification.
0 = Remove notification.
1 = Set Notification.
StructElement.name: receiveNotification

StructElement.description:
Should the saved search be available to all users.
The awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object indicates if the search is shared or not.
-1 = Do not change the value of set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object.
0 = set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object to false.
1 = set awp0is_global_shared property on Awp0FullTextSavedSearch object to true.
StructElement.name: shareSavedSearch

StructElement.description: A map of category internal names and list of filters in each category. (string/list of SearchFilter). In some cases, it can also be a non-Teamcenter type/property name constructed just for the purpose of filtering on a category that may be a composite of other categories.

Struct.description:
This structure contains the file ticket of exported file. .

The following partial errors may be returned:
141401    Unable to export object “<Object name>” with UID “<UID>”.
141402    selectedObjectUIDs list cannot be empty when exporting selected objects.
141403    The column configuration must be specified to export search results.
141404    An internal error has occurred which caused the object export operation to fail.
141405    The search input criteria cannot contain empty properties when exporting all objects.
141406    The supported application format is MSExcelX.
Struct.name: ExportSearchResultsResponse

StructElement.description: The ServiceData. If an error occurs then ServiceData will contain partial error such as error generating transient file read ticket due to a configuration issue at the server.

StructElement.name: transientFileReadTickets

Struct.description: This structure contains information for a column configuration within a client scope URI. It contains a unique column config id, a list of column definition information, and the operation type used to finalize the columns.

Struct.description: Contains details about a specific column. StructElement.description: The filter criteria that is applied for current operation.
StructElement.name: filterValue

StructElement.description: The filter criteria that is applied for current operation.
StructElement.name: filterDefinitionKey

StructElement.description: If true, column filtering is enabled on this column; otherwise, column filtering is not supported on this column.
StructElement.name: isFilteringEnabled

StructElement.description: The data type of the property for the given column.
StructElement.name: dataType

StructElement.description: If true, the table has columns frozen until this column; otherwise, this column is not frozen.
StructElement.name: isFrozen

Struct.description: A structure representing the column filter criteria.
Struct.name: FilterCriteria

StructElement.description: This operation specifies the type of column filter operation applied. The supported operations are "CONTAINS", "EQUAL", "GREATER THAN", "LESS THAN" and "BETWEEN".
StructElement.name: operation

StructElement.description: A list of filter values saved in the database from the previous filter use case executed by the user.
StructElement.name: values

Struct.description: The response structure for the getNamedColumnConfigs service operation.
Struct.name: GetNamedColumnConfigsResponse

StructElement.description: A JSON string containing the information about the named column configuration(s).
StructElement.name: namedColumnConfigsJSON

StructElement.description: The service data object.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: Contains input information required to retrieve UI named and un-named column configurations from the Teamcenter database.
Struct.name: NamedColumnConfigInput

StructElement.description:
The name of a client application, as represented by an instance of Fnd0Client in the Teamcenter database. This value must match the value of fnd0ClientName property.
For example: The client name for Active Workspace is "AWClient".
StructElement.name: clientName

StructElement.description:
The unique name of the client scope containing column configurations.

Example: "Awp0SearchResults" is the client scope URI for search
StructElement.name: clientScopeUri

StructElement.description:
The name of the column configuration.

Example: "Search Results" for search location.
StructElement.name: columnConfigName

StructElement.description:
The unique identifier for the column configuration.
Ex: "searchResultsColConfig" for search location.
StructElement.name: columnConfigId

StructElement.description:
List of columns which should be excluded from the final list being returned. The value provided should be in the format "TypeName.PropertyName". Both type name and property name should be internal values.
For example: ItemRevision.sequence_id, where '.' is the delimiter.
StructElement.name: columnsToExclude

Typedef.description: Map from string to string.
Typedef.name: StringMap

OperationTemplate.description: This generic operation saves the modified properties for the given input objects and submits them to workflow. First it will perform the save operation and if completed successfully, will initiate a workflow process for all input objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::saveEditAndSubmitToWorkflow
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of SaveEditAndSubmitOutput structures, one for each successfully saved and submitted objects is returned. There are no objects returned in the ServiceData. Following partial errors are returned in ServiceData.

    • 302021 The input object is not modifiable.
    • 302022 The property is not modifiable.
    • 302023 The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
    • 219015 The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.

OperationParameter.description: A list of SaveEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation saves the modified properties for the given input objects and submits the objects to a workflow. The workflow is submitted only if all of the save operations are successful. If the save fails for a single object none of the input objects will be submitted to a workflow.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::saveEditAndSubmitToWorkflow
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of SaveEditAndSubmitOutput structures, one for each successfully saved and submitted object is returned. . If object is submitted to workflow then newly created EPMJob business object is added to created list in ServiceData. The updated list contains modified revision business object which was passed as input. Following partial errors may be returned in ServiceData.
302021 The input object is not modifiable.
302022 The property is not modifiable.
302023 The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
219015 The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.

OperationParameter.description: A list of SaveEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation saves the modified properties for the given input objects and submits the objects to a workflow. The workflow is submitted only if all of the save operations are successful. If the save fails for a single object none of the input objects will be submitted to a workflow.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::saveEditAndSubmitToWorkflow
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of SaveEditAndSubmitOutput structures, one for each successfully saved and submitted object is returned. If object is submitted to workflow then newly created EPMJob business object is added to created list in ServiceData. The updated list contains modified revision business object which was passed as input. Following partial errors may be returned in ServiceData.

141021 The object <OBJECT_NAME> is not modifiable.
141022 The property <PROP_NAME> on the object <OBJECT_NAME> is not modifiable.
141023 The object <OBJECT_NAME> has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
219015 The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.

OperationParameter.description: A list of SaveEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description:
The operation queries on scratch, accountability and subscription tables to identify the impacted ItemRevisions from last index time due to adds/modify/deletes that took place. These impacted objects need to be re-indexed to have the revision rule selectors updated.
Steps:
1.    Queries for deleted objects from scratch table. Gets their parent Item objects from accountability table impacted island if they exist. For the Item objects found, it fetches all the ItemRevisions and adds them to the response.
2.    Queries for newly added objects from scratch table. Filters out non ItemRevisions from the list. Adds the ItemRevisions to the reponse.
3.    Queries for any Modified islands from the accountability table. If modified island belongs to an ItemRevision, then the ItemRevision will be added to the response.

Finally the response will contain the impacted ItemRevisions due to adds/modify/deletes.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::getImpactedItemRevsForReIndex
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The list of impacted ItemRevision UIDs. The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 141051:     The operation to retrieve the impacted ItemRevision objects for synchronization has failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.

OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::getObjectsToIndex

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation is invoked to query the data for a property having an LOV attachment. The results returned from the server also take into consideration any filter string that is in the input. This operation returns both LOV meta data as necessary for the client to render the LOV and partial LOV values list as specified.
The operation will return the results in the LOVSearchResults data structure. Maximum number of results to be returned are specified in the InitialLOVData data structure. If there are more results, the moreValuesExist flag in the LOVSearchResults data structure will be true. If the flag is true, more values can be retrieved with a call to the getNextLOVValues operation.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::LOV::getInitialLOVValues
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: The LOV Search Results. This includes LOV metadata information (LOV usage, LOV style, etc.). It also contains the instance data (LOV values) that the client can use to render the LOV UI widget. The output also contains information as to whether there are more results to be processed in which case a user can page to get next set of values (this triggers a call to the getNextLOVValues operation). The following partial errors are returned in the ServiceData - 54051 - The property is not a valid sort property. Property must be one of the LOV Value or LOV Description or any of Filter Properties. - 54052 - The Dynamic LOV has an invalid configuration. It may be that Business Object Type this dynamic LOV may not exists in the system. Please contact your business modeler administrator with this information - 54053- The Dynamic LOV has an invalid configuration with one of the filter property does not exists. Please contact your business modeler administrator with this information - 54054- The Dynamic LOV has an invalid configuration The specified LOV value property for the Dynamic LOV does not exists. Please contact your business modeler administrator with this - 54055- The Dynamic LOV has an invalid configuration. The specified LOV value description property for the Dynamic LOV does not exists. Please contact your business modeler administrator with this information

OperationParameter.description: Input data to get LOV results for any LOV
OperationParameter.name: initialData

OperationTemplate.description: This operation is invoked after a call to getInitialLOVValues if the moreValuesExist flag is true in the LOVSearchResults output returned from a call to the getInitialLOVValues operation. The operation will retrieve the next set of LOV values
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::LOV::getNextLOVValues
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: LOV Search Results (LOVSearchResults instance). The LOV Search Results contains LOV metadata information (LOV usage, LOV style, etc.). It also contains the instance data (LOV values) that the client can use to render the LOV UI widget. The output also contains information as to whether there are more results to be processed in which case a user can page to get next set of values (this triggers a call to the subsequent getNextLOVValues operation). Partial errors are returned in the ServiceData field in the LOV Search Results. Possible errors are:

OperationParameter.description: Input data to get next set of LOV results for Dynamic LOV. This is returned as part of the LOVSearchResults output from the call to getInitialLOVValues operation
OperationParameter.name: lovData

Use this operation to do additional validation to be done on server such as validating Range value, getting the dependent properties values in case of interdependent LOV (resetting the dependendent property values), Coordinated LOVs ( populating dependent property values )

OperationTemplate.returnDescription: The response data indicating validity of LOV value selections and containing updated property values and interdependent property values

OperationParameter.description: updated LOV input with new selection

OperationParameter.name: propName
