OperationParameter.name: uidOfSelectedRows

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns a list of business objects containing group membership information.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::OrganizationManagement::getGroupMembership
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: A service response structure containing group membership information.

OperationParameter.description: The structure containing input to retrieve group membership information.
OperationParameter.name: groupMembershipInput

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation searches for active GroupMember based on name, role and group inputs . Literal and partial strings (strings with wildcard character '*') are supported. Literal string are AND together and partial strings are grouped OR and AND with with the literal strings.
Using the following search critera:

userId = "tc*"
userName = "tcadmin"
groupName = "dba"
roleName = "DB*"

The operation will assemble the final search criteria as follows:

username = "tcadmin" AND groupName = "dba" AND ( userId = "tc*" OR roleName = "DB*" ).

Following examples demonstrate how this operation can be used to get GroupMember objects based on different inputs:

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User objects where userd_id, user_name contain "XYZ". Input for this search will be :

userId - "*XYZ*"
userName - "*XYZ*"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User or Role or Group objects where userd_id, user_name, role_name,or name contain "xyz". Input for this search will be :

userId - "*xyz*"
userName - "*xyz*"
roleName - "*xyz*"
groupName - "*xyz*"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User or Role objects where userd_id,user_name, role_name contain "xyz" and has Group object with name "dba". Inputs for this search will be :

userId - "*xyz*"
userName - "*xyz*"
roleName - "*xyz*"
groupName - "dba"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User or Group objects where userd_id, user_name, name contain "xyz" and has Role object with role_name "DBA". Inputs for this search will be :

userId - "*xyz*"
userName - "*xyz*"
roleName - "DBA"
groupName - "*xyz*"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User objects where user_id, user_name contain"xyz" and Role object with role_name "DBA" and Group object with name "dba". Inputs for this search will be :

userId - "*xyz*"
userName - "*xyz*"
roleName - "DBA"
groupName - "dba"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User objects where user_id "xyz" and user_name "xyz" and Role object with role_name "DBA" and Group object with name "dba". Inputs for this search will be :

userId - "xyz"
userName - "xyz"
roleName - "DBA"
groupName - "dba"
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::OrganizationManagement::getGroupMembership2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of GroupMember objects found after performing the GroupMember objects search. This operation also returns the map of User object to Person objects . The User objects returned in the map are corresponding to the found GroupMember objects.
Possible errors returned in ServiceData are:

516001 - An enquiry internal error has occurred..
516127 - The enquiry module has run out of memory.
516130 - The enquiry has timed-out.

OperationParameter.description: The input search criteria for finding the GroupMember objects.
OperationParameter.name: input

All returned objects are included in the plain objects list of the ServiceData.

The following partial errors may be returned:
141103 The operation to retrieve the stylesheet information has failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation lists the business objects whose READ access is impacted by the changes in Access Manager rule tree. The rule tree changes considered are limited to those made after the previous call to this operation.
This operation is usually called periodically and the objects whose read access is modified due to the changes to Access Manager rule tree between the previous call and the current one are determined and returned.
Optionally, this operation returns the set of objects which is the intersection of objects impacted by Access Manager rule changes and objects previously indexed. Previously indexed objects are stored in ACCT_TABLE table. The application id will be used to further filter the objects impacted by Access manager rule changes and got previously indexed for a particular application.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::getAMImpactedObjects
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
An instance of GetAMImpactedObjectsResponse with the list of objects whose read access is modified. If the number of objects impacted is too large the flag isImpactGlobal is set to true and the callers may treat this as the indication to perform full reindexing. Number of objects returned in this case will be zero. Number of objects returned can also be zero when there are no changes to the rule tree. In this case the isImpactGlobal flag will be returned as false.
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 525185     Failed to identify impacted objects.

OperationParameter.description: Application ID subscribed by Access Manager to identify the impacted objects by rule tree changes. Ex: ":FTS_AMSYNC"
OperationParameter.name: amSyncAppID

OperationParameter.description: The unique identifier to differentiate objects indexed to different target applications. This is optional. If this is specified only the objects previosuly indexed by this application and impacted due to rule tree changes will be returned. Else all the impacted objects from the entire database will be included in the response. Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID used for indexing object data.
OperationParameter.name: applicationID

OperationTemplate.description: This operation queries for the indexed objects matching the given input criteria. Criteria include application ID, timestamp, export or import status of the object and list of object class names.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::getIndexedObjects
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The list of indexed objects that matched the given input criteria.
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
    • 141061 Specified status is invalid.

OperationParameter.description:
The unique identifier that identifies the application that indexed the object.
Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID of the Full Text Search Indexer that indexes object data.
OperationParameter.name: applicationID

OperationParameter.description: The application id used to gets the last processed date from subscription table to be used to filter the indexed objects. This is optional. If this value is specified it ignores the last exported date passed in as input to the operation.
OperationParameter.name: subscriptionAppID

OperationParameter.description:
The timestamp used to identify objects that have been indexed before the specified value.
If the value is NULLDATE, this field will be excluded from the query i.e., all objects, regardless of when they were indexed, are returned as long as they match the other criteria i.e application ID, status and class names.
OperationParameter.name: exportedDate

OperationParameter.description:
The export or import status of the object. This is optional.
Vaid values are
0 - status is ignored and not included as part of the query
1 - Replication Pending
2 - Replication Complete
3 - Dirty
4 - Import Failed
OperationParameter.name: status

OperationParameter.description: The list of class names of the objects to find. This is optional and list can be empty.
OperationParameter.name: classNames

OperationParameter.description: Count of objects to be returned back in resposne. If the value is 0, all objects found by the query will be returned.
OperationParameter.name: maxObjectCount

OperationTemplate.description: This operation finds all indexed objects that have been modified since the last "sync" run.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::getModifiedObjectsToSync
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
• The list modified object UIDs since the last sync run.
    • The timestamp when the query is executed to find the modified objects.

The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209     The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.

OperationParameter.description:
The unique ID used by the application consuming the data.
Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID used for indexing object data.
OperationParameter.name: applicationID

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation returns the dataset type and reference information for a set of file extensions. This operation also returns the default paste relation for each Dataset type returned for the given input parent. Named references are Teamcenter objects that related to a specific data file.

For each file extension, it is possible that it belongs to multiple dataset types. For such cases, all matching dataset types will be returned using the file extension as the key in the GetDatasetTypesWithDefaultRelationOutput structure.

The order of file extension in the GetDatasetTypesWithDefaultRelationOutput structure may be different than the order of file extension input. This operation inserts file extensions that match the default dataset type defined in AE_default_dataset_type preference at the beginning of the list.

This operation uses the TC_Dataset_Import_Exclude_Wildcard preference to determine if wildcard may be used in file extension input. If the preference is set and file extension is set to asterisk, this operation will return all data set types that allow wildcards in its name reference in Teamcenter.

Default paste relation for each Dataset type returned is determined by evaluating preferences __default_relation and/or _default_relation. The preference __default_relation takes precedence over _default_relation.

Details about these four preferences can be found in Preferences and Environment (Variables Reference Configuration preferences, under Data management preferences).
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getDatasetTypesWithDefaultRelation
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Dataset type and reference information for each fileExtensions input and default paste relation for each Dataset type for the given input parent.
The following partial errors may be returned:
214135 :The input file extension does not exist.

OperationParameter.description: Parent object which acts as primary for the Dataset. If parent object is null or invalid then default relation is not populated with the response.
OperationParameter.name: parent

OperationParameter.description: List of file extensions used to get the named reference information, such as "doc" or "txt".
OperationParameter.name: fileExtensions

OperationTemplate.description: This operation creates Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects. Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects are used to store information about a saved search such as search name, search string, search filters, etc.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::createFullTextSavedSearch
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of saved searches created by this service operation.

The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141141 - The operation failed to create a new saved search because a saved search with same name already exits.

OperationParameter.description: Information required to create a list of new Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation creates Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects. Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects are used to store information about a saved search such as search name, search string, search filters, chart input parameters etc.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::createFullTextSavedSearch
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of saved searches created by this service operation.

The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 141152 - The operation failed to create a new saved search because a saved search with same name already exits.
    • 141162 - This is not a valid chart input parameter key. Valid keys are: ChartOn.

OperationParameter.description: Information required to create a list of new Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation modifies existing Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::modifyFullTextSavedSearch
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of modified saved searches.

The following partial error may be returned:
    • 141145 - Invalid type. Only Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects allowed.

OperationParameter.description: A list of Awp0FullTextSavedSearchInputObjects2 objects that contain information to edit existing Saved Search objects.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation modifies existing Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::modifyFullTextSavedSearch
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of modified saved searches.

The following partial error may be returned:
    • 141153 - The modified search cannot be saved with that name, because a saved search already exists with the same name.
    • 141162 - This is not a valid chart input parameter key. Valid keys are: ChartOn.

OperationParameter.description: A list of Awp0ModifyFTSSavedSearchInput objects that contain information to edit existing Saved Search objects.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns the stylesheets and the required data to present that stylesheet for each input object.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getStyleSheet2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The data required in order for the client to build the UI and present the information to the user. This data includes the stylesheet to present, the properties on the object to render, the children to present, the properties on those children, thumbnail file tickets, the page to render, and the localized values of certain text labels to be presented in UI.

All returned objects are included in the plain objects list of the ServiceData.

The following partial errors may be returned:
141103 The operation to retrieve the stylesheet information has failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.
141233: An invalid property was found in the SortBy field in the stylesheet. Please contact your system administrator to correct that.

OperationParameter.description: If true, this operation will process the data for the entire XRT. If false, this operation will only process the target page which is defined on the input structure.
OperationParameter.name: processEntireXRT

OperationParameter.description: Input data for which to retrieve stylesheets.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns the unprocessed XRT stylesheet.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getUnprocessedXRT
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: This operation returns the unprocessed XRT stylesheet, or no DSInfo object if nothing is registered to the input context.

OperationParameter.description: The client string. For Activeworkspace value shall be "AWC" for other clients use empty string.
OperationParameter.name: client

OperationParameter.description: The business object type.
OperationParameter.name: type

OperationParameter.description: The client location, or empty string if undefined.
OperationParameter.name: location

OperationParameter.description: The client sublocation, or empty string if undefined.
OperationParameter.name: sublocation

OperationParameter.description: The stylesheet type (CREATE, SUMMARY, INFO, REVISE )
OperationParameter.name: stylesheetType

OperationParameter.description: The preference location (USER, ROLE, GROUP, SITE, ALL).
OperationParameter.name: preferenceLocation

OperationTemplate.description: This operation provides classification properties for a given WorkspaceObject(s).
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Finder::getClassificationProps
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of WorkspaceObject and their corresponding classification properties. And a list of Classification attribute ID and their corresponding meta data.

The following partial error may be returned:
    • 515024 Invalid workspace object is passed in to this operation.

OperationParameter.description: A list of WorkspaceObject for which classification properties are required.
OperationParameter.name: objects

OperationParameter.description:
If True, a union of found classification properties for the given WorkspaceObjects are returned.
If False, an intersection of found classification properties for the given WorkspaceObjects are returned.
OperationParameter.name: showAllProperties

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation routes a search request to a specific provider specified as providerName in the searchInput structures

The framework allows a custom solution to be able to provide a new specific provider to collect data, perform sorting and filtering. The provider can be a User Inbox retriever or Full Text searcher, for example. The new data provider can be encapsulated via a new runtime business object from Fnd0BaseProvider class. The implementation is done using its fnd0performSearch operation.

RuntimeBusinessObject
---- Fnd0BaseProvider (foundation template)
-------- Fnd0GetChildrenProvider (foundation template)
-------- Awp0FullTextSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Awp0TaskSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Aos0TestProvider (aosinternal template)
-------- etc.
This operation provides a common interface to send the request to and receive the response from a new data provider. Ultimately it allows common framework in UI to support filter, pagination, and sorting.

This operation allows the caller to send the search input, filter values, and sorting data. These input values are then to be passed to the fnd0performSearch operation on the server to collect, sort, and filter its results.

The first two input parameters are important. The first input is the provider name. This is a string to represent the type name of RuntimeBusinessObject which this request should be routed to. If the template that contains the class is not installed, a partial error 217016 is returned. The second input is the search input map. The key is different per each provider. For example, for Full Text searcher, the input key would be a searchString. For User Inbox retriever, the input key would be an Inbox Type. The fnd0performSearch implementation for each provider takes into account the key name as it is used to store the values in OperationInput object.

The internal property name is passed as part of search input to allow grouping of business objects. The grouping allows for added functionality such as color coding, etc. If no internal property name is passed, default value is assumed as "object_type" to group the business objects.

If new list of column config data is passed in to be saved, it will get saved in the database for the login user scope. This will be done prior to performing the search.

The column configuration input has the criteria needed to query for the columns configured for the provided client and client scope URI. The final list of columns are identified based on the types returned back in the search results and the operation type( Union / Intersection / Configured ) configured for the client scope URI. Finally the determined column attributes and the attributes to be inflated passed in as part of search input criteria are combined. This combined list of attributes along with the business objects found during search are added to the Service data.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Finder::performSearch
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The search results, search filters for each search filter field based on the search results, and search filter categories ordered by filter priority. The search filters contains internal and their display values.

The ObjectsGroupedByProperty object containing the internal property name, a map of business object and its associated property group unique identifier, and a list of unmatched business objects is also returned.

The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 217016 Invalid search provider name.Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.
    • 217017 Failed to perform search.
    • 217018 The input list cannot be empty.
    • 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.
    • 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.

OperationParameter.description: The search input containing search criteria.
OperationParameter.name: searchInput

OperationParameter.description: The column config input criteria.
OperationParameter.name: columnConfigInput

OperationParameter.description: Column config data to be saved for the login user scope.
OperationParameter.name: saveColumnConfigData

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation returns information used by the client to render the User Interface. The information returned includes column configuration information.
If the resetColumnConfig flag is "True", this operation deletes the column configuration of the input scope and then queries the new effective UI column configuration for the login user. This operation will only clear the login user column configurations.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::getOrResetUIColumnConfigs
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of column configurations based on the input provided to the operation.
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 302010 - Invalid Client Scope.
    • 302012 - Invalid Client.
    • 302014 - Invalid Hosting Client.
    • 141160 - Invalid scope.

OperationParameter.description: Input information required to retrieve UI column configurations from the Teamcenter database.
OperationParameter.name: getOrResetUiConfigsIn

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns information used by the client to render the User Interface. The information returned includes commands that are visible.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::getVisibleCommands
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of commands that are visible based on the input provided to the operation. The following partial errors may be returned:
302010 - Invalid Client Scope. The client scope URI is not defined for the client.
302012 - Invalid Client. The name of a client application is not valid. This value is represented by an instance of Awp0Client in the Teamcenter databases and must match a value of the Awp0ClientName property.
302013 - Invalid Scope. Scope parameter input value is not valid. Valid values are Site, Group, Role, User, LoginUser and AvailableForLoginUser.
302014 - Invalid Hosting Client. The name of a hosting client application is not valid. This value is represented by an instance of Awp0Client in the Teamcenter databases and must match a value of the Awp0ClientName property.

OperationParameter.description: Contains input information required to retrieve the commands that are visible from the Teamcenter database.
OperationParameter.name: getVisibleCommandsInfo

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns the proposed values to act as initial values when a new row object needs to be added to the table. User can then do further modification as needed, and perform save operation to create the row object in the database.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getInitialTableRowData
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: The information that can be used to create a row of the requested object.

OperationParameter.description: The object that defines the table property
OperationParameter.name: owningObject

OperationParameter.description: The name of the table property for which a new row is to be added
OperationParameter.name: tablePropertyName

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns the stylesheets and the required data to present that stylesheet for each input object.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getStyleSheet
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The data required in order for the client to build the UI and present the information to the user. This data includes the stylesheet to present, the properties on the object to render, the children to present, the properties on those children, thumbnail file tickets, the page to render, and the localized values of certain text labels to be presented in UI.

All returned objects are included in the plain objects list of the ServiceData.

The following partial errors may be returned:
141103 The operation to retrieve the stylesheet information has failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.

OperationParameter.description: If true, this operation will process the data for the entire XRT. If false, this operation will only process the target page which is defined on the input structure.
OperationParameter.name: processEntireXRT

OperationParameter.description: Input data for which to retrieve stylesheets.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This SOA method ensures that the properties can be edited, and returns the last save date of the related objects for optimistic edit
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::loadDataForEditing
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The last save date for each of the objects and the table property values.
The following partial errors may be returned:

302021: The input object is not modifiable.
302022: The property is not modifiable.

OperationParameter.description: A List of LoadDataForEditingInfo structures which provide input information for loading the editable information. It includes the list of property names whose editable information is to be loaded.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: Creates the Advanced Query Criteria business object (Awp0AdvancedQueryCriteria). This object is used to populate criteria for currently selected Saved Query. The Query Criteria are represented by dynamic runtime business objects. This is necessary because the query criteria fields change deepending on which Saved Query is selected by the user. Advanced Query Criteria is the parent business object of the dynamic runtime business objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::AdvancedSearch::getSelectedQueryCriteria
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The Advanced Query Criteria object and the Service Data. The Service Data contains newly created Advanced Query Criteria in the Created list.The Service Data can contain the following partial errors.
    • 141207 - "Selected Query" could not load because of an internal failure.

OperationParameter.description: Currently selected saved query by user.
OperationParameter.name: selectedQuery

OperationTemplate.description: Creates the Advanced Search Input business object (Awp0AdvancedSearchInput). This object is used to populate values for the advanced query name or the quick search name. Based on the quick search name or advanced query name that is populated on this object, the quick search criteria or advanced search criteria fields are shown in the client UI. The Advanced Search object that is created also has a property with the default quick search name populated.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::AdvancedSearch::createAdvancedSearchInput
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The Advanced Search Input object and the Service Data. The Service Data contains newly created Advanced Search Input in the Created list, while the Saved query object representing the default quick search name is in the Plain list. The Service Data can contain the following partial errors.
    • 141205 - The value provided for the preference Default_Quick_Access_Query is invalid.
    • 141206 - The preference Default_Quick_Access_Query is not set.
    • 141204 - Advanced Search is not available because of an internal failure.

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns the declarative UI definition generated from stylesheets for each input object. It first gets the stylesheets for each input object, then converts them into declarative view defintions which can be rended as HTML page by declarative UI framework.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getDeclarativeStyleSheets
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The data required in order for the client to build the declarative UI and present the information to the user. This data includes the declarative view to render, the view model to be bound to view, and the localized values of certain text labels to be presented in declarative UI.

All returned objects are included in the plain objects list of the ServiceData.

The following partial errors may be returned:
141108 The operation to retrieve the declarative UI definition from stylesheet information has failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.

OperationParameter.description: If true, this operation will process the data for the entire XRT. If false, this operation will only process the target page which is defined on the input structure.
OperationParameter.name: processEntireXRT

OperationParameter.description: Input data for which to retrieve declarative UI definition from stylesheets.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation returns the value of default relation preference for given combination of primary and secondary object types as defined by Teamcenter Administrator. The entire type hierarchy of secondary object type is traversed while determining the default relation preference. The preference format should be as follows:
<primary_object_type>_<secondary_object_type>_default_relation

If the secondary object type is passed as empty, then the preference format should be as follows:
<primaty_object_type>_default_relation
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getDefaultRelation
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
GetDefaultRelationResponse containing list of GetDefaultRelationInfo objects. Each GetDefaultRelationInfo object holds the primary and secondary type as well as the default relation information
    • 1700 - The preference "<PREF_NAME>" cannot be found.

OperationParameter.description: List of GetDefaultRelationIn objects with each object holding the primary and secondary object type.
OperationParameter.name: input

    • 217016 Invalid search provider name.Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.
    • 217017 Failed to perform search.
    • 217018 The input list cannot be empty.
    • 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.
    • 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.

OperationParameter.description: The search input containing search criteria.
OperationParameter.name: searchInput

OperationParameter.description: The column config input criteria.
OperationParameter.name: columnConfigInput

OperationParameter.description: Column config data to be saved for the login user scope.
OperationParameter.name: saveColumnConfigData

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns the stylesheets and the required data to present that stylesheet for each input object.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getStyleSheet3
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The data required in order for the client to build the UI and present the information to the user. This data includes the stylesheet to present, the properties on the object to render, the children to present, the properties on those children, thumbnail file tickets, the page to render, and the localized values of certain text labels to be presented in UI.
All returned objects are included in the plain objects list of the ServiceData.

The following partial errors may be returned:

OperationParameter.description: If true, this operation will process the data for the entire XRT. If false, this operation will only process the target page which is defined in the input structure.
OperationParameter.name: processEntireXRT

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns the dataset, file and relevant viewer data for given combination of input object, dataset and direction by processing the viewer preference set by Teamcenter Administrator. Datasets associated with input object are retrieved and sorted based on the values of viewer preference. Thereafter, appropriate dataset is identified using the input dataset and direction. The corresponding file and viewer information along with dataset is returned in the response.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getViewerData
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
GetViewerDataResponse object containing list of GetViewerDataOutput objects. Each GetViewerDataOuput object holds the output dataset and list of ViewData objects. Each ViewData object contains the ImanFile, the read fmsTicket for ImanFile and viewer to be rendered on the client.

    • 1700 - The preference "" cannot be found.

OperationParameter.description: List of GetViewerDataIn objects.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation is provided to get property values of instances outside of the current object property policy for a particular business object.This operation is an enhanced version of the getProperties service operation and allows for retrieving values of dynamic compound properties as well.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getViewModelProperties
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Objects for which properties could be successfully retrieved are returned as ViewModelObject structures along with corresponding ViewModelPropertyDescriptor structures. Any failures will be returned with the input object mapped to the error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors.

The following errors are returned as partial errors if there is an error in retrieving values for the input properties
236002 - The tag is invalid. Properties for the requested object cannot be retrieved.

OperationParameter.description: A list of business objects for which property values are requested.
OperationParameter.name: objects

OperationParameter.description: A list of attribute/property name strings for which values are needed. Properties can include dynamic compound properties as well.
OperationParameter.name: attributes

OperationTemplate.description: This method ensures that the properties can be edited, and returns the last save date of the related objects for optimistic edit. This service operation is similar to loadDataForEditing service operation, the difference is that this operation saves the ViewModelObject instead of model object, and this operation supports dynamic compound properties. If the property is dynamic compound property, this operation checks if the traversal path on server is same as the input traversal path , if it is not the same, then editing is not allowed.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::loadViewModelForEditing
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The last save date for each of the view model objects.
The following partial errors may be returned:
302021: The input object is not modifiable.
302022: The property is not modifiable.
302024: The traversal path of dynamic compound property has changed.

OperationParameter.description: A list of LoadViewModelForEditingInfo structures which provide input information for loading the editable information. It includes the list of view model properties whose editable information is to be loaded.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation saves the modified view model properties for the given input objects and submits the objects to a workflow. The workflow is submitted only if all of the save operations are successful. If the save fails for a single object none of the input objects will be submitted to a workflow. This operation is similar to the saveEditAndSubmitToWorkflow operation, the difference is that this operation saves the ViewModelObject instead of model object, and this operation supports dynamic compound properties.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::saveViewModelEditAndSubmitWorkflow
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of SaveViewModelEditAndSubmitOutput structures, one for each successfully saved and submitted objects is returned. There are no objects returned in the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:
302021: The input object is not modifiable.
302022: The property is not modifiable.
302023: The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
302024: The traversal path of dynamic compound property has changed.
219015: The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.

OperationParameter.description: A list of SaveViewModelEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation routes a search request to a specific provider specified as providerName in the searchInput structures.

The framework allows a custom solution to be able to provide a new specific provider to collect data, perform sorting and filtering. The provider can be a User Inbox retriever or Full Text searcher, for example. The new data provider can be encapsulated via a new runtime business object from Fnd0BaseProvider class. The implementation is done using its fnd0performSearch operation.

RuntimeBusinessObject
---- Fnd0BaseProvider (foundation template)
-------- Fnd0GetChildrenProvider(foundation template)
-------- Awp0FullTextSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Awp0TaskSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Aos0TestProvider (aosinternal template)
-------- etc.

This operation provides a common interface to send the request to and receive the response from a new data provider. Ultimately it allows common framework in UI to support filter, pagination, and sorting.

This operation allows the caller to send the search input, filter values, and sorting data. These input values are then to be passed to the fnd0performSearch operation on the server to collect, sort, and filter its results.

The first two input parameters are important. The first input is the provider name. This is a string to represent the type name of RuntimeBusinessObject which this request should be routed to. If the template that contains the class is not installed, a partial error 217016 is returned. The second input is the search input map. The key is different per each provider. For example, for Full Text searcher, the input key would be a searchString. For User Inbox retriever, the input key would be an Inbox Type. The fnd0performSearch implementation for each provider takes into account the key name as it is used to store the values in OperationInput object.

The internal property name is passed as part of search input to allow grouping of business objects. The grouping allows for added functionality such as color coding, etc. If no internal property name is passed, default value is assumed as "object_type" to group the business objects.

The final list of columns are identified based on the types returned back in the search results and the operation type (Union / Intersection / Configured ) configured for the client scope URI. Finally the determined column attributes and the attributes to be inflated passed in as part of search input criteria are combined. This combined list of attributes along with the business objects found during search are added to the Service data.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Finder::performSearchViewModel
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The search results, search filters for each search filter field based on the search results, and search filter categories ordered by filter priority. The search filters contains internal and their display values. The ObjectsGroupedByProperty object containing the internal property name, a map of business object and its associated property group unique identifier, and a list of unmatched business objects is also returned. unmatched business objects is also returned.The thresholdCrossed argument, indicates if the returned objects as search results contain all revisions (true) or only those revisions that conform to the current revision rule (false).
The following partial errors may be returned:
* 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.
* 217017 Failed to perform search.
* 217018 The input list cannot be empty.
* 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.
* 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.
* 141218 Sort operation is not supported on selected column.

OperationParameter.description: The search input containing search criteria.
OperationParameter.name: searchInput

OperationParameter.description: The column configuration input criteria.
OperationParameter.name: columnConfigInput

OperationParameter.description: Column configuration data to be saved for the login user scope.
OperationParameter.name: saveColumnConfigData

OperationParameter.description: If true, the properties will be inflated.
OperationParameter.name: inflateProperties

OperationTemplate.description:
The operation identifies the siblings of Revisionable Objects that have been added/modified/deleted.

The identified siblings are marked in the accountability table with the TIE sync status provided and returned if requsted

Based on the value of the addModDelBitMask the following steps will be executed.
Steps:
1. Queries for siblings of deleted objects from scratch table. Gets their parent Item objects from accountability table impacted island if they exist. For the Item objects found, it fetches all the Revisionable Objects and adds them to the response.
2. Queries for siblings of newly added objects from scratch table. Filters out non Revisionable Objects from the list.
Adds the Revisionable Objects to the reponse.
3. Queries for any Modified islands from the accountability table. If modified island belongs to an Revisionable Objects, then queries for the Revisionable Objects siblings and adds to the response.

Finally the response will contain the impacted Revisionable Objects due to adds/modify/deletes.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::identifyImpactedObjects
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: The list of impacted Revisionable Object UIDs

OperationParameter.description: Input values
OperationParameter.name: impactedObjectsInput

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation returns information used by the client to render the User Interface. The information returned includes column configuration information.
If the resetColumnConfig flag is "True", this operation deletes the column configuration of the input scope and then queries the new effective UI column configuration for the login user. This operation will clear the login user column configurations.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::getOrResetUIColumnConfigs2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of column configurations based on the input provided to the operation.
The following partial errors may be returned:

302010 - Invalid Client Scope. Please provide a valid client scope as per BMIDE template definition.
302012 - The client name is invalid. Please provide a valid client name as per BMIDE template definition.
302014 - Invalid Hosting Client for given client name
141160 - Invalid scope. Valid values for scope are "Site", "Group", "Role", "User", "LoginUser"

OperationParameter.description: Input information required to retrieve UI column configurations from the Teamcenter database.
OperationParameter.name: getOrResetUiConfigsIn

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns available workspaces. The list of workspaces is populated based on input criteria (e.g. current user session ).
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getAvailableWorkspaces
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
This operation returns available workspaces based on the service operation input.

The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141225 - The retrieval of the available workspaces has failed due to an internal error. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog for more information.
    • 141226 - The mandatory key 'scope' is missing in the filter parameters.

OperationParameter.description:
The map of (string, string) filter parameters.
Following are the possible values.
1. Key "scope", Value could be "session" or "all". If the value is passed as "session", only the workspaces which match other filter parameters and apply to current user session (group role combination) will be returned. If it is passed as "all", all the workspaces in the system matching other filters will be returned regardless of existing user session.
2. Key "group", Value needs to be the group ID to which associated workspaces needs to be loaded. Key "group" is optional. If it is not present in operation input, all the workspaces matching other filters will be returned. 3. Key "role", Value needs to be the role ID to which associated workspaces needs to be loaded. Key "role" is optional. If it is not present in operation input, all the workspaces matching other filters will be returned.
OperationParameter.name: filterParams

OperationTemplate.description: The operation returns the column configuration and Table View Model properties for the input object UIDs.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getTableViewModelProperties
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Returns the column configuration along with the properties for each of the object passed in input as JSON string. Any failures will be returned in the ServiceData list of partial errors.

The following partial errors may be returned:
236002 - The requested object does not exist. Properties for the requested object cannot be retrieved.

172003 - The object type does not exist.

172010 - The client scope URI does not exists.

141114 -The parameter passed in is not supported.

141115 - The value for the parameter is not valid.

OperationParameter.description: The input to the operation is list of the object UIDs and client scope URIs for which the Table data is to be fetched.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation is provided to get property values of instances outside of the current object property policy for a particular business object. This operation is an enhanced version of the getProperties service operation and allows for retrieving values of dynamic compound properties as well.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getViewModelProperties2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Objects for which properties could be successfully retrieved are returned as JSON string. Any failures will be returned with the input object mapped to the error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors.

The following errors are returned as partial errors if there is an error in retrieving values for the input propertiesThe following partial errors may be returned:

236002 - The object is invalid. Properties for the requested object cannot be retrieved.

OperationParameter.description: A list of business objects for which property values are requested. All business object types are supported.
OperationParameter.name: objects

OperationParameter.description: A list of attribute/property names strings for which values are needed. Properties can include dynamic compound properties as well.
OperationParameter.name: attributes

OperationParameter.description:
Configuration parameters of this service operation,the following are the possible values:
1. Key "supportsCardinality", value could be "true or "false", if value is true, multiple view model objects will be returned if dynamic compounds properties traverses to multiple source objects.
OperationParameter.name: configs

OperationTemplate.description: This method ensures that the properties can be edited and returns the last save date of the related objects for optimistic edit. This new operation is similar to the existing loadDataForEditing operation, the difference is that this SOA saves the ViewModelObject instead of model object, and this SOA supports dynamic compound properties. In addition to checking if the object and the properties are modifiable, if the property is dynamic compound property, this SOA also validates if the traversal path of the dynamic compound property is same as when properties was queries from server during display, if it is, then editing is not allowed. loadViewModelForEditing operation will be deprecated.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::loadViewModelForEditing2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The last save date for each of the view model objects.
The following partial errors may be returned:

302021: The input object is not modifiable.
302022: The property is not modifiable.
302024. The traversal path of dynamic compound property has changed

OperationParameter.description: A List of LoadViewModelForEditingInfo structures which provide input information for loading the editable information. It includes the list of view model properties whose editable information is to be loaded.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation provides information about the current user's Teamcenter session and data required for Teamcenter Software Analytics processing.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getTCSessionAnalyticsInfo
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The information of the current user's session and an instance of analytics object required to gather nonsensitive information. All returned objects are included in plain objects list of the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141052 The extraInfo input parameter is invalid.
    • 141053 The operation to retrieve the user's session information failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.

OperationParameter.description:
A list of strings that specify what should be included in the extra information in the response. If an empty list is passed, all the possible information would be included; If some string are valid and some are not, only the valid strings will be included; If all strings are invalid, then the map in the response will be empty. Valid string for this information are:

    • "AWC_StartupPreferences"
    • "AWC_StartupTypes"
    • "DefaultDateFormat"
    • "TCServerVersion"
    • "AWServerVersion"
    • "hasProjects"
    • "typeCacheLMD"
    • "WorkspaceId"
    • "AWC_PostLoginStages"
OperationParameter.name: extraInfo

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation routes a search request to a specific provider specified as providerName in the searchInput structures.

The framework allows a custom solution to be able to provide a new specific provider to collect data, perform sorting and filtering. The provider can be a User Inbox retriever or Full Text searcher, for example. The new data provider can be encapsulated via a new runtime business object from Fnd0BaseProvider class. The implementation is done using its fnd0performSearch operation.

RuntimeBusinessObject
---- Fnd0BaseProvider (foundation template)
-------- Fnd0GetChildrenProvider(foundation template)
-------- Awp0FullTextSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Awp0TaskSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Aos0TestProvider (aosinternal template)
-------- etc.

This operation provides a common interface to send the request to and receive the response from a new data provider. Ultimately it allows common framework in UI to support filter, pagination, and sorting.

This operation allows the caller to send the search input, filter values, and sorting data. These input values are then to be passed to the fnd0performSearch operation on the server to collect, sort, and filter its results.

The first two input parameters are important. The first input is the provider name. This is a string to represent the type name of RuntimeBusinessObject which this request should be routed to. If the template that contains the class is not installed, a partial error 217016 is returned. The second input is the search input map. The key is different per each provider. For example, for Full Text searcher, the input key would be a searchString. For User Inbox retriever, the input key would be an Inbox Type. The fnd0performSearch implementation for each provider takes into account the key name as it is used to store the values in OperationInput object.

The internal property name is passed as part of search input to allow grouping of business objects. The grouping allows for added functionality such as color coding, etc. If no internal property name is passed, default value is assumed as "object_type" to group the business objects.

If new list of column config data is passed in to be saved, it will get saved in the database for the login user scope. This will be done prior to performing the search.

The column configuration input has the criteria needed to query for the columns configured for the provided client and client scope URI. The final list of columns are identified based on the types returned back in the search results and the operation type (Union / Intersection / Configured ) configured for the client scope URI. Finally the determined column attributes and the attributes to be inflated passed in as part of search input criteria are combined. This combined list of attributes along with the business objects found during search are added to the Service data.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Finder::performSearchViewModel2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The search results, search filters for each search filter field based on the search results, and search filter categories ordered by filter priority. The search filters contains internal and their display values. The ObjectsGroupedByProperty object containing the internal property name, a map of business object and its associated property group unique identifier, and a list of unmatched business objects is also returned. The thresholdCrossed argument, indicates if the returned objects as search results contain all revisions (true) or only those revisions that conform to the current revision rule (false). The following partial errors may be returned:

* 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.

* 217017 Failed to perform search.

* 217018 The input list cannot be empty.

* 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.

* 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.

OperationParameter.description: The search input containing search criteria.
OperationParameter.name: searchInput

OperationParameter.description: The column configuration input criteria.
OperationParameter.name: columnConfigInput

OperationParameter.description: Column configuration data to be saved for the login user scope.
OperationParameter.name: saveColumnConfigData

OperationParameter.description: If true, the properties will be inflated.
OperationParameter.name: inflateProperties

OperationTemplate.description: This operation queries for the indexed objects matching the given input criteria. Criteria include application ID, timestamp, list of export or import statuses of the object and list of object class names. The maxCountObject can be specified to limit the count of matching object UIDs to be fetched by the query. The statusToUpdate will be used to update the records of the UIDs fetched by the query in ACCT_TABLE.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::getIndexedObjectsAndUpdate
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The list of indexed objects that matched the given input criteria.
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
    • 141061 Specified status is invalid.

OperationParameter.description:
The unique identifier that identifies the application that indexed the object.
":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID of the Full Text Search Indexer that indexes object data.
":SITECON_SYNC" is the application ID of the Site Consolidation applciation
OperationParameter.name: applicationID

OperationParameter.description: The application id used to gets the last processed date from subscription table to be used to filter the indexed objects. This is optional. If this value is specified it ignores the last exported date passed in as input to the operation.
OperationParameter.name: subscriptionAppID

OperationParameter.description:
The timestamp used to identify objects that have been indexed before the specified value.
If the value is NULLDATE, this field will be excluded from the query i.e., all objects, regardless of when they were indexed, are returned as long as they match the other criteria i.e application ID, status and class names.
OperationParameter.name: exportedDate

OperationParameter.description:
List of statuses of the objects to be queried from ACCT_TABLE. This is optional.
Supported values are
0 - status is ignored and not included as part of the query
1 - Replication Pending
2 - Replication Complete
3 - Dirty
4 - Import Failed
12 - Delta add pending
13 - Delta modify pending
14 - Delta delete pending
15 - Revision Rule refresh pending
16 - Add modify pending
17 - Modify relation pending
OperationParameter.name: statuses

OperationParameter.description: The list of class names of the objects to find. This is optional and list can be empty.
OperationParameter.name: classNames

OperationParameter.description: Count of objects to be returned back in response. If the value is 0, all objects found by the query will be returned.
OperationParameter.name: maxObjectCount

OperationParameter.description:
Status to update the records found by the query in ACCT_TABLE.
If the vaue is 0 the state of the records will not be updated.
Supported values are
0 - status is ignored and state of the records are not updated
1 - Replication Pending
2 - Replication Complete
3 - Dirty
4 - Import Failed
12 - Delta add pending
13 - Delta modify pending
14 - Delta delete pending
15 - Revision Rule refresh pending
16 - Add modify pending
17 - Modify relation pending
OperationParameter.name: statusToUpdate

OperationTemplate.description:
This service operation queries for the data to be synced and updates the state of those records in ACCT_TABLE. The Full Text Search Indexer which indexes Teamcenter data uses the information for further processing.

Queries for deleted objects that have been previously indexed after previous sync.
Updates these records in ACCT_TABLE with DELETE_PENDING state
Updates the :FTS_DEL_QRY app_id timetsamp in SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE

Queries for newly added objects after previous sync.
Inserts these records into ACCT_TABLE with ADD_MODIFY_PENDING state.
Updates the timestamp of the :FTS_ADD_QRY app_id in SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE

Queries for modifications via relations of indexed objects
Updates these records in ACCT_TABLE with MODIFY_REL_PENDING state.
Queries for modifications of indexed objects.
Updates these records in ACCT_TABLE with ADD_MODIFY_PENDING state
Updates the timestamp of the :FTS_SYNC app_id in SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE

The count of added or deleted or modified objects found by queries will be returned back through SyncInfo map. Any errors during queries or update of records will be reported as partial errors through ServiceData object.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::queryAndUpdateSyncData
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Returns a structure containg information generated during the operation. Also includes ServiceData object with partial errors.

    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
    • 141062 Failed to query and update added objects.
    • 141063 Failed to query and update deleted objects.
    • 141064 Failed to query and update modified objects.

OperationParameter.description: Input values.
OperationParameter.name: inputData

OperationTemplate.description: The operation looks for the Awp0TileCollection with current logged in user as scope and returns information about the Awp0Tile objects associated to it.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getCurrentUserGateway2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The information about the Awp0Tile objects for the current logged in user. The following partial errors may be returned:
    •     141029: Unable to find or create a Tile Collection with user scope.

OperationTemplate.description: This operation saves the modified view model properties for the given input objects and submits the objects to a workflow. The workflow is submitted only if all of the save operations are successful. If the save fails for a single object none of the input objects will be submitted to a workflow. This operation saves the ViewModelObject and supports dynamic compound properties.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::saveViewModelEditAndSubmitWorkflow2
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of Workflow process objects, one for each successfully saved and submitted objects is returned. A JSON string of view model objects and their last save dates. There are no objects returned in the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:
302021 - The input object is not modifiable.
302022 - The property is not modifiable.
302023 - The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
302024 - The traversal path of dynamic compound property has changed
219015 - The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.

OperationParameter.description: A list of SaveViewModelEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation unpins the objects represented by the input list of UIDs from the user’s Gateway.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::unpinObjects
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The updated information about the Awp0Tile objects for the current logged in user. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141029: Unable to find or create a Tile Collection with user scope.

OperationParameter.description: If true, the User’s gateway is returned in the response.
OperationParameter.name: returnGateway

OperationParameter.description: List of UIDs to unpin. The UID may represent any Teamcenter object type.
OperationParameter.name: uidsToUnpin

OperationTemplate.description: This operation updates the input list of Tile objects from the user’s Gateway. This includes moving Tile objects from one group to another, as well as updating properties on Tile objects such as the size and ordering of Tile objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::updateTiles
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The updated information about the Awp0Tile objects for the current logged in user. The following partial errors may be returned:

* 141029: Unable to find or create a Tile Collection with user scope.

OperationParameter.description: The Tile objects to update. Number of Tile objects must match the number of entries in the groupNames parameter.
OperationParameter.name: tiles

OperationParameter.description: The new group name for the TileGroup where the Tile object has moved, if an entry is empty, then the Tile shall remain in the same group. The number of groupName entries must match the number of Tile entries in the tiles parameter.
OperationParameter.name: groupNames

OperationTemplate.description: This operation fetches facet values in a paged fashion for a selected filter category. It also supports search on facet values to get matching facet values for a given text input.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Finder::performFacetSearch
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Returns:
The facet values for the selected search filter category based on the search results. The following partial errors may be returned:

* 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.

* 217017 Failed to perform search.

* 140232 Invalid property name.

* 140233 Invalid value for parameter maxToReturn. Only positive values are permissible.

* 140234 Invalid value for parameter startIndex. Negative values are non-permissible.

OperationParameter.description: It contains search criteria and search filter information.
OperationParameter.name: facetSearchInput

The thresholdCrossed argument, indicates if the returned objects as search results contain all revisions (true) or only those revisions that conform to the current revision rule (false). The following partial errors may be returned:

* 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.

* 217017 Failed to perform search.

* 217018 The input list cannot be empty.

* 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.

OperationParameter.description: The search input containing search criteria.
OperationParameter.name: searchInput

OperationParameter.description: The column configuration input criteria.
OperationParameter.name: columnConfigInput

OperationParameter.description: Column configuration data (Awp0::Soa::Internal::AWS2::_2016_03::Finder::SaveColumnConfigData) to be saved for the login user scope.
OperationParameter.name: saveColumnConfigData

OperationParameter.description: If true, the properties will be inflated (the properties will be loaded and fully populated).
OperationParameter.name: inflateProperties

OperationParameter.description: This flag decides if we want to populate ServiceData. If the flag is “true”, the service data is not populated and the inflateProperties flag is not honored in this case since inflating the properties would need the Service Data. This has been done for performance improvement.If the flag is “false”, the service data gets populated and the properties get inflated depending solely on the value of inflateProperties flag.
OperationParameter.name: noServiceData

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation exports Teamcenter business objects based on search results to the MSExcelX application. The operation allows caller to specify a list of objects to export or to specify if they want to export all objects from the search result.
If the caller chooses to export a list of objects then the object UIDs must be passed along with column configuration information. The order of the objects received will be the order of objects exported.
If the caller chooses to export all objects, then this operation requires searchInput object parameter to be populated which is used to perform a search and the result will be exported. The searchSortCriteria property will be used to sort the exported objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Finder::exportSearchResults
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
ExportSearchResultsResponse
The transient file read tickets of the exported file. The following partial errors may be returned:
141311 selectedObjectUIDs list cannot be empty when exporting selected objects.
141012 The supported application format is MSExcelX.
141313 The search input criteria cannot contain empty properties when exporting all objects.
141314 The column configuration input criteria cannot be empty.
141315 The search results were not exported because of an internal error.

OperationParameter.description: The search input containing search criteria.
OperationParameter.name: searchInput

OperationParameter.description: Effective column configuration for the client scope URI.
OperationParameter.name: columnConfig

OperationParameter.description: If true, all objects which match the search criteria are exported.
OperationParameter.name: exportAll

OperationParameter.description: UIDs of selected objects.
OperationParameter.name: selectedObjectUIDs

OperationParameter.description: The application format supported is: "MSExcelX”
OperationParameter.name: applicationFormat
