The search filters contains internal and their display values. The ObjectsGroupedByProperty object containing the internal property name, a map of business object and its associated property group unique identifier, and a list of unmatched business objects is also returned. The thresholdCrossed argument, indicates if the returned objects as search results contain all revisions (true) or only those revisions that conform to the current revision rule (false). The following partial errors may be returned:

* 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.

* 217017 Failed to perform search.

* 217018 The input list cannot be empty.

* 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.

* 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.

* 172010 : No client scope exists with the URI.

OperationParameter.description: The search input containing search criteria.
OperationParameter.name: searchInput

OperationParameter.description: The column configuration input criteria.
OperationParameter.name: columnConfigInput

OperationParameter.description: Column configuration data to be saved for the login user scope.
OperationParameter.name: saveColumnConfigData

OperationParameter.description: If true, the properties will be inflated.
OperationParameter.name: inflateProperties

OperationParameter.description: This flag decides if we want to populate ServiceData. If the flag is “true”, the service data is not populated and the inflateProperties flag is not honored in this case since inflating the properties would need the Service Data. This has been done for performance improvement.If the flag is “false”, the service data gets populated and the properties get inflated depending solely on the value of inflateProperties flag.
OperationParameter.name: noServiceData

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation exports either a given list of objects or the objects found through the given search input. If searchInput and objectsToExport are both present in the input, then objectsToExport will take precedence. The objects are exported in a tabular format, with the objects as the rows and the given attributesToExport as the columns. If an object does not contain an attribute in attributesToExport then the value that will be exported is an empty string. There is also no relation between attributesToExport and columnsToExclude from columnConfigInput.

This operation allows callers to specify export options, which determines the behavior of the export operation. The only supported export option for AW4.3 is "fileFormat":"MSExcel" but will be extended in future releases.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Finder::exportObjectsToFile
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
ExportObjectsToFileResponse
The file tickets of the exported file. The following partial errors may be returned:

• 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.
• 217017 Failed to perform search.
• 217018 The input list cannot be empty.
• 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.
• 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.
• 141361 The filter "<operation> <value>" could not be applied on "<column>" because “<reason>”.

OperationParameter.description: The search input containing search criteria.
OperationParameter.name: searchInput

OperationParameter.description: A list of UIDs of selected objects.
OperationParameter.name: objectsToExport

OperationParameter.description: A list of attributes that are available for export.
OperationParameter.name: attributesToExport

OperationParameter.description: The column configuration input criteria. This is used to obtain the default sort criteria when none is provided in searchInput.
OperationParameter.name: columnConfigInput

OperationParameter.description:
A list of options for export. Supported options are:
"fileFormat":"MSExcel", the objects and the given attributes will be exported to a table in excel.
OperationParameter.name: exportOptions

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation fetches the possible filter values (Facets) of a given column in a table. Each table in Active Workspace is typically backed by a provider, so the input of this operation is similar to performSearch operation’s searchInput request.
The framework allows a custom solution to be able to provide a new specific provider to collect data, perform sorting and filtering. The provider can be a User Inbox retriever or Full Text searcher, for example. The new data provider can be encapsulated via a new runtime business object from Fnd0BaseProvider class. The implementation is done using its fnd0performSearch operation.

RuntimeBusinessObject
---- Fnd0BaseProvider (foundation template)
-------- Fnd0GetChildrenProvider(foundation template)
-------- Awp0FullTextSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Awp0TaskSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Aos0TestProvider (aosinternal template)
-------- etc.

This operation provides a common interface to get Filter Facet values in a generic way from any data provider that is compatible with performSearch operation. This operation takes the data provider which is responsible for fetching the objects, a columnName one which the filter values need to be obtained, and a filter or query criteria which is used to refine the filter facet values. Once the query or filtering is complete, the ui values are obtained from the search results and are returned as the facet values.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Finder::getFilterValues
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A JSON string of the sorted list of unique facet values based on the query results from the data provider and the total unique facet values found in the search results. The following partial errors may be returned:

* 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.

* 217017 Failed to perform search.

* 217018 The input list cannot be empty.

* 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.

* 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.

* 141361 The filter "<operation> <value>" could not be applied on "<column>".

OperationParameter.description: The facet search input containing search criteria.
OperationParameter.name: filterFacetInput

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation retrieves the underlying Item or ItemRevision related to source business object.

Use Case:

If Item is attached to Folder in database, Active Workspace client displays the Item as configured ItemRevision. The displayed ItemRevision will be as per the revision rule set by the user. If specific ItemRevision is attached to Folder in database, that specific ItemRevision is always displayed, irrespective of revision rule set by user.

In such cases, underlying object in database is different from the object displayed on client. When user performs a operation on displayed ItemRevision, the actual operation happens on the object related in Teamcenter database.
For example, if a configured ItemRevision is cut, and its related Item is in database, the Item is likewise cut (from database). Similarly, when a specific ItemRevision is cut and the ItemRevision is in the database, only the ItemRevision is cut (from database). For business objects other than ItemRevision, if the object displayed is identical to object in database, the object in database is cut.

This operation returns actual objects in database for given list of displayed objects on client.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getRelatedObjsForConfiguredRevision
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of successfully fetched child objects with its parent object and relation information.
The following partial error may be returned:

•    38015        Unable to find property with given name.

OperationParameter.description: A list of RelatedObjectsInfo objects to get the related child object information.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation gets named column configuration information from the Teamcenter database.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::getNamedColumnConfigs
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The JSON string containing the named column configurations information.

Example:
"[
{
columnConfigName: 'LoadExampleName',
uid: 'LoadExampleUid',
isAdmin: true,
isModifiable: false,
isCurrent: true,
columnConfig: {}
},
{
columnConfigName: 'LoadExampleName2',
uid: 'LoadExampleUid2',
isAdmin: true,
isModifiable: false,
isCurrent: true,
columnConfig: {}
}
]"

Also, the ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while getting the data in the input structures. The following partial errors may be returned:
•302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
•302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.

OperationParameter.description: The column configuration input required to locate a named column configuration to be loaded on the client.
OperationParameter.name: namedColumnConfigInput

OperationParameter.description: The options for getting the named column configurations. Possible key-value pairs are "mostRecentlyUsed": "true" or "contains": "filterText".
OperationParameter.name: namedColumnConfigCriteria

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation will load the given named column configuration for a given user.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::loadNamedColumnConfig
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The JSON string containing the named column configurations information.

Example:
"{
        columnConfigName: 'LoadExampleName',
        uid: 'LoadExampleUid',
        isAdmin: true,
        isModifiable: false,
        isCurrent: true,
        columnConfig: {
            columnConfigId: 'LoadExampleId',
            operationType: 'Intersection',
            columns: [
                {
                    displayName: 'Name',
                    typeName: 'WorkspaceObject',
                    propertyName: 'object_name',
                    pixelWidth: 120,
                    columnOrder: 0,
                    hiddenFlag: false,
                    sortPriority: 1,
                    sortDirection: 'Ascending',
                    filterValue: {
                        operation: '',
                        values: []
                    },
                    filterDefinitionKey: '',
                    isFilteringEnabled: true,
                    dataType: 'String',
                    isFrozen: true
                }
            ]
        }
}"

Also, the ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while getting the data in the input structures. The following partial errors may be returned:
•302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
•302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.

OperationParameter.description: The uid of the named column configuration object to load.
OperationParameter.name: uid

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation updates the user's favorites by adding or removing the objects specified with the input.

Favorites are stored per user in the database as Teamcenter preference: "MyFavorites"

The operation takes list of objects and the action as input whether to add or remove and finalizes the complete list of favorites before they are saved to the database. This implies that the caller of the operation needs to send delta list of objects to add or remove to the user's favorites.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::modifyFavorites
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Any partial errors encountered during this operation are returned in the list of partial errors of the ServiceData.

    • 141352 An invalid action string passed to the operation. Valid values are "add" and "remove".

OperationParameter.description: A list of objects of type BusinessObject to be added or removed from the user's favorites.
OperationParameter.name: favorites

OperationParameter.description:
A string representing the action. Supported values are:
"add" – The list of objects to be added to the current user's favorites.
"remove" – The list of objects to be remove from the current user's favorites.
OperationParameter.name: action

OperationTemplate.description: This operation pins the objects represented by the input objects to the user’s Gateway.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::pinObjects
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141029: Unable to find or create a Tile Collection with user scope.

OperationParameter.description: List of PinObjectInput. PinObjectInput represents the information required to pin a BusinessObject to the User’s Gateway.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: Save the edits on the objects
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::saveEdit
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: Service data

OperationTemplate.description: Saves an XRT definition to the specified context. In this version, saving of injected datasets is not supported.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::saveXRT
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
All returned objects are included in the plain objects list of the ServiceData.

Partial Errors:
141107 - Returned if there is a failure saving the XRT.
141109 - Returned if DOCTYPE is not permitted in this XML document.

OperationParameter.description: The stylesheet information to save.
OperationParameter.name: dsInfo

OperationTemplate.description: The scratch table contains records for the new and deleted objects. The applications consuming this data will have their unique application ID and the last processed timestamp entries in subscription table. This operation deletes the records from the scratch table that are consumed by all the registered applications. The scratch table records whose last saved date is less than the minimum of the last processed date of subscription table will be deleted.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::cleanupScratchTable
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209     The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.

OperationTemplate.description: This operation deletes saved searches. The saved search is unpinned before deleted.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::deleteFullTextSavedSearch
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Returns Service Data with error if any.

The following partial error may be returned:
    • 141145 - Invalid type. Only Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects allowed.

OperationParameter.description: List of Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.
OperationParameter.name: objects

OperationTemplate.description: The accountability table contains records for the indexed objects. When the principal objects are deleted, the index is cleared but the records in the accountability table still exist. This operation deletes the records from the accountability table whose island UIDs and the application id match the given criteria.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::deleteIndexedIslands
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.

OperationParameter.description:
The unique identifier that identifies the application that indexed the object.
Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID of the Full Text Search Indexer that indexes object data.
OperationParameter.name: applicationID

OperationParameter.description: The list of exported objects UIDs that represent the index islands.
OperationParameter.name: indexIslandUIDs

OperationTemplate.description: This operation deletes the records of the given list of application IDs from the subscription table.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::deregisterApplicationIDs
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.

OperationParameter.description:
The list of application IDs to be deregistered from the subscription table.
Ex: ":FTS_REFRESH" is the application ID of the Full Text Search Indexer that is used to query for data to be re-indexed when there is a global impact.
OperationParameter.name: applicationIDs

OperationTemplate.description: Updates the subscription table with the application id and processed date time of an action during indexing process.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::updateIndexingStatus
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: Returns ServiceData with error if any.

OperationParameter.description: Input to keep track of Indexer status.
OperationParameter.name: indexerStatusInput

OperationTemplate.description: This operation updates the data islands that match the given input criteria with a status (1 - Replication Pending, 2 - Replication Complete, etc.) and exported date. Criteria include application ID, timestamp, and list of index island UIDs.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::FullTextSearch::updateIndexIslandStatus
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209     The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
    • 141061     Specified status is invalid.
    • 141062     Index Island UIDs list cannot be empty. Please provide a valid list.

OperationParameter.description:
The unique identifier that identifies the application that indexed the object.
Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID of the Full Text Search
OperationParameter.name: applicationID

OperationParameter.description: The list of exported object UIDs that represent the index islands. This list should not be empty.
OperationParameter.name: indexIslandUIDs

OperationParameter.description: The timestamp used to identify objects that have been indexed before the specified value. If the value is NULLDATE, the exported date field will not be updated.
OperationParameter.name: exportDate

OperationParameter.description:
The export or import status of the object.
Vaid values are
1 - Replication Pending
2 - Replication Complete
3 - Dirty
4 - Import Failed
OperationParameter.name: status

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation creates the named column configuration information in the Teamcenter database. Active Workspace client may use this information to populate columns of tables in various sublocations as the user navigates. Default named column configurations can be initially created by a utility during install.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::createNamedColumnConfig
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while managing the named column configurations. The following partial errors may be returned:
•302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
•302003 - Invalid object type name.
•302004 - Invalid property name.
•302005 - Invalid pixel width.
•302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.

OperationParameter.description: The column configuration input required to locate a named column configuration for create.
OperationParameter.name: namedColumnConfigInput

OperationParameter.description: A list of column configuration data including information about each column to be created.
OperationParameter.name: columns

OperationParameter.description: The options for managing the named column configuration. Possible key-value pairs are “Group”-“Engineering” or “operationType”-“Union”.
OperationParameter.name: namedColumnConfigCriteria

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation deletes the given named column configuration object from the Teamcenter database.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::deleteNamedColumnConfig
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while deleting the named column configuration. The following partial errors may be returned:
• 515110 - The instance is referenced.

OperationParameter.description: The uid of the named column configuration object to delete.
OperationParameter.name: uid

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation saves the named column configuration information to the Teamcenter database. Active Workspace client may use this information to populate columns of tables in various sublocations as the user navigates.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::saveNamedColumnConfig
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while managing the named column configurations. The following partial errors may be returned:
•302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
•302003 - Invalid object type name.
•302004 - Invalid property name.
•302005 - Invalid pixel width.
•302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.

OperationParameter.description: The uid of the named column configuration object to save.
OperationParameter.name: uid

OperationParameter.description: Column configuration data including information about each column to be created or saved.
OperationParameter.name: columns

OperationParameter.description: The options for managing the named column configuration. Possible key-value pairs are “Group”-“Engineering” or “operationType”-“Union”.
OperationParameter.name: namedColumnConfigCriteria

OperationTemplate.description: This service operation saves column configuration information to the Teamcenter database. A Teamcenter client may use this information to render the user interface as the user navigates the Teamcenter client. Default column configurations are initally created by an utility during install. This operation will modify the default column configuration for the site, group, role or a specific user.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::saveUIColumnConfigs
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while saving the data in the input structures. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
    • 302003 - Invalid object type name.
    • 302004 - Invalid property name.
    • 302005 - Invalid pixel width.
    • 302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.

OperationParameter.description: List of column configurations.
OperationParameter.name: columnConfigurations

Operation.description: Creates the Advanced Search Input business object (Awp0AdvancedSearchInput). This object is used to populate values for the advanced query name or the quick search name. Based on the quick search name or advanced query name that is populated on this object, the quick search criteria or advanced search criteria fields are shown in the client UI. The Advanced Search object that is created also has a property with the default quick search name populated.
Operation.name: createAdvancedSearchInput
Operation.returnDescription:
The Advanced Search Input object and the Service Data. The Service Data contains newly created Advanced Search Input in the Created list, while the Saved query object representing the default quick search name is in the Plain list. The Service Data can contain the following partial errors.
    • 141205 - The value provided for the preference Default_Quick_Access_Query is invalid.
    • 141206 - The preference Default_Quick_Access_Query is not set.
    • 141204 - Advanced Search is not available because of an internal failure.
Operation.useCase: User clicks on the advanced search link in Active Workspace UI. This brings up a panel that is used to collect the initial user input for the quick search name or the advanced search name. This panel is represented by the Advanced Search Input business object and its properties that is instantiated by this operation.

Operation.description: Creates the Advanced Query Criteria business object (Awp0AdvancedQueryCriteria). This object is used to populate criteria for currently selected Saved Query. The Query Criteria are represented by dynamic runtime business objects. This is necessary because the query criteria fields change deepending on which Saved Query is selected by the user. Advanced Query Criteria is the parent business object of the dynamic runtime business objects.
Operation.name: getSelectedQueryCriteria
Operation.returnDescription:
The Advanced Query Criteria object and the Service Data. The Service Data contains newly created Advanced Query Criteria in the Created list.The Service Data can contain the following partial errors.
    • 141207 - "Selected Query" could not load because of an internal failure.
Operation.useCase: Advanced Search panel is loaded and saved queries are populated in the Advanced Query field. User selects any of the listed query, this will retrieve the criteria defined for that query from the database. The criteria will be shown on the Advanced Search panel as user input fields so that the user can enter the appropriate values to execute the advanced search. This will be called after the getAdvancedSearchInput operation.

ParameterInfo.description: Currently selected saved query by user.

Operation.description: This operation clears the objects in the history and returns the objects that were present in the history.
Operation.name: clearHistory
Operation.returnDescription: A structure containing the objects in the history.

Operation.description: This operation returns available workspaces. The list of workspaces is populated based on input criteria (e.g. current user session ).
Operation.name: getAvailableWorkspaces
Operation.returnDescription:
This operation returns available workspaces based on the service operation input.

The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141225 - The retrieval of the available workspaces has failed due to an internal error. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog for more information.
    • 141226 - The mandatory key 'scope' is missing in the filter parameters.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: Click on the current workspace user is working in.
In Active Workspace, when user clicks on the header context link (which shows current workspace) the getAvailableWorkspaces operation will be called. The client will show a list of available workspaces to the user to choose a value from.

Use Case 2: Show list of all workspaces in primary workarea.
In ActiveWorkspace, when user navigates to "workspaces" sublocation, primary work-area needs to display all the workspaces in the system. In order to populate the primary workarea, the getAvailableWorkspaces call is invoked. The returned data is parsed and processed in order to display list of all workspaces into the system.

ParameterInfo.description:
The map of (string, string) filter parameters.
Following are the possible values.
1. Key "scope", Value could be "session" or "all". If the value is passed as "session", only the workspaces which match other filter parameters and apply to current user session (group role combination) will be returned. If it is passed as "all", all the workspaces in the system matching other filters will be returned regardless of existing user session.
2. Key "group", Value needs to be the group ID to which associated workspaces needs to be loaded. Key "group" is optional. If it is not present in operation input, all the workspaces matching other filters will be returned. 3. Key "role", Value needs to be the role ID to which associated workspaces needs to be loaded. Key "role" is optional. If it is not present in operation input, all the workspaces matching other filters will be returned.

Operation.name: getChildren
Operation.returnDescription: returns children

Operation.description: The operation looks for the Awp0TileCollection with current logged in user as scope and returns information about the Awp0Tile objects associated to it.
Operation.name: getCurrentUserGateway
Operation.returnDescription:
The information about the Awp0Tile objects for the current logged in user. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141029: Unable to find or create a Tile Collection with user scope.
Operation.useCase:
This operation is suited to display the Awp0Tile objects on the Active Workspace client gateway page. The Awp0Tiles that are returned by this operation are the ones which are configured for the logged in user based on current group, role, and project.

Display the user specific Awp0Tile objects during startup
    • User logs into Active Workspace.
    • Active Workspace invokes getCurrentUserGateway operation.
    • Displays the Awp0Tile that are configured for the logged in user.


Display the user specific Awp0Tile objects during context change
    • User changes the group/role/project in Active Workspace.
    • Active Workspace invokes getCurrentUserGateway operation.
    • Displays the Awp0Tile that are configured for the logged in user based on current group, role, and project.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is replaced by the getCurrentUserGateway2.

Operation.description: The operation looks for the Awp0TileCollection with current logged in user as scope and returns information about the Awp0Tile objects associated to it.
Operation.name: getCurrentUserGateway2
Operation.returnDescription:
The information about the Awp0Tile objects for the current logged in user. The following partial errors may be returned:
    •     141029: Unable to find or create a Tile Collection with user scope.
Operation.useCase:
This operation is suited to display the Awp0Tile objects on the Active Workspace client gateway page. The Tile objects that are returned by this operation are the ones which are configured for the logged in user based on current group, role, and project.

Display the user specific Awp0Tile objects during startup
1. User logs into Active Workspace.
2. Active Workspace invokes getCurrentUserGateway2 operation.
3. Displays the groups of Tile objects that are configured for the logged in user.

Display the user specific Awp0Tile objects during context change
1. User changes the group/role/project in Active Workspace.
2. Active Workspace invokes getCurrentUserGateway2 operation.
3. Displays the groups of Tile objects that are configured for the logged in user based on current group, role, and project.

Operation.description:
This operation returns the dataset type and reference information for a set of file extensions. This operation also returns the default paste relation for each Dataset type returned for the given input parent. Named references are Teamcenter objects that related to a specific data file.

For each file extension, it is possible that it belongs to multiple dataset types. For such cases, all matching dataset types will be returned using the file extension as the key in the GetDatasetTypesWithDefaultRelationOutput structure.

The order of file extension in the GetDatasetTypesWithDefaultRelationOutput structure may be different than the order of file extension input. This operation inserts file extensions that match the default dataset type defined in AE_default_dataset_type preference at the beginning of the list.

This operation uses the TC_Dataset_Import_Exclude_Wildcard preference to determine if wildcard may be used in file extension input. If the preference is set and file extension is set to asterisk, this operation will return all data set types that allow wildcards in its name reference in Teamcenter.

Default paste relation for each Dataset type returned is determined by evaluating preferences __default_relation and/or _default_relation. The preference __default_relation takes precedence over _default_relation.

Details about these four preferences can be found in Preferences and Environment (Variables Reference Configuration preferences, under Data management preferences).
Operation.name: getDatasetTypesWithDefaultRelation
Operation.returnDescription:
Dataset type and reference information for each fileExtensions input and default paste relation for each Dataset type for the given input parent.
The following partial errors may be returned:
214135 :The input file extension does not exist.

ParameterInfo.description: Parent object which acts as primary for the Dataset. If parent object is null or invalid then default relation is not populated with the response.
List of file extensions used to get the named reference information, such as "doc" or "txt".

Operation.description: Find the dataset types that has named reference with the given file extension
Operation.name: getDatasetTypesWithFileExtension

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and replaced by Teamcenter::Soa::Core::DataManagement::getDatasetTypesWithFileExtension from the _2012_10 namespace.

ParameterInfo.description: File extensions

Operation.description: This operation returns the declarative UI definition generated from stylesheets for each input object. It first gets the stylesheets for each input object, then converts them into declarative view defintions which can be rended as HTML page by declarative UI framework.
Operation.name: getDeclarativeStyleSheets
Operation.returnDescription:
The data required in order for the client to build the declarative UI and present the information to the user. This data includes the declarative view to render, the view model to be bound to view, and the localized values of certain text labels to be presented in declarative UI.

All returned objects are included in the plain objects list of the ServiceData.

The following partial errors may be returned:
141108 The operation to retrieve the declarative UI definition from stylesheet information has failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: Load Create Object Panel
When creating an object of selected type in creation panel, the getDeclarativeStyleSheets SOA operation is invoked, and the returned data is parsed/processed in the declarative UI framework to display the creation panel.

Use Case 2: Show Object Info
When an object is selected in ActiveWorkspace, a user may choose the "Show Object Info" command. When executed, a panel slides out from the right hand side of the application, and the selected objects data is presented. In order to populate the panel, the getDeclarativeStyleSheets call is invoked and the returned data is parsed and processed in order to build the declarative UI.

ParameterInfo.description: If true, this operation will process the data for the entire XRT. If false, this operation will only process the target page which is defined on the input structure.
Input data for which to retrieve declarative UI definition from stylesheets.

Operation.description:
This operation returns the value of default relation preference for given combination of primary and secondary object types as defined by Teamcenter Administrator. The entire type hierarchy of secondary object type is traversed while determining the default relation preference. The preference format should be as follows:
<primary_object_type>_<secondary_object_type>_default_relation

If the secondary object type is passed as empty, then the preference format should be as follows:
<primaty_object_type>_default_relation
Operation.name: getDefaultRelation
Operation.returnDescription:
GetDefaultRelationResponse containing list of GetDefaultRelationInfo objects. Each GetDefaultRelationInfo object holds the primary and secondary type as well as the default relation information
    • 1700 - The preference "<PREF_NAME>" cannot be found.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: Preference for Primary and Secondary object type default relation exists
Teamcenter Administrator defines the default relation betweeen ItemRevision and DocumentRevision to be IMAN_manifestation through the following preference:

ItemRevision_DocumentRevision_default_relation : IMAN_ manifestation

When getDefaultRelation operation of DataManagement service is invoked passing primary object type as "ItemRevision" and secondary object type as "DocumentRevision", the response returned is "IMAN_manifestation".

Use Case 2: Preference for Primary and Parent of Secondary object type default relation exists
Teamcenter Administrator defines the default relation between ItemRevision and DocumentRevision to be IMAN_manifestation through the following preference:

ItemRevision_DocumentRevision_default_relation : IMAN_ manifestation

When getDefaultRelation operation of DataManagement service is invoked passing primary object type as "ItemRevision" and secondary object type as "EmailRevision", the operation will check preference value for given combination of types. In case the preference is not defined for given pair, the operation will try finding preference value for combination of "ItemRevision" and each type in "EmailRevision" business object's type hierarchy. EmailRevision inherits DocumentRevision and since the preference for primary type as "ItemRevision" and secondary type as "DocumentRevision" is defined, the default relation in response is returned as "IMAN_manifestation".

Use Case 3: Preference for Primary object type default relation exists
Teamcenter Administrator defines the default relation for ItemRevision to be IMAN_specification through the following preference:

ItemRevision_default_relation : IMAN_ specification

When getDefaultRelation operation of DataManagement service is invoked passing primary object type as "ItemRevision" and secondary object type as "DocumentRevision", the operatin will check for preference value for input types. In case the preference value for given combination and any combination from secondary type hierarchy is not found, the operation will return preference value for "ItemRevision_default_relation" as "IMAN_specification".

ParameterInfo.description: List of GetDefaultRelationIn objects with each object holding the primary and secondary object type.

Operation.description: This operation returns the objects in the history.
Operation.name: getHistory
Operation.returnDescription: A structure containing the objects in the history.

Operation.description: This operation returns the proposed values to act as initial values when a new row object needs to be added to the table. User can then do further modification as needed, and perform save operation to create the row object in the database.
Operation.exceptionCondition: 141156 An error has occurred while creating initial row values of type tablePropertyName. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.
Operation.name: getInitialTableRowData
Operation.returnDescription: The information that can be used to create a row of the requested object.
Operation.useCase: When user clicks on the add button for table property, client can add a temporary row showing some of the system generated properties populated. Property value generation will honor related LOVs, naming rules, default values etc. The newly added row should behave as if user has added a new row. User can then perform save to make the row persist in the database.

ParameterInfo.description: The object that defines the table property
The name of the table property for which a new row is to be added

Operation.description:
This operation retrieves the underlying Item or ItemRevision related to source business object.

Use Case:

If Item is attached to Folder in database, Active Workspace client displays the Item as configured ItemRevision. The displayed ItemRevision will be as per the revision rule set by the user. If specific ItemRevision is attached to Folder in database, that specific ItemRevision is always displayed, irrespective of revision rule set by user.

In such cases, underlying object in database is different from the object displayed on client. When user performs a operation on displayed ItemRevision, the actual operation happens on the object related in Teamcenter database.
For example, if a configured ItemRevision is cut, and its related Item is in database, the Item is likewise cut (from database). Similarly, when a specific ItemRevision is cut and the ItemRevision is in the database, only the ItemRevision is cut (from database). For business objects other than ItemRevision, if the object displayed is identical to object in database, the object in database is cut.

This operation returns actual objects in database for given list of displayed objects on client.
Operation.name: getRelatedObjsForConfiguredRevision
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of successfully fetched child objects with its parent object and relation information.
The following partial error may be returned:

•    38015        Unable to find property with given name.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of RelatedObjectsInfo objects to get the related child object information.

Operation.description: This operation returns the stylesheets and the required data to present that stylesheet for each input object.
Operation.name: getStyleSheet
Operation.returnDescription:
The data required in order for the client to build the UI and present the information to the user. This data includes the stylesheet to present, the properties on the object to render, the children to present, the properties on those children, thumbnail file tickets, the page to render, and the localized values of certain text labels to be presented in UI.

All returned objects are included in the plain objects list of the ServiceData.

The following partial errors may be returned:
141103 The operation to retrieve the stylesheet information has failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: Open an object in ActiveWorkspace.
When an object is selected in ActiveWorkspace, the user may choose to invoke the open operation. When that operation is executed the getStylesheet call is invoked and the Stylesheet is processed in order to display the data to the user.

Use Case 2: List view with Summary
When an object is selected in the ActiveWorkspace navigator, when in list view with summary mode, the getStyleSheet SOA operation is invoked, and the returned data is parsed/processed in order to present the data to the user in the Summary panel.

Use Case 3: Show Object Info
When an object is selected in ActiveWorkspace, a user may choose the "Show Object Info" command. When executed, a panel slides out from the right hand side of the application, and the selected objects data is presented. In order to populate the panel, the getStylesheet call is invoked and the returned data is parsed and processed in order to build the UI.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation does not support the more than 31 XRT pages. Use the getStyleSheet opeation from the _2016_14 namespace instead.

ParameterInfo.description: If true, this operation will process the data for the entire XRT. If false, this operation will only process the target page which is defined on the input structure.
Input data for which to retrieve stylesheets.

Operation.description: The operation returns the column configuration and Table View Model properties for the input object UIDs.
Operation.name: getTableViewModelProperties
Operation.returnDescription:
Returns the column configuration along with the properties for each of the object passed in input as JSON string. Any failures will be returned in the ServiceData list of partial errors.

The following partial errors may be returned:
236002 - The requested object does not exist. Properties for the requested object cannot be retrieved.

172003 - The object type does not exist.

172010 - The client scope URI does not exists.

141114 -The parameter passed in is not supported.

141115 - The value for the parameter is not valid.
Operation.useCase:
Usecase 1: When the user opens a structure in the content tab and switch to table mode. The column configuration and related properties need to be fetched.

Usecase 2: When a structure is opened in the tree mode. The column configuration and related properties need to be fetched.

ParameterInfo.description: The input to the operation is list of the object UIDs and client scope URIs for which the Table data is to be fetched.

Operation.description: This operation provides information about the current user's Teamcenter session and data required for Teamcenter Software Analytics processing.
Operation.name: getTCSessionAnalyticsInfo
Operation.returnDescription:
The information of the current user's session and an instance of analytics object required to gather nonsensitive information. All returned objects are included in plain objects list of the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141052 The extraInfo input parameter is invalid.
    • 141053 The operation to retrieve the user's session information failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.
Operation.useCase: Use Case 1: After the user logs into Active Workspace this operation is invoked by the Active Workspace client to get information related to the user session like Groups, Projects, the Teamcenter Server version, platform type,License type, preference related to the time interval and product excellence agreement as required by analytics.

ParameterInfo.description:
A list of strings that specify what should be included in the extra information in the response. If an empty list is passed, all the possible information would be included; If some string are valid and some are not, only the valid strings will be included; If all strings are invalid, then the map in the response will be empty. Valid string for this information are:

    • "AWC_StartupPreferences"
    • "AWC_StartupTypes"
    • "DefaultDateFormat"
    • "TCServerVersion"
    • "AWServerVersion"
    • "hasProjects"
    • "typeCacheLMD"
    • "WorkspaceId"
    • "AWC_PostLoginStages"

Operation.description: This operation gets information about the current user's Teamcenter session.
Operation.name: getTCSessionInfo
Operation.returnDescription: Details about the current user's Teamcenter session information. All returned objects are included in plain list of the ServiceData.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and replaced by Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getTCSessionAnalyticsInfo.

Operation.description: This operation gets information about the current user's Teamcenter session.s
Operation.name: getTCSessionInfo2
Operation.returnDescription: Details about the current user's Teamcenter session information. All returned objects are included in plain objects list of the ServiceData.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and replaced by Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getTCSessionAnalyticsInfo.

The additional information provided in getTCSessionInfo3 as compared to getTCSessionInfo2 is a map of extra information. Any new information that needs to be passed to the client will be put in this map.
Operation.name: getTCSessionInfo3

The information of the current user's session. All returned objects are included in plain objects list of the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:
- 141052: "Name of parameter" is an invalid string in the list of requested information. Valid values are "Value1, Value2, Value3".
- 141053: The operation to retrieve the user's session information failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.
Operation.useCase: After the user logs in to Active Workspace this operation is invoked by the Active Workspace client to get information related to the user session like Groups, Projects, and the Teamcenter Server version.

If an empty list is passed, all the possible information would be included; If some string are valid and some are not, only the valid strings would be included; If all strings are invalid, then the map in the response would be empty.

The client location, or empty string if undefined.
