Operation.description: Get the Site, Group/Role and User Gateways for the current logged in user.
Operation.name: getUserGatewayXMLs
Operation.returnDescription: The contents of the Gateway file definitions.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and replaced by Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getCurrentUserGateway.

Operation.description: This operation returns the dataset, file and relevant viewer data for given combination of input object, dataset and direction by processing the viewer preference set by Teamcenter Administrator. Datasets associated with input object are retrieved and sorted based on the values of viewer preference. Thereafter, appropriate dataset is identified using the input dataset and direction. The corresponding file and viewer information along with dataset is returned in the response.
Operation.name: getViewerData
Operation.returnDescription:
GetViewerDataResponse object containing list of GetViewerDataOutput objects. Each GetViewerDataOuput object holds the output dataset and list of ViewData objects. Each ViewData object contains the ImanFile, the read fmsTicket for ImanFile and viewer to be rendered on the client.

    • 1700 - The preference "" cannot be found.

ParameterInfo.description: List of GetViewerDataIn objects.

Operation.description: This service operation is provided to get property values of instances outside of the current object property policy for a particular business object.This operation is an enhanced version of the getProperties service operation and allows for retrieving values of dynamic compound properties as well.
Operation.name: getViewModelProperties
Operation.returnDescription:
Objects for which properties could be successfully retrieved are returned as ViewModelObject structures along with corresponding ViewModelPropertyDescriptor structures. Any failures will be returned with the input object mapped to the error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors.

The following errors are returned as partial errors if there is an error in retrieving values for the input properties
236002 - The tag is invalid. Properties for the requested object cannot be retrieved.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: Open an object in ActiveWorkspace.
When an object is selected in ActiveWorkspace, the user may choose to invoke the open operation. When that operation is executed the getViewModelProperties call is executed to fetch required properties.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of business objects for which property values are requested.
A list of attribute/property name strings for which values are needed. Properties can include dynamic compound properties as well.

Operation.description: This service operation is provided to get property values of instances outside of the current object property policy for a particular business object. This operation is an enhanced version of the getProperties service operation and allows for retrieving values of dynamic compound properties as well.
Operation.name: getViewModelProperties2
Operation.returnDescription:
Objects for which properties could be successfully retrieved are returned as JSON string. Any failures will be returned with the input object mapped to the error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors.

The following errors are returned as partial errors if there is an error in retrieving values for the input propertiesThe following partial errors may be returned:

236002 - The object is invalid. Properties for the requested object cannot be retrieved.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: Open an object in ActiveWorkspace.
When an object is selected in ActiveWorkspace, the user may choose to invoke the open operation. When that operation is executed the getViewModelProperties call is executed to fetch required properties.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of business objects for which property values are requested. All business object types are supported.
A list of attribute/property names strings for which values are needed. Properties can include dynamic compound properties as well.

Configuration parameters of this service operation,the following are the possible values:
1. Key "supportsCardinality", value could be "true or "false", if value is true, multiple view model objects will be returned if dynamic compounds properties traverses to multiple source objects.

Operation.description: This SOA method ensures that the properties can be edited, and returns the last save date of the related objects for optimistic edit
Operation.name: loadDataForEditing

Operation.description: This SOA method ensures that the properties can be edited, and returns the last save date of the related objects for optimistic edit
Operation.name: loadDataForEditing
Operation.returnDescription:
The last save date for each of the objects and the table property values.
The following partial errors may be returned:

302021: The input object is not modifiable.
302022: The property is not modifiable.

ParameterInfo.description: A List of LoadDataForEditingInfo structures which provide input information for loading the editable information. It includes the list of property names whose editable information is to be loaded.

Operation.description: This method ensures that the properties can be edited, and returns the last save date of the related objects for optimistic edit. This service operation is similar to loadDataForEditing service operation, the difference is that this operation saves the ViewModelObject instead of model object, and this operation supports dynamic compound properties. If the property is dynamic compound property, this operation checks if the traversal path on server is same as the input traversal path , if it is not the same, then editing is not allowed.
Operation.name: loadViewModelForEditing
Operation.returnDescription:
The last save date for each of the view model objects.
The following partial errors may be returned:
302021: The input object is not modifiable.
302022: The property is not modifiable.
302024: The traversal path of dynamic compound property has changed.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of LoadViewModelForEditingInfo structures which provide input information for loading the editable information. It includes the list of view model properties whose editable information is to be loaded.

Operation.description: This method ensures that the properties can be edited and returns the last save date of the related objects for optimistic edit. This new operation is similar to the existing loadDataForEditing operation, the difference is that this SOA saves the ViewModelObject instead of model object, and this SOA supports dynamic compound properties. In addition to checking if the object and the properties are modifiable, if the property is dynamic compound property, this SOA also validates if the traversal path of the dynamic compound property is same as when properties was queries from server during display, if it is, then editing is not allowed. loadViewModelForEditing operation will be deprecated.
Operation.name: loadViewModelForEditing2
Operation.returnDescription:
The last save date for each of the view model objects.
The following partial errors may be returned:

302021: The input object is not modifiable.
302022: The property is not modifiable.
302024. The traversal path of dynamic compound property has changed

ParameterInfo.description: A List of LoadViewModelForEditingInfo structures which provide input information for loading the editable information. It includes the list of view model properties whose editable information is to be loaded.

Operation.description:
This operation updates the user's favorites by adding or removing the objects specified with the input.

Favorites are stored per user in the database as Teamcenter preference: "MyFavorites"

The operation takes list of objects and the action as input whether to add or remove and finalizes the complete list of favorites before they are saved to the database. This implies that the caller of the operation needs to send delta list of objects to add or remove to the user's favorites.
Operation.name: modifyFavorites
Operation.returnDescription:
Any partial errors encountered during this operation are returned in the list of partial errors of the ServiceData.

    • 141352 An invalid action string passed to the operation. Valid values are "add" and "remove".

ParameterInfo.description: A list of objects of type BusinessObject to be added or removed from the user's favorites.

A string representing the action. Supported values are:
"add" – The list of objects to be added to the current user's favorites.
"remove" – The list of objects to be remove from the current user's favorites.

Operation.description: This operation pins the objects represented by the input objects to the user’s Gateway.
Operation.name: pinObjects
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141029: Unable to find or create a Tile Collection with user scope.
Operation.useCase:
Pin an Object while not in the Gateway
1. User logs into Active Workspace.
2. User selects a previouslycreated BusinessObject object.
3. User chooses the “pin” command.
4. ActiveWorkspace invokes the pinObject service operation, providing the UID of the BusinessObject object to pin, along with any optional template ID or parameter information in the list of PinObjectInput structures.

ParameterInfo.description: List of PinObjectInput. PinObjectInput represents the information required to pin a BusinessObject to the User’s Gateway.

Operation.description: Save the edits on the objects
Operation.name: saveEdit
Operation.returnDescription: Service data

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This method is deprecated. Use saveEditAndSubmitToWorkflow instead of this operation.

Operation.description: This generic operation saves the modified properties for the given input objects and submits them to workflow. First it will perform the save operation and if completed successfully, will initiate a workflow process for all input objects.
Operation.name: saveEditAndSubmitToWorkflow
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of SaveEditAndSubmitOutput structures, one for each successfully saved and submitted objects is returned. There are no objects returned in the ServiceData. Following partial errors are returned in ServiceData.

    • 302021 The input object is not modifiable.
    • 302022 The property is not modifiable.
    • 302023 The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
    • 219015 The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.
Operation.useCase: User can modify the object(s) properties and submit the object(s) to workflow in one operation. This operation first saves the modified properties and then initiates the workflow process for all input objects.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of SaveEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.

Operation.description: This operation saves the modified properties for the given input objects and submits the objects to a workflow. The workflow is submitted only if all of the save operations are successful. If the save fails for a single object none of the input objects will be submitted to a workflow.
Operation.name: saveEditAndSubmitToWorkflow
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of SaveEditAndSubmitOutput structures, one for each successfully saved and submitted object is returned. . If object is submitted to workflow then newly created EPMJob business object is added to created list in ServiceData. The updated list contains modified revision business object which was passed as input. Following partial errors may be returned in ServiceData.
302021 The input object is not modifiable.
302022 The property is not modifiable.
302023 The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
219015 The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.
Operation.useCase: User can modify the object(s) properties and submit the object(s) to workflow in one operation. This operation first saves the modified properties and then initiates the workflow process for all input objects.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of SaveEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.

Operation.description: This operation saves the modified properties for the given input objects and submits the objects to a workflow. The workflow is submitted only if all of the save operations are successful. If the save fails for a single object none of the input objects will be submitted to a workflow.
Operation.name: saveEditAndSubmitToWorkflow
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of SaveEditAndSubmitOutput structures, one for each successfully saved and submitted object is returned. If object is submitted to workflow then newly created EPMJob business object is added to created list in ServiceData. The updated list contains modified revision business object which was passed as input. Following partial errors may be returned in ServiceData.

141021 The object <OBJECT_NAME> is not modifiable.
141022 The property <PROP_NAME> on the object <OBJECT_NAME> is not modifiable.
141023 The object <OBJECT_NAME> has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
219015 The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.
Operation.useCase: User can modify the object(s) properties and submit the object(s) to workflow in one operation. This operation first saves the modified properties and then initiates the workflow process for all input objects.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of SaveEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.

Operation.description: This operation saves the modified view model properties for the given input objects and submits the objects to a workflow. The workflow is submitted only if all of the save operations are successful. If the save fails for a single object none of the input objects will be submitted to a workflow. This operation is similar to the saveEditAndSubmitToWorkflow operation, the difference is that this operation saves the ViewModelObject instead of model object, and this operation supports dynamic compound properties.
Operation.name: saveViewModelEditAndSubmitWorkflow
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of SaveViewModelEditAndSubmitOutput structures, one for each successfully saved and submitted objects is returned. There are no objects returned in the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:
302021: The input object is not modifiable.
302022: The property is not modifiable.
302023: The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
302024: The traversal path of dynamic compound property has changed.
219015: The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.
Operation.useCase: User can modify the object(s) properties and submit the object(s) to workflow in one operation. This operation first saves the modified properties and then initiates the workflow process for all input objects.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of SaveViewModelEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.

Operation.description: This operation saves the modified view model properties for the given input objects and submits the objects to a workflow. The workflow is submitted only if all of the save operations are successful. If the save fails for a single object none of the input objects will be submitted to a workflow. This operation saves the ViewModelObject and supports dynamic compound properties.
Operation.name: saveViewModelEditAndSubmitWorkflow2
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of Workflow process objects, one for each successfully saved and submitted objects is returned. A JSON string of view model objects and their last save dates. There are no objects returned in the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:
302021 - The input object is not modifiable.
302022 - The property is not modifiable.
302023 - The object has been modified. Please refresh the object before editing. If the object is modified by another user since it was in edit mode, this error will be shown to the user.
302024 - The traversal path of dynamic compound property has changed
219015 - The workflow creation process has failed. For example, if operation could not find the workflow template defined for input Business object, workflow process creation will fail.
Operation.useCase: User can modify the object(s) properties and submit the object(s) to workflow in one operation. This operation first saves the modified properties and then initiates the workflow process for all input objects.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of SaveViewModelEditAndSubmitInfo structures which provides input information for saving the modified properties for the given input Business objects and whether these should subsequently be submitted to a workflow process or not.

Operation.description: Saves an XRT definition to the specified context. In this version, saving of injected datasets is not supported.
Operation.name: saveXRT
Operation.returnDescription:
All returned objects are included in the plain objects list of the ServiceData.

Partial Errors:
141107 - Returned if there is a failure saving the XRT.
141109 - Returned if DOCTYPE is not permitted in this XML document.
Operation.useCase: Save an XRT from the internal client called xrtFiddle.

ParameterInfo.description: The stylesheet information to save.

Operation.description: This operation unpins the objects represented by the input list of UIDs from the user’s Gateway.
Operation.name: unpinObjects
Operation.returnDescription:
The updated information about the Awp0Tile objects for the current logged in user. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141029: Unable to find or create a Tile Collection with user scope.
Operation.useCase:
This operation is suited to update the Tile objects on the Active Workspace client gateway page.

Unpin an Object while not in the Gateway
1. User logs into Active Workspace.
2. User selects a previously pinned BusinessObject object and chooses the “unpin” command.
3. Active Workspace invokes unpinObjects operation.
4. Using the unpinObjects’ response, Active Workspace displays the updated group of Tile objects that are configured for the logged in user.

Unpin a user specific Awp0TileObject
1. User logs into Active Workspace.
2. Active Workspace invokes getCurrentUserGateway2 operation.
3. Displays the groups of Tile objects that are configured for the logged in user.
4. User selects a Tile object and chooses the “unpin” command.
5. Active Workspace invokes unpinObjects operation.
6. Using the unpinObjects’ response, Active Workspace displays the updated group of Tile objects that are configured for the logged in user.

ParameterInfo.description: If true, the User’s gateway is returned in the response.
List of UIDs to unpin. The UID may represent any Teamcenter object type.

Operation.description: This operation adds objects to the history and/or removes objects from the history.
Operation.name: updateHistory
Operation.returnDescription: A structure containing the objects in the history if the history was requested to be returned.

ParameterInfo.description: The input structure to add objects to the history and/or remove objects from the history.

Operation.description: This operation updates the input list of Tile objects from the user’s Gateway. This includes moving Tile objects from one group to another, as well as updating properties on Tile objects such as the size and ordering of Tile objects.
Operation.name: updateTiles
Operation.returnDescription:
The updated information about the Awp0Tile objects for the current logged in user. The following partial errors may be returned:

* 141029: Unable to find or create a Tile Collection with user scope.
Operation.useCase:
This operation is suited to update the Tile objects on the Active Workspace client gateway page.

Update the user specific Awp0Tile objects.
1. User logs into Active Workspace.
2. Active Workspace invokes getCurrentUserGateway2 operation.
3. Displays the groups of Tile objects that are configured for the logged in user.
4. User selects a Tile object and updates the Tile’s size, order, and group.
5. Active Workspace invokes updateTiles operation.
6. Using the updateTiles’ response, Active Workspace displays the updated group of Tile objects that are configured for the logged in user.

ParameterInfo.description: The Tile objects to update. Number of Tile objects must match the number of entries in the groupNames parameter.

The new group name for the TileGroup where the Tile object has moved, if an entry is empty, then the Tile shall remain in the same group. The number of groupName entries must match the number of Tile entries in the tiles parameter.

Operation.description:
This operation exports either a given list of objects or the objects found through the given search input. If searchInput and objectsToExport are both present in the input, then objectsToExport will take precedence. The objects are exported in a tabular format, with the objects as the rows and the given attributesToExport as the columns. If an object does not contain an attribute in attributesToExport then the value that will be exported is an empty string. There is also no relation between attributesToExport and columnsToExclude from columnConfigInput.

This operation allows callers to specify export options, which determines the behavior of the export operation. The only supported export option for AW4.3 is "fileFormat":"MSExcel" but will be extended in future releases.
Operation.name: exportObjectsToFile
Operation.returnDescription:
ExportObjectsToFileResponse
The file tickets of the exported file. The following partial errors may be returned:

• 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.
• 217017 Failed to perform search.
• 217018 The input list cannot be empty.
• 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.
• 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.
• 141361 The filter "<operation> <value>" could not be applied on "<column>" because “<reason>”.
Operation.useCase: 1) User clicks the export command in an object set, which launches the export properties panel. User selects the desired properties to export and clicks the export button. Then the objects and the selected properties are exported into a table into Excel.

ParameterInfo.description: The search input containing search criteria.
A list of UIDs of selected objects.
A list of attributes that are available for export.
The column configuration input criteria. This is used to obtain the default sort criteria when none is provided in searchInput.

A list of options for export. Supported options are:
"fileFormat":"MSExcel", the objects and the given attributes will be exported to a table in excel.

Operation.description:
This operation exports Teamcenter business objects based on search results to the MSExcelX application. The operation allows caller to specify a list of objects to export or to specify if they want to export all objects from the search result.
If the caller chooses to export a list of objects then the object UIDs must be passed along with column configuration information. The order of the objects received will be the order of objects exported.
If the caller chooses to export all objects, then this operation requires searchInput object parameter to be populated which is used to perform a search and the result will be exported. The searchSortCriteria property will be used to sort the exported objects.
Operation.name: exportSearchResults
Operation.returnDescription:
ExportSearchResultsResponse
The transient file read tickets of the exported file. The following partial errors may be returned:
141311 selectedObjectUIDs list cannot be empty when exporting selected objects.
141012 The supported application format is MSExcelX.
141313 The search input criteria cannot contain empty properties when exporting all objects.
141314 The column configuration input criteria cannot be empty.
141315 The search results were not exported because of an internal error.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case:
1) The user selects single or multiple objects in Active Workspace client. The user clicks on the Export button and selects the option to export the selected objects and clicks on export, then the selected objects are exported to MsExcelX.
2) The user does not select any objects from list of search results in Active Workspace client. The user clicks on the Export button and selects the option to export all search results and clicks on export, then all objects are exported to MsExcelX.

ParameterInfo.description: The search input containing search criteria.
Effective column configuration for the client scope URI.
If true, all objects which match the search criteria are exported.
UIDs of selected objects.
The application format supported is: "MSExcelX”

Operation.description: Returns a list of objects for a specific class type with certain attributes and values.
Operation.name: findObjectsByClassAndAttributes2
Operation.returnDescription: Contains the objects requested.

ParameterInfo.description: Contains the attributes and values searched for

Operation.description: Finds all the tasks the user has.
Operation.name: findUsersTasks
Operation.returnDescription: A structure of tasks to track and perform.

Operation.description: This operation provides classification properties for a given WorkspaceObject(s).
Operation.name: getClassificationProps
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of WorkspaceObject and their corresponding classification properties. And a list of Classification attribute ID and their corresponding meta data.

The following partial error may be returned:
    • 515024 Invalid workspace object is passed in to this operation.
Operation.useCase: User wants to find classification properties for WorkspaceObjects. Each time a WorkspaceObject is classified in a classification class a classification object (icm0) is created. After searching for all the classification objects corresponding to a workspace object, user can find more information about the classification(s) of a workspace object. The operation getClassificationProps() can be used to get detailed information about the classification objects.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of WorkspaceObject for which classification properties are required.

If True, a union of found classification properties for the given WorkspaceObjects are returned.
If False, an intersection of found classification properties for the given WorkspaceObjects are returned.

Operation.description:
This operation fetches the possible filter values (Facets) of a given column in a table. Each table in Active Workspace is typically backed by a provider, so the input of this operation is similar to performSearch operation’s searchInput request.
The framework allows a custom solution to be able to provide a new specific provider to collect data, perform sorting and filtering. The provider can be a User Inbox retriever or Full Text searcher, for example. The new data provider can be encapsulated via a new runtime business object from Fnd0BaseProvider class. The implementation is done using its fnd0performSearch operation.

RuntimeBusinessObject
---- Fnd0BaseProvider (foundation template)
-------- Fnd0GetChildrenProvider(foundation template)
-------- Awp0FullTextSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Awp0TaskSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Aos0TestProvider (aosinternal template)
-------- etc.

This operation provides a common interface to get Filter Facet values in a generic way from any data provider that is compatible with performSearch operation. This operation takes the data provider which is responsible for fetching the objects, a columnName one which the filter values need to be obtained, and a filter or query criteria which is used to refine the filter facet values. Once the query or filtering is complete, the ui values are obtained from the search results and are returned as the facet values.
Operation.name: getFilterValues
Operation.returnDescription:
A JSON string of the sorted list of unique facet values based on the query results from the data provider and the total unique facet values found in the search results. The following partial errors may be returned:

* 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.

* 217017 Failed to perform search.

* 217018 The input list cannot be empty.

* 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.

* 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.

* 141361 The filter "<operation> <value>" could not be applied on "<column>".
Operation.useCase:
User clicks on "Name" column in Home Folder and clicks on Show Filters to expand the possible Filter facet values
A getFilterValues request will be made by passing in the needed query or filter criteria. In this case the provider name is "Awp0ObjectSetRowProvider". The provider is responsible for fetching the objects of the Home Folder, then it queries for the Name property of all the objects returned by the data provider and returns a unique sorted UI values for the "Name" column. These are the facet results and are shown in a list of checkboxes in a column menu in the client.

ParameterInfo.description: The facet search input containing search criteria.

Operation.description: This operation fetches facet values in a paged fashion for a selected filter category. It also supports search on facet values to get matching facet values for a given text input.
Operation.name: performFacetSearch
Operation.returnDescription:
Returns:
The facet values for the selected search filter category based on the search results. The following partial errors may be returned:

* 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.

* 217017 Failed to perform search.

* 140232 Invalid property name.

* 140233 Invalid value for parameter maxToReturn. Only positive values are permissible.

* 140234 Invalid value for parameter startIndex. Negative values are non-permissible.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: User clicks on unpopulated filter category
Only 200 classification filters are populated and available at the client. To get facet values for an unpopulated filter, a search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria. It queries for the facet values and returns to the client. The number of values to be returned is controlled by the input parameter maxToReturn.

Use Case 2: User performs search for filter values by entering text in filter category search input box.
If user types in a value in the filter box, a search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria. The input text will be passed into ‘stringValue’ parameter of the input searchFilterMap. It queries for the data and finds the facet values matching the input text. These facet values are included in the searchFilterMap of the response.

Use Case 3: User clicks on “More” to get next set of facet values
If ‘hasMoreFacetValues’ flag of the FacetSearchResponse is true, the client will make a search request for facet values. Facet values will be queried and returned based on the input criteria.

ParameterInfo.description: It contains search criteria and search filter information.

Operation.description:
This operation routes a search request to a specific provider specified as providerName in the searchInput structures

The framework allows a custom solution to be able to provide a new specific provider to collect data, perform sorting and filtering. The provider can be a User Inbox retriever or Full Text searcher, for example. The new data provider can be encapsulated via a new runtime business object from Fnd0BaseProvider class. The implementation is done using its fnd0performSearch operation.

RuntimeBusinessObject
---- Fnd0BaseProvider (foundation template)
-------- Fnd0GetChildrenProvider (foundation template)
-------- Awp0FullTextSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Awp0TaskSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Aos0TestProvider (aosinternal template)
-------- etc.
This operation provides a common interface to send the request to and receive the response from a new data provider. Ultimately it allows common framework in UI to support filter, pagination, and sorting.

This operation allows the caller to send the search input, filter values, and sorting data. These input values are then to be passed to the fnd0performSearch operation on the server to collect, sort, and filter its results.

The first two input parameters are important. The first input is the provider name. This is a string to represent the type name of RuntimeBusinessObject which this request should be routed to. If the template that contains the class is not installed, a partial error 217016 is returned. The second input is the search input map. The key is different per each provider. For example, for Full Text searcher, the input key would be a searchString. For User Inbox retriever, the input key would be an Inbox Type. The fnd0performSearch implementation for each provider takes into account the key name as it is used to store the values in OperationInput object.

The internal property name is passed as part of search input to allow grouping of business objects. The grouping allows for added functionality such as color coding, etc. If no internal property name is passed, default value is assumed as "object_type" to group the business objects.

If new list of column config data is passed in to be saved, it will get saved in the database for the login user scope. This will be done prior to performing the search.

The column configuration input has the criteria needed to query for the columns configured for the provided client and client scope URI. The final list of columns are identified based on the types returned back in the search results and the operation type( Union / Intersection / Configured ) configured for the client scope URI. Finally the determined column attributes and the attributes to be inflated passed in as part of search input criteria are combined. This combined list of attributes along with the business objects found during search are added to the Service data.
Operation.name: performSearch
Operation.returnDescription:
The search results, search filters for each search filter field based on the search results, and search filter categories ordered by filter priority. The search filters contains internal and their display values.

The ObjectsGroupedByProperty object containing the internal property name, a map of business object and its associated property group unique identifier, and a list of unmatched business objects is also returned.

The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 217016 Invalid search provider name.Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.
    • 217017 Failed to perform search.
    • 217018 The input list cannot be empty.
    • 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.
    • 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: User clicks on Inbox tile
A search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria. In this case the the provider name is "Awp0InboxProvider". It queries for the data and finds the effective columns for the client scope URI passed in through column config input. The results are finally shown in the view type selected in client. If table view is selected the returned effective columns will be shown.

Use Case 2: User performs search by entering a keyword in global search input box.
A search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria that includes the keyword user has typed in. In this case the the provider name is "Awp0FullTextSearchProvider". It queries for the data and finds the effective columns for the client scope URI passed in through column config input. The results are finally shown in the view type selected in client. If table view is selected the returned effective columns will be shown.

Use Case 3: User tries to save new column configuartions after performing search.
The new list of column configurations will be saved for the login user scope. Later the search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria that includes the keyword user had typed in. In this case the the provider name is "Awp0FullTextSearchProvider". It queries for the data and finds the effective columns for the client scope URI passed in through column config input. The results are finally shown in the view type selected in client. If table view is selected the returned effective columns will be shown.

ParameterInfo.description: The search input containing search criteria.
The column config input criteria.
Column config data to be saved for the login user scope.

If table view is selected the returned effective columns will be shown.

Use Case 2: User performs search by entering a keyword in global search input box.
A search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria that includes the keyword user has typed in. In this case the provider name is "Awp0FullTextSearchProvider". It queries for the data and finds the effective columns for the client scope URI passed in through column config input. The results are finally shown in the view type selected in client. If table view is selected the returned effective columns will be shown.

Use Case 3: User tries to save new column configurations after performing search.
The new list of column configurations will be saved for the login user scope. Later the search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria that includes the keyword user had typed in. In this case the provider name is "Awp0FullTextSearchProvider". It queries for the data and finds the effective columns for the client scope URI passed in through column config input. The results are finally shown in the view type selected in client. If table view is selected the returned effective columns will be shown.

---

ParameterInfo.description: The search input containing search criteria.
The column configuration input criteria.
Column configuration data to be saved for the login user scope.
If true, the properties will be inflated.

Operation.description:
This operation routes a search request to a specific provider specified as providerName in the searchInput structures.

The framework allows a custom solution to be able to provide a new specific provider to collect data, perform sorting and filtering. The provider can be a User Inbox retriever or Full Text searcher, for example. The new data provider can be encapsulated via a new runtime business object from Fnd0BaseProvider class. The implementation is done using its fnd0performSearch operation.

RuntimeBusinessObject
---- Fnd0BaseProvider (foundation template)
-------- Fnd0GetChildrenProvider(foundation template)
-------- Awp0FullTextSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Awp0TaskSearchProvider (aws template)
-------- Aos0TestProvider (aosinternal template)
-------- etc.

This operation provides a common interface to send the request to and receive the response from a new data provider. Ultimately it allows common framework in UI to support filter, pagination, and sorting.

This operation allows the caller to send the search input, filter values, and sorting data. These input values are then to be passed to the fnd0performSearch operation on the server to collect, sort, and filter its results.

The first two input parameters are important. The first input is the provider name. This is a string to represent the type name of RuntimeBusinessObject which this request should be routed to. If the template that contains the class is not installed, a partial error 217016 is returned. The second input is the search input map. The key is different per each provider. For example, for Full Text searcher, the input key would be a searchString. For User Inbox retriever, the input key would be an Inbox Type. The fnd0performSearch implementation for each provider takes into account the key name as it is used to store the values in OperationInput object.

The internal property name is passed as part of search input to allow grouping of business objects. The grouping allows for added functionality such as color coding, etc. If no internal property name is passed, default value is assumed as "object_type" to group the business objects.

If new list of column config data is passed in to be saved, it will get saved in the database for the login user scope. This will be done prior to performing the search.

The column configuration input has the criteria needed to query for the columns configured for the provided client and client scope URI. The final list of columns are identified based on the types returned back in the search results and the operation type (Union / Intersection / Configured ) configured for the client scope URI. Finally the determined column attributes and the attributes to be inflated passed in as part of search input criteria are combined. This combined list of attributes along with the business objects found during search are added to the Service data.
Operation.name: performSearchViewModel3
Operation.returnDescription:
The search results, search filters for each search filter field based on the search results, and search filter categories ordered by filter priority. The search filters contains internal and their display values. The ObjectsGroupedByProperty object containing the internal property name, a map of business object and its associated property group unique identifier, and a list of unmatched business objects is also returned. The thresholdCrossed argument, indicates if the returned objects as search results contain all revisions (true) or only those revisions that conform to the current revision rule (false). The following partial errors may be returned:

* 217016 Invalid search provider name. Either check the provider name or make sure the template containing the provider is installed.

* 217017 Failed to perform search.

* 217018 The input list cannot be empty.

* 217019 The internal property name cannot be empty.

* 217020 Business Object list cannot be empty.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: User clicks on Inbox tile
A search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria. In this case the provider name is "Awp0InboxProvider". It queries for the data and finds the effective columns for the client scope URI passed in through column config input. The results are finally shown in the view type selected in client. If table view is selected the returned effective columns will be shown.

Use Case 2: User performs search by entering a keyword in global search input box.
A search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria that includes the keyword user has typed in. In this case the provider name is "Awp0FullTextSearchProvider". It queries for the data and finds the effective columns for the client scope URI passed in through column config input. The results are finally shown in the view type selected in client. If table view is selected the returned effective columns will be shown.

Use Case 3: User tries to save new column configurations after performing search.
The new list of column configurations will be saved for the login user scope. Later the search request will be made by passing in the needed criteria that includes the keyword user had typed in. In this case the provider name is "Awp0FullTextSearchProvider". It queries for the data and finds the effective columns for the client scope URI passed in through column config input. The results are finally shown in the view type selected in client. If table view is selected the returned effective columns will be shown.

---

ParameterInfo.description: The search input containing search criteria.
The column configuration input criteria.
Column configuration data (Awp0::Soa::Internal::AWS2::_2016_03::Finder::SaveColumnConfigData) to be saved for the login user scope.
If true, the properties will be inflated (the properties will be loaded and fully populated).

This flag decides if we want to populate ServiceData. If the flag is “true”, the service data is not populated and the inflateProperties flag is not honored in this case since inflating the properties would need the Service Data. This has been done for performance improvement.If the flag is “false”, the service data gets populated and the properties get inflated depending solely on the value of inflateProperties flag.

Operation.description: The scratch table contains records for the new and deleted objects. The applications consuming this data will have their unique application ID and the last processed timestamp entries in subscription table. This operation deletes the records from the scratch table that are consumed by all the registered applications. The scratch table records whose last saved date is less than the minimum of the last processed date of subscription table will be deleted.
Operation.name: cleanupScratchTable
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209     The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
Operation.useCase:
Full Text Indexer Sync

When objects are created or deleted, the database triggers will add them to the scratch table. During the Full Text Indexer Sync process, these new and deleted objects are queried and updated to the search index. On success, the data needs to be removed from the scratch table in order to avoid the table growing in size and leading to poor performance of queries. This new operation will help in cleaning only the data that is consumed by all the registered applications. This operation will be called at the end or the sync process.

Operation.description: Create FullTextSavedSearch objects
Operation.name: createFullTextSavedSearch
Operation.returnDescription: Response from createFullTextSavedSearch SOA

ParameterInfo.description: Inputs of createFullTextSavedSearch SOA

Operation.name: createFullTextSavedSearch
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of saved searches created by this service operation.

The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141141 - The operation failed to create a new saved search because a saved search with same name already exits.

ParameterInfo.description: Information required to create a list of new Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.

Operation.description: This operation creates Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects. Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects are used to store information about a saved search such as search name, search string, search filters, chart input parameters etc.
Operation.name: createFullTextSavedSearch
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of saved searches created by this service operation.

The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 141152 - The operation failed to create a new saved search because a saved search with same name already exits.
    • 141162 - This is not a valid chart input parameter key. Valid keys are: ChartOn.

ParameterInfo.description: Information required to create a list of new Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.

Operation.description: This operation deletes saved searches. The saved search is unpinned before deleted.

Returns Service Data with error if any.

The following partial error may be returned:

ParameterInfo.description: List of Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.

Operation.description: The accountability table contains records for the indexed objects. When the principal objects are deleted, the index is cleared but the records in the accountability table still exist. This operation deletes the records from the accountability table whose island UIDs and the application id match the given criteria.
Operation.name: deleteIndexedIslands
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
Operation.useCase:
Full Text Indexer Sync

When objects are created or deleted, the database triggers will add them to the scratch table. During the Full Text Indexer Sync process, it queries for the deleted objects and updates the search index. On success, the data needs to be removed from the accountability table in order to avoid the table growing in size and leading to poor performance of queries. This new operation will help in cleaning the data. This operation will be called during the delete process of sync.

ParameterInfo.description:
The unique identifier that identifies the application that indexed the object.
Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID of the Full Text Search Indexer that indexes object data.
The list of exported objects UIDs that represent the index islands.

Operation.description: This operation deletes the records of the given list of application IDs from the subscription table.
Operation.name: deregisterApplicationIDs
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
Operation.useCase:
Full Text Indexer Sync

The Initial Condition for this use case is that all the data from Teamcenter database has already been indexed in the Search Engine. When there are Access Manager rule tree changes and the change has a global impact, then all of the indexed data has to be refreshed. In order to identify the globally impacted objects, an application ID called :FTS_REFRESH (a unique identifier representing the Full Text Search Refresh operation) is registered with TIE (Teamcenter Import Export). Once the indexing is complete and there are no more objects left to be refreshed, this operation is invoked to deregister and to signal to TIE that the necessary cleanup of data in the database can be done. This is necessary to limit the growth of the database tables used by TIE.

ParameterInfo.description:
The list of application IDs to be deregistered from the subscription table.
Ex: ":FTS_REFRESH" is the application ID of the Full Text Search Indexer that is used to query for data to be re-indexed when there is a global impact.

Operation.description: Find FullTextSavedSearch objects
Operation.name: findFullTextSavedSearches
Operation.returnDescription: Response of findFullTextSavedSearches SOA

Operation.description: This operation queries the scratch table to identify objects that have been added since the last indexing operation.
Operation.name: getAddedObjectsToUpdateIndex
Operation.returnDescription: The service response structure containing UIDs of added objects to update the full text search index.

ParameterInfo.description: The application ID.

Operation.description: This operation queries the scratch table to identify objects that have been added since the last indexing operation.
Operation.name: getAddedObjectsToUpdateIndex1
Operation.returnDescription: The service response structure containing UIDs of the added objects to update the full text search index and the Date including time at which the query is executed to find the data.

ParameterInfo.description: The application ID.

Operation.description:
This operation lists the business objects whose READ access is impacted by the changes in Access Manager rule tree. The rule tree changes considered are limited to those made after the previous call to this operation.
This operation is usually called periodically and the objects whose read access is modified due to the changes to Access Manager rule tree between the previous call and the current one are determined and returned.
Optionally, this operation returns the set of objects which is the intersection of objects impacted by Access Manager rule changes and objects previously indexed. Previously indexed objects are stored in ACCT_TABLE table. The application id will be used to further filter the objects impacted by Access manager rule changes and got previously indexed for a particular application.
Operation.name: getAMImpactedObjects
Operation.returnDescription:
An instance of GetAMImpactedObjectsResponse with the list of objects whose read access is modified. If the number of objects impacted is too large the flag isImpactGlobal is set to true and the callers may treat this as the indication to perform full reindexing. Number of objects returned in this case will be zero. Number of objects returned can also be zero when there are no changes to the rule tree. In this case the isImpactGlobal flag will be returned as false.
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 525185     Failed to identify impacted objects.

ParameterInfo.description: Application ID subscribed by Access Manager to identify the impacted objects by rule tree changes. Ex: ":FTS_AMSYNC"

The unique identifier to differentiate objects indexed to different target applications. This is optional. If this is specified only the objects previosuly indexed by this application and impacted due to rule tree changes will be returned. Else all the impacted objects from the entire database will be included in the response. Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID used for indexing object data.

Operation.description: This operation finds all the files associated with the given list of datasets and filters out that are not supported for indexing. Finally returns back a map of datasets uids and supported files information of file UID and FMS read ticket for downloading the file.
Operation.name: getDatasetIndexableFilesInfo
Operation.returnDescription: Returns the map containing the dataset UIDs and their associated Files information.

ParameterInfo.description: List of Dataset UIDs for which the File Ticket Information is needed for indexing.

Operation.description: This operation queries the scratch table to identify objects that have been deleted since the last indexing operation.
Operation.name: getDeletedObjectsToUpdateIndex
Operation.returnDescription: The service response structure containing UIDs of deleted objects to update the full text search index.

ParameterInfo.description: The application ID.

Operation.description: This operation queries the scratch table to identify objects that have been deleted since last indexing operation.
Operation.name: getDeletedObjectsToUpdateIndex1
Operation.returnDescription: The service response structure containing the UIDs of deleted objects to update the full text search index along with the time at which the query is executed to find the data.

ParameterInfo.description: The application ID.

Operation.description:
The operation queries on scratch, accountability and subscription tables to identify the impacted ItemRevisions from last index time due to adds/modify/deletes that took place. These impacted objects need to be re-indexed to have the revision rule selectors updated.
Steps:
1.    Queries for deleted objects from scratch table. Gets their parent Items from accountability table impacted island if they exist. For the Items found, it fetches all the ItemRevisions and adds them to the response.
2.    Queries for newly added objects from scratch table. Filters out non ItemRevisions from the list. Adds the ItemRevisions to the reponse.
3.    Queries for any Modified islands from the accountability table. If modified island belongs to an ItemRevision, then the ItemRevision will be added to the response.

Finally the response will contain the impacted ItemRevisions due to adds/modify/deletes.
Operation.name: getImpactedItemRevsForReIndex
Operation.returnDescription:
The list of impacted ItemRevision UIDs. The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 141051:     The operation to retrieve the impacted ItemRevision objects for synchronization has failed. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1: TcFtsIndexer Sync

When data is indexed for the first time the Revision rule slector information is also indexed on each ItemRevision. So whenever a new ItemRevision is added/deleted/modified that impacts all the ItemRevisions associated with its parent Item and the revision rule selector information need to be regenerated. This new operation will help in identifying the impacted objects and they can be re-indexed to sync the index data .

Operation.description: This operation queries for the indexed objects matching the given input criteria. Criteria include application ID, timestamp, export or import status of the object and list of object class names.
Operation.name: getIndexedObjects
Operation.returnDescription:
The list of indexed objects that matched the given input criteria.
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
    • 141061 Specified status is invalid.

ParameterInfo.description:
The unique identifier that identifies the application that indexed the object.
Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID of the Full Text Search Indexer that indexes object data.

The application id used to gets the last processed date from subscription table to be used to filter the indexed objects. This is optional. If this value is specified it ignores the last exported date passed in as input to the operation.

The timestamp used to identify objects that have been indexed before the specified value.
If the value is NULLDATE, this field will be excluded from the query i.e., all objects, regardless of when they were indexed, are returned as long as they match the other criteria i.e application ID, status and class names.

The export or import status of the object. This is optional.
Vaid values are
0 - status is ignored and not included as part of the query
1 - Replication Pending
2 - Replication Complete
3 - Dirty
4 - Import Failed
The list of class names of the objects to find. This is optional and list can be empty.
Count of objects to be returned back in resposne. If the value is 0, all objects found by the query will be returned.

Operation.description: This operation queries for the indexed objects matching the given input criteria. Criteria include application ID, timestamp, list of export or import statuses of the object and list of object class names. The maxCountObject can be specified to limit the count of matching object UIDs to be fetched by the query. The statusToUpdate will be used to update the records of the UIDs fetched by the query in ACCT_TABLE.
Operation.name: getIndexedObjectsAndUpdate
Operation.returnDescription:
The list of indexed objects that matched the given input criteria.
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
    • 141061 Specified status is invalid.

ParameterInfo.description:
The unique identifier that identifies the application that indexed the object.
":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID of the Full Text Search Indexer that indexes object data.
":SITECON_SYNC" is the application ID of the Site Consolidation applciation

The application id used to gets the last processed date from subscription table to be used to filter the indexed objects. This is optional. If this value is specified it ignores the last exported date passed in as input to the operation.

The timestamp used to identify objects that have been indexed before the specified value.
If the value is NULLDATE, this field will be excluded from the query i.e., all objects, regardless of when they were indexed, are returned as long as they match the other criteria i.e application ID, status and class names.

List of statuses of the objects to be queried from ACCT_TABLE. This is optional.
Supported values are
0 - status is ignored and not included as part of the query
1 - Replication Pending
2 - Replication Complete
3 - Dirty
4 - Import Failed
12 - Delta add pending
13 - Delta modify pending
14 - Delta delete pending
15 - Revision Rule refresh pending
16 - Add modify pending
17 - Modify relation pending
The list of class names of the objects to find. This is optional and list can be empty.
Count of objects to be returned back in response. If the value is 0, all objects found by the query will be returned.

Status to update the records found by the query in ACCT_TABLE.
If the vaue is 0 the state of the records will not be updated.
Supported values are
0 - status is ignored and state of the records are not updated
1 - Replication Pending
2 - Replication Complete
3 - Dirty
4 - Import Failed
12 - Delta add pending
13 - Delta modify pending
14 - Delta delete pending
15 - Revision Rule refresh pending
16 - Add modify pending
17 - Modify relation pending

Operation.description: This operation finds all indexed objects that have been modified since the last "sync" run.
Operation.name: getModifiedObjectsToSync
Operation.returnDescription:
• The list modified object UIDs since the last sync run.
    • The timestamp when the query is executed to find the modified objects.

The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209     The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.

ParameterInfo.description:
The unique ID used by the application consuming the data.
Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID used for indexing object data.

Operation.description: Determine the list of objects to index based on the given date/time range and the "Awp0SearchIsIndexed" business object constant.
Operation.name: getObjectsToIndex
Operation.returnDescription: The response structure containing the list of objects to index.

ParameterInfo.description: The input to determine the objects to index.

Operation.description: Fetches the pre filter properties and their values from the preferences defined in the system.
Operation.name: getPreFilters
Operation.returnDescription: A service response containing the list of PreFilter properties.

Operation.description: This operation returns a list of search suggestions for the given search string.
Operation.name: getSuggestions
Operation.returnDescription: A response structure containing a list of search suggestions.

ParameterInfo.description: The structure containing input data to retrieve search suggestions.

Operation.description:
The operation identifies the siblings of Revisionable Objects that have been added/modified/deleted.

The identified siblings are marked in the accountability table with the TIE sync status provided and returned if requsted

Based on the value of the addModDelBitMask the following steps will be executed.
Steps:
1. Queries for siblings of deleted objects from scratch table. Gets their parent Item objects from accountability table impacted island if they exist. For the Item objects found, it fetches all the Revisionable Objects and adds them to the response.
2. Queries for siblings of newly added objects from scratch table. Filters out non Revisionable Objects from the list.
Adds the Revisionable Objects to the reponse.
3. Queries for any Modified islands from the accountability table. If modified island belongs to an Revisionable Objects, then queries for the Revisionable Objects siblings and adds to the response.

Finally the response will contain the impacted Revisionable Objects due to adds/modify/deletes.
Operation.name: identifyImpactedObjects
Operation.returnDescription: The list of impacted Revisionable Object UIDs
Operation.useCase:
Use Cases:
Use Case 1: TcFtsIndexer Sync

Whenever Revisionable Objects are indexed the Revision rule slector information (Working, Latest Working, etc…) is also indexed on each Revisionable Object. So whenever a new Revisionable Object is added/deleted/modified that impacts all the Revisionable Object associated with its parent Item and the revision rule selector information need to be regenerated. This operation will help in identifying the impacted objects and they can be re-indexed to sync the index data .

ParameterInfo.description: Input values

Operation.description: This operation modifies existing Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.

Operation.returnDescription:
A list of modified saved searches.

The following partial error may be returned:
    • 141145 - Invalid type. Only Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects allowed.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of Awp0FullTextSavedSearchInputObjects2 objects that contain information to edit existing Saved Search objects.

Operation.description: This operation modifies existing Awp0FullTextSavedSearch objects.
Operation.name: modifyFullTextSavedSearch
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of modified saved searches.

The following partial error may be returned:
    • 141153 - The modified search cannot be saved with that name, because a saved search already exists with the same name.
    • 141162 - This is not a valid chart input parameter key. Valid keys are: ChartOn.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of Awp0ModifyFTSSavedSearchInput objects that contain information to edit existing Saved Search objects.

Operation.description: This operation returns a list of business objects obtained after performing a full text search using the input search criteria.
Operation.name: performFullTextSearch
Operation.returnDescription: A service response structure containing search results.

ParameterInfo.description: The input search criteria.

Operation.description:
This service operation queries for the data to be synced and updates the state of those records in ACCT_TABLE. The Full Text Search Indexer which indexes Teamcenter data uses the information for further processing.

Queries for deleted objects that have been previously indexed after previous sync.
Updates these records in ACCT_TABLE with DELETE_PENDING state
Updates the :FTS_DEL_QRY app_id timetsamp in SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE

Queries for newly added objects after previous sync.
Inserts these records into ACCT_TABLE with ADD_MODIFY_PENDING state.
Updates the timestamp of the :FTS_ADD_QRY app_id in SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE

Queries for modifications via relations of indexed objects
Updates these records in ACCT_TABLE with MODIFY_REL_PENDING state.
Queries for modifications of indexed objects.
Updates these records in ACCT_TABLE with ADD_MODIFY_PENDING state
Updates the timestamp of the :FTS_SYNC app_id in SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE

The count of added or deleted or modified objects found by queries will be returned back through SyncInfo map. Any errors during queries or update of records will be reported as partial errors through ServiceData object.
Operation.name: queryAndUpdateSyncData
Operation.returnDescription:
Returns a structure containg information generated during the operation. Also includes ServiceData object with partial errors.

    • 515209 The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
    • 141062 Failed to query and update added objects.
    • 141063 Failed to query and update deleted objects.
    • 141064 Failed to query and update modified objects.

ParameterInfo.description: Input values.

Operation.description: Updates the subscription table with the application id and processed date time of an action during indexing process.
Operation.name: updateIndexingStatus
Operation.returnDescription: Returns ServiceData with error if any.

ParameterInfo.description: Input to keep track of Indexer status.

Operation.description: This operation updates the data islands that match the given input criteria with a status (1 - Replication Pending, 2 - Replication Complete, etc.) and exported date. Criteria include application ID, timestamp, and list of index island UIDs.
Operation.name: updateIndexIslandStatus
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 515209     The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
    • 141061     Specified status is invalid.
    • 141062     Index Island UIDs list cannot be empty. Please provide a valid list.
Operation.useCase:
Full Text Indexer error handling

While indexing of data there might be issues during any step of the ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) process. This operation will be used to set the status of the exported objects. The status that is updated will help in identifying the failed objects for error recovery. This operation will be used during indexing and sync when an error occurs.

ParameterInfo.description:
The unique identifier that identifies the application that indexed the object.
Ex: ":FTS_SYNC" is the application ID of the Full Text Search
The list of exported object UIDs that represent the index islands. This list should not be empty.
The timestamp used to identify objects that have been indexed before the specified value. If the value is NULLDATE, the exported date field will not be updated.

The export or import status of the object.
Vaid values are
1 - Replication Pending
2 - Replication Complete
3 - Dirty
4 - Import Failed

Operation.description:
This operation is invoked to query the data for a property having an LOV attachment. The results returned from the server also take into consideration any filter string that is in the input. This operation returns both LOV meta data as necessary for the client to render the LOV and partial LOV values list as specified.
The operation will return the results in the LOVSearchResults data structure. Maximum number of results to be returned are specified in the InitialLOVData data structure. If there are more results, the moreValuesExist flag in the LOVSearchResults data structure will be true. If the flag is true, more values can be retrieved with a call to the getNextLOVValues operation.
Operation.name: getInitialLOVValues
Operation.returnDescription: The LOV Search Results. This includes LOV metadata information (LOV usage, LOV style, etc.). It also contains the instance data (LOV values) that the client can use to render the LOV UI widget. The output also contains information as to whether there are more results to be processed in which case a user can page to get next set of values (this triggers a call to the getNextLOVValues operation). The following partial errors are returned in the ServiceData - 54051 - The property is not a valid sort property. Property must be one of the LOV Value or LOV Description or any of Filter Properties. - 54052 - The Dynamic LOV has an invalid configuration. It may be that Business Object Type this dynamic LOV may not exists in the system. Please contact your business modeler administrator with this information - 54053- The Dynamic LOV has an invalid configuration with one of the filter property does not exists. Please contact your business modeler administrator with this information - 54054- The Dynamic LOV has an invalid configuration The specified LOV value property for the Dynamic LOV does not exists. Please contact your business modeler administrator with this - 54055- The Dynamic LOV has an invalid configuration. The specified LOV value description property for the Dynamic LOV does not exists. Please contact your business modeler administrator with this information

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and replaced by Teamcenter::Soa::Core::LOV::getInitialLOVValues from the _2013_05 namespace.

ParameterInfo.description: Input data to get LOV results for any LOV

Operation.description: This operation is invoked after a call to getInitialLOVValues if the moreValuesExist flag is true in the LOVSearchResults output returned from a call to the getInitialLOVValues operation. The operation will retrieve the next set of LOV values
Operation.name: getNextLOVValues
Operation.returnDescription: LOV Search Results (LOVSearchResults instance). The LOV Search Results contains LOV metadata information (LOV usage, LOV style, etc.). It also contains the instance data (LOV values) that the client can use to render the LOV UI widget. The output also contains information as to whether there are more results to be processed in which case a user can page to get next set of values (this triggers a call to the subsequent getNextLOVValues operation). Partial errors are returned in the ServiceData field in the LOV Search Results. Possible errors are:

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and replaced by Teamcenter::Soa::Core::LOV::getNextLOVValues from the _2013_05 namespace.

ParameterInfo.description: Input data to get next set of LOV results for Dynamic LOV. This is returned as part of the LOVSearchResults output from the call to getInitialLOVValues operation

Operation.description: This operation can be invoked after selecting a value from the LOV. Use this operation to do additional validation to be done on server such as validating Range value, getting the dependent properties values in case of interdependent LOV (resetting the dependendent property values), Coordinated LOVs ( populating dependent property values )
Operation.name: validateLOVValueSelections
Operation.returnDescription: The response data indicating validity of LOV value selections and containing updated property values and interdependent property values

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and replaced by Teamcenter::Soa::Core::LOV::validateLOVValueSelections from the _2013_05 namespace.

ParameterInfo.description: updated LOV input with new selection
It is the name of the Property for which LOV is being evaluated

Pass the uids from the selected rows. Every LovValueRow returned from server is designated with valid UID for dynamic LOV. That is the value need to be passed to the server for effective validation. For other LOVs it is empty

Operation.description: This operation returns a list of business objects containing group membership information.
Operation.name: getGroupMembership
Operation.returnDescription: A service response structure containing group membership information.

ParameterInfo.description: The structure containing input to retrieve group membership information.

Operation.description:
This operation searches for active GroupMember based on name, role and group inputs . Literal and partial strings (strings with wildcard character '*') are supported. Literal string are AND together and partial strings are grouped OR and AND with with the literal strings.
Using the following search critera:

userId = "tc*"
userName = "tcadmin"
groupName = "dba"
roleName = "DB*"

The operation will assemble the final search criteria as follows:

username = "tcadmin" AND groupName = "dba" AND ( userId = "tc*" OR roleName = "DB*" ).

Following examples demonstrate how this operation can be used to get GroupMember objects based on different inputs:

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User objects where userd_id, user_name contain "XYZ". Input for this search will be :

userId - "*XYZ*"
userName - "*XYZ*"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User or Role or Group objects where userd_id, user_name, role_name,or name contain "xyz". Input for this search will be :

userId - "*xyz*"
userName - "*xyz*"
roleName - "*xyz*"
groupName - "*xyz*"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User or Role objects where userd_id,user_name, role_name contain "xyz" and has Group object with name "dba". Inputs for this search will be :

userId - "*xyz*"
userName - "*xyz*"
roleName - "*xyz*"
groupName - "dba"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User or Group objects where userd_id, user_name, name contain "xyz" and has Role object with role_name "DBA". Inputs for this search will be :

userId - "*xyz*"
userName - "*xyz*"
roleName - "DBA"
groupName - "*xyz*"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User objects where user_id, user_name contain"xyz" and Role object with role_name "DBA" and Group object with name "dba". Inputs for this search will be :

userId - "*xyz*"
userName - "*xyz*"
roleName - "DBA"
groupName - "dba"

    • Search for GroupMember objects which have User objects where user_id "xyz" and user_name "xyz" and Role object with role_name "DBA" and Group object with name "dba". Inputs for this search will be :

userId - "xyz"
userName - "xyz"
roleName - "DBA"
groupName - "dba"
Operation.name: getGroupMembership2
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of GroupMember objects found after performing the GroupMember objects search. This operation also returns the map of User object to Person objects . The User objects returned in the map are corresponding to the found GroupMember objects.
Possible errors returned in ServiceData are:

516001 - An enquiry internal error has occurred..
516127 - The enquiry module has run out of memory.
516130 - The enquiry has timed-out.
Operation.useCase:
Search GroupMember(s) againt signoff profile of a select-signoff task:

User has an active select-signoff-task with signoff profile. Profile specifies the group, role and number of the users who are allowed to perform the review. This task has following profiles:
    • * / DBA / 1 ( Any User who has a role "DBA")
    • dba / * / 1 ( Any User who is in group "dba" )
    • dba / DBA / 1 ( Any User who has a role "DBA" and in group "dba" )
    • Engineering++ / * / 1 ( Any User from "Engineering" sub-group )
    • GroupA++ / RoleA / 1 ( Any User who has a role "RoleA" and from "GroupA" sub-group )


Here user wants to search for all the active GroupMembers in Teamcenter organization with above profiles to signoff the task.

ParameterInfo.description: The input search criteria for finding the GroupMember objects.

Operation.description: The response of this operation is the list of Parent Item Revisions where each one of the input Item Revisions are used.
Operation.name: getParentsWhereUsed

An object of RevisionRule that is used to configure the parents found for the input Item Revisions.
The page number (starting with 0) whose content are expected in the response. If the page number is higher than total page count then nothing will be returned in the response.
