The page number (starting with 0) whose content are expected in the response. If the page number is higher than total page count then nothing will be returned in the response.

Operation.description: This service operation creates the named column configuration information in the Teamcenter database. Active Workspace client may use this information to populate columns of tables in various sublocations as the user navigates. Default named column configurations can be initially created by a utility during install.
Operation.name: createNamedColumnConfig
Operation.returnDescription:
The ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while managing the named column configurations. The following partial errors may be returned:
•302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
•302003 - Invalid object type name.
•302004 - Invalid property name.
•302005 - Invalid pixel width.
•302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.
Operation.useCase:
Create Named Column Configuration:
A user wants to create a named column configuration for a given table when he/she is logged into the client. The named column configuration will become the active column configuration for that user on the given table.

ParameterInfo.description: The column configuration input required to locate a named column configuration for create.
A list of column configuration data including information about each column to be created.
The options for managing the named column configuration. Possible key-value pairs are “Group”-“Engineering” or “operationType”-“Union”.

Operation.description: This service operation deletes the given named column configuration object from the Teamcenter database.
Operation.name: deleteNamedColumnConfig
Operation.returnDescription:
The ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while deleting the named column configuration. The following partial errors may be returned:
• 515110 - The instance is referenced.
Operation.useCase:
Delete Named Column Configuration:
A user wants to delete an existing named column configuration for a given table. The named column configuration will be deleted.

ParameterInfo.description: The uid of the named column configuration object to delete.

Operation.description: This service operation gets named column configuration information from the Teamcenter database.
Operation.name: getNamedColumnConfigs
Operation.returnDescription:
The JSON string containing the named column configurations information.

Example:
"[
{
columnConfigName: 'LoadExampleName',
uid: 'LoadExampleUid',
isAdmin: true,
isModifiable: false,
isCurrent: true,
columnConfig: {}
},
{
columnConfigName: 'LoadExampleName2',
uid: 'LoadExampleUid2',
isAdmin: true,
isModifiable: false,
isCurrent: true,
columnConfig: {}
}
]"

Also, the ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while getting the data in the input structures. The following partial errors may be returned:
•302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
•302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.
Operation.useCase:
Get a list of Named Column Configurations:
This service operation will be called to get all available named column configurations for the logged in user.

ParameterInfo.description: The column configuration input required to locate a named column configuration to be loaded on the client.
The options for getting the named column configurations. Possible key-value pairs are "mostRecentlyUsed": "true" or "contains": "filterText".

Operation.description:
This operation returns information used by the client to render the User Interface. The information returned includes column configuration information.
If the resetColumnConfig flag is "True", this operation deletes the column configuration of the input scope and then queries the new effective UI column configuration for the login user. This operation will only clear the login user column configurations.
Operation.name: getOrResetUIColumnConfigs
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of column configurations based on the input provided to the operation.
The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 302010 - Invalid Client Scope.
    • 302012 - Invalid Client.
    • 302014 - Invalid Hosting Client.
    • 141160 - Invalid scope.
Operation.useCase:
Request UI Configuration(s) based on the current login user
Client requests the column information for one or more client scopes using this operation and scope as login user.

Request UI Configuration(s) based on a specific Teamcenter scope
Client requests the column information for one or more client scopes using this operation and scope as Role, Site or Group.

Request to reset UI Column Configuration(s) based on the current login user
If a client needs to reset the column information for login user scope, they can use this operation. The new effective UI column configuration will be retrieved for the login user.

ParameterInfo.description: Input information required to retrieve UI column configurations from the Teamcenter database.

Operation.description:
This operation returns information used by the client to render the User Interface. The information returned includes column configuration information.
If the resetColumnConfig flag is "True", this operation deletes the column configuration of the input scope and then queries the new effective UI column configuration for the login user. This operation will clear the login user column configurations.
Operation.name: getOrResetUIColumnConfigs2
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of column configurations based on the input provided to the operation.
The following partial errors may be returned:

302010 - Invalid Client Scope. Please provide a valid client scope as per BMIDE template definition.
302012 - The client name is invalid. Please provide a valid client name as per BMIDE template definition.
302014 - Invalid Hosting Client for given client name
141160 - Invalid scope. Valid values for scope are "Site", "Group", "Role", "User", "LoginUser"
Operation.useCase:
Request UI Configuration(s) based on the current login user
Client requests the column information for one or more client scopes using this operation and scope as login user.

Request UI Configuration(s) based on a specific Teamcenter scope
Client requests the column information for one or more client scopes using this operation and scope as Role, Site or Group.

Request to reset UI Column Configuration(s) based on the current login user
If a client needs to reset the column information for login user scope, they can use this operation. The new effective UI column configuration will be retrieved for the login user.

ParameterInfo.description: Input information required to retrieve UI column configurations from the Teamcenter database.

Operation.description: This operation returns information used by the client to render the User Interface. The information returned includes command and column configuration information. This operation replaces getUIConfigs operation, it returns the Awp0CommandCollectionRel objects that associate the top level command collections to client scope in CommandConfigData2 structure instead of Awp0CommandCollection objects in CommandConfigData.
Operation.name: getUIConfigs2
Operation.returnDescription: Returns: A list of command and column configurations based on the input provided to the operation. The following partial errors may be returned: 141112-Invalid Scope for the client. 141113-Invalid Client Scope.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: This operation is deprecated and created new SOA getUIConfigs3 in AW3.3.0 release. So use new service definition Awp0::Soa::AWS2::UiConfig::getUIConfigs3.

ParameterInfo.description: Contains input information required to retrieve UI configurations from the Teamcenter database.

Operation.description: This operation returns information used by the client to render the User Interface. The information returned includes command and column configuration information. The returned information includes Fnd0CommandCollectionRel objects that associate the top level command collections to client scope in CommandConfigData structure.
Operation.name: getUIConfigs3
Operation.returnDescription:
Returns: A list of command and column configurations based on the input provided to the operation. The following partial errors may be returned:
141112-Invalid Scope for the client.
141113-Invalid Client Scope.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: With the AW Declarative framework, the command configurations are all moved to client side. The column configurations for table views are fetched using performSearchViewModel2. So there is no need to fetch them upfront via getUiConfigs3.

ParameterInfo.description: Contains input information required to retrieve UI configurations from the Teamcenter database.

Operation.description: This operation returns information used by the client to render the User Interface. The information returned includes commands that are visible.
Operation.name: getVisibleCommands
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of commands that are visible based on the input provided to the operation. The following partial errors may be returned:
302010 - Invalid Client Scope. The client scope URI is not defined for the client.
302012 - Invalid Client. The name of a client application is not valid. This value is represented by an instance of Awp0Client in the Teamcenter databases and must match a value of the Awp0ClientName property.
302013 - Invalid Scope. Scope parameter input value is not valid. Valid values are Site, Group, Role, User, LoginUser and AvailableForLoginUser.
302014 - Invalid Hosting Client. The name of a hosting client application is not valid. This value is represented by an instance of Awp0Client in the Teamcenter databases and must match a value of the Awp0ClientName property.

ParameterInfo.description: Contains input information required to retrieve the commands that are visible from the Teamcenter database.

Operation.description: This service operation will load the given named column configuration for a given user.
Operation.name: loadNamedColumnConfig
Operation.returnDescription:
The JSON string containing the named column configurations information.

Example:
"{
        columnConfigName: 'LoadExampleName',
        uid: 'LoadExampleUid',
        isAdmin: true,
        isModifiable: false,
        isCurrent: true,
        columnConfig: {
            columnConfigId: 'LoadExampleId',
            operationType: 'Intersection',
            columns: [
                {
                    displayName: 'Name',
                    typeName: 'WorkspaceObject',
                    propertyName: 'object_name',
                    pixelWidth: 120,
                    columnOrder: 0,
                    hiddenFlag: false,
                    sortPriority: 1,
                    sortDirection: 'Ascending',
                    filterValue: {
                        operation: '',
                        values: []
                    },
                    filterDefinitionKey: '',
                    isFilteringEnabled: true,
                    dataType: 'String',
                    isFrozen: true
                }
            ]
        }
}"

Also, the ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while getting the data in the input structures. The following partial errors may be returned:
•302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
•302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.
Operation.useCase:
Load a Named Column Configuration:
This service operation will be called which will get the detailed columns information from the selected named column configuration.

ParameterInfo.description: The uid of the named column configuration object to load.

Operation.description: This service operation saves the named column configuration information to the Teamcenter database. Active Workspace client may use this information to populate columns of tables in various sublocations as the user navigates.
Operation.name: saveNamedColumnConfig
Operation.returnDescription:
The ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while managing the named column configurations. The following partial errors may be returned:
•302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
•302003 - Invalid object type name.
•302004 - Invalid property name.
•302005 - Invalid pixel width.
•302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.
Operation.useCase:
Save Named Column Configuration:
A user wants to modify an existing named column configuration for a given table by adding or removing columns. The modified named column configuration will become the active column configuration for that user.

ParameterInfo.description: The uid of the named column configuration object to save.
Column configuration data including information about each column to be created or saved.
The options for managing the named column configuration. Possible key-value pairs are “Group”-“Engineering” or “operationType”-“Union”.

Operation.description: This service operation saves column configuration information to the Teamcenter database. A Teamcenter client may use this information to render the user interface as the user navigates the Teamcenter client. Default column configurations are initally created by an utility during install. This operation will modify the default column configuration for the site, group, role or a specific user.
Operation.name: saveUIColumnConfigs
Operation.returnDescription:
The ServiceData structure containing any partial errors that may have occurred while saving the data in the input structures. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 302001 - Invalid column configuration id.
    • 302003 - Invalid object type name.
    • 302004 - Invalid property name.
    • 302005 - Invalid pixel width.
    • 302010 - Invalid Client Scope URI.
Operation.useCase:
User level column configuration:
A User wants to change the default column configuration for a Client Scope when he is logged into the client. The saved configuration will override the default configuration for the user's applicable role, group or site.

ParameterInfo.description: List of column configurations.

Struct.description: The IDContextOut is list of IdContext objects. It also contains the input object of type Item or ItemRevision.

StructElement.description: A list of all IdContext objects found in the Teamcenter database.
StructElement.name: idContexts

Struct.name: IDContextOutput

StructElement.description: A list of IdContextOut structures which holds the list of IdContext objects and input object of type WorkspaceObject or NULL.
StructElement.name: idContextOuts

StructElement.description: Any partial errors encountered during this operation are returned in the list of partial errors of the ServiceData.
StructElement.name: serviceData

StructElement.description: If true, the created IdDispRule object is set as the current ID Display Rule for the user; otherwise, the existing current ID Display Rule will remain the current.
StructElement.name: setCurrent

Struct.name: IdentifiersOut

StructElement.description: A list of valid Identifier types which can be used to define the Alternate and Alias IDs of the input object.
StructElement.name: identifierTypes

StructElement.description: Item object of the given input ItemRevision for which Alternate IDs can be defined.
StructElement.name: item

StructElement.description: A list containing all revisions of the input Item for which Alternate IDs can be defined.
StructElement.name: revisions

Struct.description: The IdentifierTypesIn structure is used to hold the input Item or ItemRevision object and the input IdContext object.
Struct.name: IdentifierTypesIn

StructElement.description: Input Item or ItemRevision object for which the Identifier type is being fetched.

StructElement.description: Input IdContext object used to fetch the Identifier type for the input Item or ItemRevision from the defined ID Display Rules.
StructElement.name: idContext

Struct.description: The IdentifierTypesOut is list of IdentifiersOut objects. It also contains the instance of ServiceData for the operation.
Struct.name: IdentifierTypesOut

StructElement.description: A list of IdentifiersOut structures which holds list of Identifier types, object of type Item and list of ItemRevision objects, applicable for defining the Alternate IDs.
StructElement.name: identifiersOutput

StructElement.description: Any partial errors encountered during this operation are returned in the list of partial errors of the ServiceData.
StructElement.name: serviceData

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation fetches all instances of the ID Context objects (IdContext) from the Teamcenter database applicable for the input objects of type Item and ItemRevision based on defined ID Context Rules (IdContextRule) by the system administrators.

This operation queries ID Context Rule objects and fetches the ID Context objects based on the input Item, ItemRevision or NULL. The input is the identifiable type defined on the ID Context Rules. For a NULL input, it returns the Id Context objects where the identifiable type is NULL.
All ID Context objects from the Teamcenter data base are returned in case input object is other than Item, ItemRevision or NULL. An empty input list would also return all ID Context objects from the Teamcenter data base.

IdContext objects represents the context information under which the OEM defines the unique IDs of their Item and ItemRevision objects. This context information is used when Teamcenter users define the unique IDs of Item and ItemRevision objects.

Alternate and Alias IDs of Teamcenter are the example of the such unique IDs of Item and ItemRevision. Users define Alternate and Alias IDs with the help of the ID Context as one of the unique attribute of the ID.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getIdContexts
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: The list of IdContext objects found.

OperationParameter.description: A list of objects of type WorkspaceObject or NULL for which the objects of type IdContext are fetched.
OperationParameter.name: inputObjs

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation fetches the applicable Identifier types for the input objects of type Item and/or ItemRevision along with the input IdContext object. System queries the ID Context Rules defined in Teamcenter database and retrives the Identifier types.

Alternate and Alias IDs are defined in Teamcenter as instances of business object of type Identifier. ID Context, of business object type IdContext, represents the context information under which the OEM defines the unique IDs of their Item and ItemRevision. This context information is used when Teamcenter users define the Alternate and Alias IDs of Item and ItemRevision objects.

ID Context Rules are defined as instances of business object type IdContextRule in Teamcenter database. These rules map the combination of ID Context and the object type e.g. Item or ItemRevision, called Identifiable types, to the type of the Identifier applicable in the context.

This operation also returns the other applicable objects for which Alternate IDs along with the input objects can be defined. In case of input objects of type Item, this operation returns the list of revision objects of the Item, and in case of input objects of type ItemRevision, this operation returns the Item object as the applicable object for which Alternate IDs can be defined.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::getIdentifierTypes
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Structure of IdentifierTypesOut which is wrapper of Identifier types, object of type Item and list of ItemRevision objects, applicable for defining the Alternate IDs. The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 203008    The input IdContext is NULL.
    • 203028    The operation has failed due to an invalid input. Objects of type Item and/or ItemRevision are the valid inputs.

OperationParameter.description: A list of IdentifierTypesIn objects used to query Identifer types from input data, Item or ItemRevision and IdContext.
OperationParameter.name: identifierTypesIn

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation creates the ID Display Rules (IdDispRule) with the input names and the corresponding ID Context information. ID Display Rule can also be created without the any input ID Context and user can update the object later with ID Context information.
ID Display Rule contains the list of ID Contexts and their order. Based on the order of the ID Contexts defined, the system evaluates the display name of the Item and ItemRevision from their Alternate IDs.

ID Context (IdContext), represents the context information under which the OEM defines the unique IDs of their Item and ItemRevision. This context information is used when Teamcenter users define the unique IDs of Item and ItemRevision objects.

User can set one of the ID Display Rules as the current ID Display Rule. The current ID Display Rule is used to evaluate the display names of the Item and ItemRevision. In case the ID Context of the Alternate ID with the Item and ItemRevision object does not match with that of the current ID Display Rule then system uses the default ID Display Rule to evaluate the display names of Item and ItemRevision objects.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::DataManagement::createIdDisplayRules
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
A list of successfully created IdDispRule objects in the created list of the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 203201    Multiple ID Display Rules are found for the name.
    • 203204    The ID Display Rule name is empty.

OperationParameter.description: A list of objects of type IdDispRuleCreateIn used to create the IdContextRule objects with input name and ID contexts.
OperationParameter.name: idDispRuleCreIns

Operation.description:
This operation creates the ID Display Rules (IdDispRule) with the input names and the corresponding ID Context information. ID Display Rule can also be created without the any input ID Context and user can update the object later with ID Context information.
ID Display Rule contains the list of ID Contexts and their order. Based on the order of the ID Contexts defined, the system evaluates the display name of the Item and ItemRevision from their Alternate IDs.

ID Context (IdContext), represents the context information under which the OEM defines the unique IDs of their Item and ItemRevision. This context information is used when Teamcenter users define the unique IDs of Item and ItemRevision objects.

User can set one of the ID Display Rules as the current ID Display Rule. The current ID Display Rule is used to evaluate the display names of the Item and ItemRevision. In case the ID Context of the Alternate ID with the Item and ItemRevision object does not match with that of the current ID Display Rule then system uses the default ID Display Rule to evaluate the display names of Item and ItemRevision objects.
Operation.name: createIdDisplayRules
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of successfully created IdDispRule objects in the created list of the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 203201    Multiple ID Display Rules are found for the name.
    • 203204    The ID Display Rule name is empty.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of objects of type IdDispRuleCreateIn used to create the IdContextRule objects with input name and ID contexts.

Operation.description:
This operation fetches all instances of the ID Context objects (IdContext) from the Teamcenter database applicable for the input objects of type Item and ItemRevision based on defined ID Context Rules (IdContextRule) by the system administrators.

This operation queries ID Context Rule objects and fetches the ID Context objects based on the input Item, ItemRevision or NULL. The input is the identifiable type defined on the ID Context Rules. For a NULL input, it returns the Id Context objects where the identifiable type is NULL.
All ID Context objects from the Teamcenter data base are returned in case input object is other than Item, ItemRevision or NULL. An empty input list would also return all ID Context objects from the Teamcenter data base.

IdContext objects represents the context information under which the OEM defines the unique IDs of their Item and ItemRevision objects. This context information is used when Teamcenter users define the unique IDs of Item and ItemRevision objects.

Alternate and Alias IDs of Teamcenter are the example of the such unique IDs of Item and ItemRevision. Users define Alternate and Alias IDs with the help of the ID Context as one of the unique attribute of the ID.
Operation.name: getIdContexts
Operation.returnDescription: The list of IdContext objects found.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of objects of type WorkspaceObject or NULL for which the objects of type IdContext are fetched.

Operation.description:
This operation fetches the applicable Identifier types for the input objects of type Item and/or ItemRevision along with the input IdContext object. System queries the ID Context Rules defined in Teamcenter database and retrives the Identifier types.

Alternate and Alias IDs are defined in Teamcenter as instances of business object of type Identifier. ID Context, of business object type IdContext, represents the context information under which the OEM defines the unique IDs of their Item and ItemRevision. This context information is used when Teamcenter users define the Alternate and Alias IDs of Item and ItemRevision objects.

ID Context Rules are defined as instances of business object type IdContextRule in Teamcenter database. These rules map the combination of ID Context and the object type e.g. Item or ItemRevision, called Identifiable types, to the type of the Identifier applicable in the context.

This operation also returns the other applicable objects for which Alternate IDs along with the input objects can be defined. In case of input objects of type Item, this operation returns the list of revision objects of the Item, and in case of input objects of type ItemRevision, this operation returns the Item object as the applicable object for which Alternate IDs can be defined.
Operation.name: getIdentifierTypes
Operation.returnDescription:
Structure of IdentifierTypesOut which is wrapper of Identifier types, object of type Item and list of ItemRevision objects, applicable for defining the Alternate IDs. The following partial errors may be returned:

    • 203008    The input IdContext is NULL.
    • 203028    The operation has failed due to an invalid input. Objects of type Item and/or ItemRevision are the valid inputs.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of IdentifierTypesIn objects used to query Identifer types from input data, Item or ItemRevision and IdContext.

ServiceInterface.description: The TCXML Services exposes the operations that are used to execute data export/import operations in TCXML format and the related operations for supporting data synchronization between different data export/import sessions.
ServiceInterface.name: TCXML

OperationTemplate.description: Returns the accountability tables' and the related POM tables' diagnostic information. The accountability tables are used for recording exported data and statuses, as well as data synchronization status and candidates.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::TCXML::getDiagnosticInfoForAcctTables
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
For the input information type value 1:
TableDiagnosticInfo
The table name: SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE
The list of NameValuesInfo structures has two NameValuesInfo:
NameValuesInfo1:
The table information type: SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE content
The list of table information values:
app_id1, lpd1
app_id2, lpd2
......
NameValuesInfo2:
The table information type: SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE stale app_id(s)
The list of table information values:
app_id3, lpd3
app_id7, lpd7
......
For the input information type value 2:
TableDiagnosticInfo
The table name: SCRATCH_TABLE
The list of NameValuesInfo structures has two NameValuesInfo:
NameValuesInfo1:
The table information type: SCRATCH_TABLE trigger_condition summary
The list of table information values:
trigger_condition=8, count=xxx
trigger_condition=9, count=xxx
......
NameValuesInfo2:
The table information type: SCRATCH_TABLE NULL lsd count
The list of table information values:
count=xxx
For the input information type value 4:
TableDiagnosticInfo
The table name: SCRATCH_TABLE
The list of NameValuesInfo structures has one NameValuesInfo:
The table information type: SCRATCH_TABLE class summary
The list of table information values:
class1, count=xxx
class2, count=xxx
......
For the input information type value 8:
TableDiagnosticInfo
The table name: ACCT_TABLE
The list of NameValuesInfo structures has one NameValuesInfo:
The table information type: ACCT_TABLE state summary
The list of table information values:
state=1, count=xxx
state=2, count=xxx
......
For the input information type value 16:
TableDiagnosticInfo
The table name: POM_object
The list of NameValuesInfo structures has one NameValuesInfo:
The table information type: POM_object trigger status
The list of table information values:
add trigger, ok/missing
delete trigger, ok/missing

The following partial error may be returned:
515209: The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
11001: TIE internal error.

OperationParameter.description:
Specifies the table information types to be retrieved. The valid values are one or sum of multiple values below:
0: Includes all the supported information types listed below.
1: SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE information. The whole table content and the stale app_id(s) will be returned. The SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE records all the applications' last processing time that is used for synchronizing data. If an app_id's lpd is within the threshold defined by DB parameter TC_TIMESTAMP_THRESHOLD, POM_TIMESTAMP table is used for data synchronization. Otherwise POM_object table is used for data synchronization, and the app_id is called stale app_id.
2: SCRATCH_TABLE summary information. The table rows count for different trigger_condition column values and the rows count for NULL lsd cloumn value will be returned. The SCRATCH_TABLE records synchronization data candidates.
4: SCRATCH_TABLE class information. The table rows count for the top 20 classes will be returned.
8: ACCT_TABLE summary information. The table rows count for different state column values will be returned. The ACCT_TABLE records all the exported data and statuses.
16: Database triggers information. The database triggers are on POM_object table for supporting data synchronization. The status of the add and delete triggers will be returned.
OperationParameter.name: infoType

OperationTemplate.description: Installs Database triggers on POM_object table for tracking newly added objects and (or) deleted objects that are used for data synchronization purpose.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::TCXML::installDBTriggersForDataSync
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial error may be returned:
515209: The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.

OperationParameter.description:
Specifies the Database trigger type that will be installed. The valid values are:
1: The database trigger for tracking the newly added objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
2: The database trigger for tracking the deleted objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
3: The database triggers for tracking both the newly added objects and the deleted objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
OperationParameter.name: triggerType

OperationTemplate.description: Removes the Database triggers on POM_object table for tracking newly added objects and (or) deleted objects that are used for data synchronization purpose.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::TCXML::removeDBTriggersForDataSync
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial error may be returned:
515209: The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.

OperationParameter.description:
Specifies the Database trigger type that will be installed. The valid values are:
1: The database trigger for tracking the newly added objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
2: The database trigger for tracking the deleted objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
3: The database triggers for tracking both the newly added objects and the deleted objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
OperationParameter.name: triggerType

Operation.useCase: Data indexing uses the operation to retrieve the accountability tables' diagnostic information and reports the information to end user. As an environment health check, this helps to understand the underlying tables status and diagnose any failure or performance problems.

ParameterInfo.description:
Specifies the table information types to be retrieved. The valid values are one or sum of multiple values below:
0: Includes all the supported information types listed below.
1: SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE information. The whole table content and the stale app_id(s) will be returned. The SUBSCRIPTION_TABLE records all the applications' last processing time that is used for synchronizing data. If an app_id's lpd is within the threshold defined by DB parameter TC_TIMESTAMP_THRESHOLD, POM_TIMESTAMP table is used for data synchronization. Otherwise POM_object table is used for data synchronization, and the app_id is called stale app_id.
2: SCRATCH_TABLE summary information. The table rows count for different trigger_condition column values and the rows count for NULL lsd cloumn value will be returned. The SCRATCH_TABLE records synchronization data candidates.
4: SCRATCH_TABLE class information. The table rows count for the top 20 classes will be returned.
8: ACCT_TABLE summary information. The table rows count for different state column values will be returned. The ACCT_TABLE records all the exported data and statuses.
16: Database triggers information. The database triggers are on POM_object table for supporting data synchronization. The status of the add and delete triggers will be returned.

Operation.description: Installs Database triggers on POM_object table for tracking newly added objects and (or) deleted objects that are used for data synchronization purpose.
Operation.name: installDBTriggersForDataSync
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial error may be returned:
515209: The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
Operation.useCase: Data indexing uses TCXML as the payload for extracting data from Database. In order to support data synchronization, data indexing needs to install Database triggers to track newly added objects and deleted objects as the first step of indexing.

ParameterInfo.description:
Specifies the Database trigger type that will be installed. The valid values are:
1: The database trigger for tracking the newly added objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
2: The database trigger for tracking the deleted objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
3: The database triggers for tracking both the newly added objects and the deleted objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.

Operation.description: Removes the Database triggers on POM_object table for tracking newly added objects and (or) deleted objects that are used for data synchronization purpose.
Operation.name: removeDBTriggersForDataSync
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial error may be returned:
515209: The operation failed due to an unexpected Database Management System error.
Operation.useCase: Data indexing uses TCXML as the payload for extracting data from Database. In order to support data synchronization, data indexing needs to install Database triggers to track newly added objects and deleted objects as the first step of indexing. This operatoin is a mirror operation to remove the Database triggers that were installed by installDBTriggersForDataSync operation.

ParameterInfo.description:
Specifies the Database trigger type that will be installed. The valid values are:
1: The database trigger for tracking the newly added objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
2: The database trigger for tracking the deleted objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.
3: The database triggers for tracking both the newly added objects and the deleted objects in POM_object table which stores all Teamcenter persistent objects.

Struct.description: A structure representing a string, date or numeric type of Task search filter.
Struct.name: TaskSearchFilter

StructElement.description:
The type of search filter. Valid values are "StringFilter", "DateFilter", "NumericFilter". An example for this input:
StringFilter - User wants to search all the tasks based on any string property on EPMtask like object_type etc.
DateFilter - User wants to search all the tasks based on any date property on EPMTask like due_date etc.
NumericFilter - User wants to search all the tasks based on any numeric property on EPMTask like task_duration etc.
StructElement.name: searchFilterType

StructElement.description: The value for a string filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "StringFilter".
StructElement.name: stringValue

StructElement.description: The starting value for a date filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "DateFilter".
StructElement.name: startDateValue

StructElement.description: The ending value for a date filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "DateFilter".
StructElement.name: endDateValue

StructElement.description: The starting value for a numeric filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "NumericFilter".
StructElement.name: startNumericValue

StructElement.description: The ending value for a numeric filter. This field is applicable only if the "searchFilterType" field is set to "NumericFilter".
StructElement.name: endNumericValue

StructElement.description: The number of values in the filter. This field is populated on the service response and is ignored on the service input.
StructElement.name: count

StructElement.description: A flag that indicates if the filter was previously selected and used to filter the search results. This field is populated on the service response and is ignored on the service input.
StructElement.name: selected

StructElement.description: The 'gap' used to generate the start and end values.
StructElement.name: startEndRange

Struct.description: A structure containing details about a search filter field.
Struct.name: TaskSearchFilterField

StructElement.description: The internal name for the search filter field.
StructElement.name: internalName

StructElement.description: The display name for the search filter field.
StructElement.name: displayName

StructElement.description: The default number of search filter values to display within the search filter field.
StructElement.name: defaultFilterValueDisplayCount

Typedef.description: TaskSearchFilterMap is a map of search filter name (key) and TaskSearchFilter structure(values).
Typedef.name: TaskSearchFilterMap

Struct.description: A structure containing input search criteria.
Struct.name: TaskSearchInput

StructElement.description: This input is used for pagination. User can specify the the start index of the next chunk of tasks to return. An example of this input is : User has 100 tasks in inbox and want to get tasks from 51 onwards. So here the startIndex would be 51.
StructElement.name: startIndex

StructElement.description: This input is used for pagination. This input specifies the maximum number of found tasks to return.
StructElement.name: maxToReturn

StructElement.description: This input is used for pagination. This input specifies the he maximum number of tasks to load.
StructElement.name: maxToLoad

StructElement.description: The map containing the list of search filters for each search filter field.This is a map of (string, list(TaskSearchFilter)).
StructElement.name: searchFilterMap

StructElement.description: The criteria to use to sort the results. Use this input to specify the EPMTask property to be used for sorting the search result. An example for this input is : User wants to sort the output result based on "last_mod_date" property etc.
StructElement.name: searchSortCriteria

StructElement.description: The criteria to decide the sort direction of the results.Valid values are "ASC", "DESC".
StructElement.name: searchSortDirection

StructElement.description: The sorting type to use to order the search filter categories in the response. Valid values are "Alphabetical", "Priority".
StructElement.name: searchFilterFieldSortType

StructElement.description: The criteria to decide the Inbox content type for searching the tasks. Valid values are "AllTasks", "MyTasks" and "TasksToTrack".
StructElement.name: searchInboxContentType

Struct.description: A service response structure containing search results.
Struct.name: TaskSearchResponse

StructElement.description: The list of business objects obtained after performing a search.
StructElement.name: searchResults

StructElement.description: The total number of business objects found.
StructElement.name: totalFound

StructElement.description: The total number of business objects loaded.
StructElement.name: totalLoaded

StructElement.description: The map containing the list of search filters for each search filter field based on the search results. This is a map of (string, list(TaskSearchFilter)).
StructElement.name: searchFilterMap

StructElement.description: A list of search filter categories ordered by filter priority.
StructElement.name: searchFilterCategories

StructElement.description: The default number of search filter categories to display.
StructElement.name: defaultFilterFieldDisplayCount

StructElement.description: Service data containing found objects, errors, etc.
StructElement.name: serviceData

StructElement.description: The information (string, list of strings) about the relation. Valid key is edgeType and the valid value is the type of the relation. This information is used by graphical framework for rendering the Edge. An example is: An edge type defined with name "FailSuccessor" can be configured to render a line with red color with dash style to show the fail path in workflow graph.

Struct.description: Structure represents the element to be shown on the graph.

This information is used by graphical framework for rendering the Element. An example is an element type defined as "EPM_started" can be configured to be render the element with yellow color frame in workflow graph.

StructElement.description: The Red component of color. Legal range is 0-255.

StructElement.description: A list of filters associated with objects.

Struct.name: WorkflowGraphLegendResponse

StructElement.description: The list of WorkflowGraphLegendData structures.The legend data will be created based on the XML configuration file. This XML file is read from the dataset specified in the preference WRKFLW_graph_legend_configuration_file_name.

For instance, a Node representing the EPMTask type is shown as a Tile. This XML is read from the dataset specified in the preference WRKFLW_graph_presentation_rules_file_name.

StructElement.description: A map (string, list of strings) of diagram related information. Valid keys are zoomLevel and layout. The valid value for zoomLevel is any percentage. Valid values for layout are Incremental, Orthographic,Tree,Left To Right, Right To Left.
StructElement.name: workflowGraphInfo

Typedef.description: String Map.
Typedef.name: StringMap

Struct.description: WorkflowTaskViewModelInput stucture that represent the input EPMTask or Signoff and its properties.
Struct.name: WorkflowTaskViewModelInput

StructElement.description: A unique string supplied by the caller. This ID is used to identify return data elements and partial errors associated with this input structure.
StructElement.name: clientId

StructElement.description: The selected EPMTask or Signoff object data for which the information to be sent in a JSON format.
StructElement.name: selection

StructElement.description:
A map (string, list of strings) represents the different properties of the task with type name. This input specify the properties of the task to be outputted to JSON string.
If a client wants to get a property value of an object which can be traversed using a reference property on a given input task then following format need to be used :
REF( reference_property_name, reference_object_type ).property_on_reference_object

For example : If the client wants to get object_string of workflow process (EPMJob), then it has to provide the input data in following format :
"EPMTask", "REF(parent_process,EPMJob).object_string"}

In above example :
reference_property_name is the “parent_process” reference property defined on EPMTask.
reference_object_type is the “EPMJob” referenced by the “parent_process” property on EPMTask.
property_on_reference_object is the “object_string”. property on EPMJob.

Below are the few examples of this input:
To get task properties: "EPMTask", {"state_value", "signoff_quorum"}
To get task reference property :"EPMTask", {"REF(parent_process,EPMJob).object_string"}
To get task signoff data : "Signoff", {"REF(group_member,GroupMember).group", "REF(group_member,GroupMember).user", "fnd0DecisionRequired" }
To get task signoff profile data : "EPMSignoffProfile",{"REF(group,Group).name", "REF(role,Role).role_name", "number_of_signoffs"}
StructElement.name: typeToPropertiesMap

Struct.description: Output structure represents the task data in JSON string and the additional data if any.
Struct.name: WorkflowTaskViewModelOutput

StructElement.description: A unique string supplied by the caller. This ID is used to identify return data elements and partial errors associated with this input structure.
StructElement.name: clientId

StructElement.description: A map (string, list of strings) represents the additional information required by client.For example this operation returns logical flag to specify if the complete button can be enabled for the selected task in the perform dialog.
StructElement.name: additionalData

StructElement.description: A map (string, list of strings) represents the additional information required by client.For example this operation returns logical flag to specify if the complete button can be enabled for the selected task in the perform dialog.
StructElement.name: taskJSONStrings

StructElement.description: Service data.
StructElement.name: serviceData

OperationTemplate.description: Return the task results of a given task template
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Workflow::getTaskResults
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: Task results of a given task template

OperationParameter.description: Task templates

OperationTemplate.returnDescription: A list of supported objects and relation types. If there is no matching data for the input view, an empty list is returned. Any failure will be returned with clientId mapped to error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors. Following possible errors could be returned in the ServiceData. 33035     The Job is in a corrupted state. 33001     An internal error has occurred in the EPM module. Please contact your system administrator.

OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: Operation to get the properties on EPMTask and Signoff objects in JSON format. It can also be used to traverse the reference properties on EPMTask and Signoff and get properties on the referenced objects. The output JSON is designed to be consumed by the active workspace client panels. The information needed to be displayed in the panels can be obtained by properly constructing the input structure.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::AWS2::Workflow::getWorkflowTaskViewModel
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
WorkflowTaskViewModelResponse structure which represents the list of WorkflowTaskViewModelOutput structure and the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141132 (AWP0AWS2_workflow_invalid_input) : The input workflow task is invalid. Please provide input of type EPMTask or Signoff.
    • 141133 (AWP0AWS2_workflow_generate_task_view_model_error) : An error has occurred while generating the workflow task view model. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.

OperationParameter.description: A list of WorkflowTaskViewModelInput stucture that represent the input EPMTask or Signoff and its properties.
OperationParameter.name: input

Operation.description: Operation to get the properties on EPMTask and Signoff objects in JSON format. It can also be used to traverse the reference properties on EPMTask and Signoff and get properties on the referenced objects. The output JSON is designed to be consumed by the active workspace client panels. The information needed to be displayed in the panels can be obtained by properly constructing the input structure.
Operation.name: getWorkflowTaskViewModel
Operation.returnDescription:
WorkflowTaskViewModelResponse structure which represents the list of WorkflowTaskViewModelOutput structure and the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be returned:
    • 141132 (AWP0AWS2_workflow_invalid_input) : The input workflow task is invalid. Please provide input of type EPMTask or Signoff.
    • 141133 (AWP0AWS2_workflow_generate_task_view_model_error) : An error has occurred while generating the workflow task view model. Please refer to the Teamcenter server syslog file for more information.
Operation.useCase:
In Active Workspace, Select-Signoff-Task perform panel needs to show the following data:
    • Required Profiles with the count of unstaffed profiles
    • Profile signoffs
    • Adhoc signoffs
    • Quorum data

This SOA is designed to get all the above data . It can also return a logical flag(s) to indicate if the task can be completed or not based on which complete button can be displayed in the dialog.This will avoid unnecessory complex logic on the client to segregate data( like profiles, profile signoffs and adhoc signoff) to display in the panel and to detemine current quorum based on exisiting signoffs etc.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of WorkflowTaskViewModelInput stucture that represent the input EPMTask or Signoff and its properties.

Operation.description: This operation searches for EPMTasks in a user's inbox based on input search criteria.
Operation.name: performTaskSearch
Operation.returnDescription:
A list of business objects found after performing the task search. Possible errors returned in ServiceData are:
38015 - Unable to find a property.
516004 - An invalid attribute is given to the enquiry.
Operation.useCase:
Use this operation to search for tasks in logged in user's inbox. User can provide multiple search criteria to search for tasks. For example :

Search tasks by specific task type
User wants to search for all the Do tasks in his inbox.

Search tasks by assignee
User wants to search for all the task in his inbox which are assigned to a specific group.

Search tasks by due date
User wants to search for all the tasks in his inbox based on a due date. The due date can be specified as a specific date or month or year.

ParameterInfo.description: The input search criteria for finding the tasks.

TcAttribute.description: This property will have a reference to the Text dataset which will contain the state of Traceability matrix.

This property is to hold the comments information on requirement.

TcRuntimeType.description: Awp0RelationProxyObject is a runtime business object used to represent related objects for a selection in Tracelink panel.

TcProperty.description: awp0Direction is a string property evaluated from the direction of the trace link relation relative to awp0SelectedObject. The string value is set when this object is constructed. Possible values "Complying", "Defining" or "Both"
awp0RelationTypeName is a string property to fetch awp0RelationElement type name.
awp0SelectedObject is a reference to the selected object in the client. The value cannot be empty and is set when this object is selected in the primary work area.
awp0RelatedObject is a reference to the related object. The value cannot be empty and is set when this object is constructed based on the related object on the other side.
awp0RelationObject is a reference to a trace link from/to awp0SelectedObject. The value cannot be empty and is set when this object is constructed when Tracelinks are queried in the Tracelink panel.

TcRuntimeType.description: This provider class to return a list of Awp0RelationProxyObjects for selected element in ACE or selected objects in Home or outiside ACE. Awp0TraceLinkProvider is used in Active Workspace TraceLink Panel to view the tracelinks on selected objects.
Trace Link Proxy Object

TcProperty.description: awp0IsOccurrenceTracelink is a boolean flag to indicate if awp0RelationObject is between two AbsOccData.
awp0RelatedObjectType is a string property to return the awp0RelationObject type name.

TcStandardType.description: Awp0TraceabilityMatrix represents a saved Trace matrix. Awp0TraceabilityMatrix allows user to save the current state of the trace matrix to Teamcenter and retrieve it later. Awp0TraceabilityMatrix is used by the Requirements Management application.

OperationTemplate.description: This operation returns true if the given property value is equal to object property value. If property is not found in given object, then returns detault result.

OperationParameter.name: object

OperationParameter.description: The property name.
OperationParameter.name: propertyName

OperationParameter.description: Expected property value.
OperationParameter.name: propertyValue

OperationParameter.description: Default result in case of following condition. 1.If property is not found on source object, API will return default expected result. 2.If the input object is null.

OperationParameter.description: When property is found on source object this field will return true if property value is equal to given value.
OperationParameter.name: isEqual

OperationTemplate.description:
Determines if a property on the referenced object constains the specific value or not.
For example: To check for the value of is_modifiable property on the Awb0Element underlying object, the operation usage would be as given below, where o indicates Awb0Element and u indicates userSession in condition signature
u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0getPropValueOnRefObj(o,"awb0UnderlyingObject","is_modifiable")="true"

Array properties are not supported.
Irrespective of the property type, value will be returned as a string. For example for int property, it is "1", for boolean property it is "true" or "false" etc.
Input parameters
object - input object
refPropName - Reference property name on the input object. VLA properties are not supported
refPropName2 - Property Name on the referenced object got from refPropName

Output Parameters
refPropValue - Property Value for refPropName2
OperationTemplate.name: awp0::aws2::Fnd0ConditionHelper::awp0getPropValueOnRefObj
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
Return Value
ITK_ok on success and error code on failure

OperationParameter.description: Selected object
OperationParameter.name: object

OperationParameter.description: TypeRef Property Name
OperationParameter.name: refPropName

OperationParameter.description: Property name on the TypeRef object whose value is to be retrieved
OperationParameter.name: refPropName2

OperationParameter.description: Property Value on the type ref object corresponding to refPropName2
OperationParameter.name: refPropValue

Condition.description: This condition determines if the user object represents the currently logged-in user.
Condition.name: Awp0AddProfilePictureCmdCond

Condition.description: Server side visibility condition to determine when the Add Component command can be visible. Works by checking the preference values for the supported open types for each CAD application. There will be additional client side visibility conditions associated as well, such as to determine if Active Workspace is running in the hosted mode, before the command is made visible.
Condition.expression: (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_SEEC_OpenSupportedTypes", o.object_type)=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_SWIM_OpenSupportedTypes", o.object_type)=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_TCAI_OpenSupportedTypes", o.object_type)=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_IPEM_OpenSupportedTypes", o.object_type)=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_TCIC_OpenSupportedTypes", o.object_type)=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_TCAA_OpenSupportedTypes", o.object_type)=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_TCISC_OpenSupportedTypes", o.object_type)=true)
Condition.name: Awp0AddToAssmCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition checks if Awp0AddToFavorites command should be visible
Condition.expression: (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o,"WorkspaceObject") OR u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "Signoff")) AND u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectInFavorites(o) != true AND u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o,"Awp0FullTextSavedSearch") = false
Condition.name: Awp0AddToFavoritesCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition hides the Cut command for the objects of type Alternate ID.
Condition.name: Awp0AlternateIdCutCmdCond

Condition.description: Server side command visibility condition for Assign Projects command. This command should be visible only if selected object is of type WorkspaceObject, Dataset or Form. This command should not be visible if selected object is of type EPMTask or Signoff. This command should not be visible if assignable_projects property is not defined for logged in user.
Condition.expression: (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o,"WorkspaceObject") = true OR u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "Dataset") = true OR u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "Form") = true) AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "EPMTask") = false AND u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "Signoff") = false) AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0isArrayOrRefPropertyValueEmpty(u.user,"assignable_projects",true) = false) AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsPlatformVersionAtLeast("11.2.4","11.2.4") = true)
Condition.name: Awp0AssignProjectsCmdCond

Condition.description: Server side command visibility condition for Assign Projects command. This command should be visible for Teamcenter Version >=10.1.5 and <=11.2.3. This command should be visible only if selected object is of type WorkspaceObject, Dataset or Form. This command should not be visible if selected object is of type EPMTask or Signoff. This command should not be visible if assignable_projects property is not defined for logged in user.
Condition.expression: (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o,"WorkspaceObject") = true OR u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "Dataset") = true OR u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "Form") = true) AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "EPMTask") = false AND u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "Signoff") = false) AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0isArrayOrRefPropertyValueEmpty(u.user,"assignable_projects",true) = false) AND (((u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsPlatformVersionSupported("10.1.5") = true) OR(u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsPlatformVersionSupported("11.2.0") = true)) AND ((u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsPlatformVersionSupported("11.2.4") = false)))
Condition.name: Awp0AssignProjectsLegacyCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if the check-out of instances of a particular business object type can be cancelled at the current site.
Condition.expression: u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0isObjectTypePresentInPref( "TCCheckoutReserveOnly", o ) = false AND ( ( o.is_modifiable = true AND o.checked_out_user = u.user ) OR ( o.checked_out = "Y" AND u.group_name = "dba" ) )
Condition.name: Awp0CancelCheckoutCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if ownership of instances of a particular business object type can be changed.
Condition.name: Awp0ChangeOwnerCmdCond

Condition.description: Determines if the selected user object represents the currently logged-in user.
Condition.name: Awp0ChangePasswordCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if instances of a particular business object type can be checked-in at current site.
Condition.expression: (o.is_modifiable = true AND o.checked_out_user = u.user) OR (o.checked_out = "Y" AND u.group_name = "dba")
Condition.name: Awp0CheckInCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if instances of a particular business object type can be checked-out. This depends upon the following checks: if the type is checkout-able; if the instance is modifiable at the current site.
Condition.expression: o.fnd0IsCheckoutable=true AND o.is_modifiable=true AND o.object_type !="Ssm0SimBaseTemplate" AND o.object_type !="Ssm0SimRealizationTemplate" AND o.object_type !="Ssm0SimModel" AND o.object_type != "Ssm0SimApp" AND o.object_type !="Ssm0SimStudy"
Condition.name: Awp0CheckoutCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition is to check if object is not null and is not a saved search type.
Condition.name: Awp0CopyCmdCond

Condition.description: Create Alternate ID command Visibilty
Condition.name: Awp0CreateAlternateIDCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if the passed, Fnd0Selection object is not null, its parent selection property is not null and fnd0IsCreatedInContext property on fnd0ContextContrast of selected objects are all set to false.
Condition.expression: s.fnd0ParentSelection!=null AND s.fnd0SelectedObjects!=null AND ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0GetPropertyValue(o,"fnd0IsCreatedInContext","false",false) OR u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0isArrayOrRefPropertyValueEmpty(o,"fnd0ContextContrast",true) = true) AND ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o,"Participant")=false )
Condition.name: Awp0CutCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if the requested object type is allowed to be deleted.
Condition.name: Awp0DeleteCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if a selected saved search is not null.
Condition.name: Awp0EditSavedSearchCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition is designed to check if the command is visible if the selected object is an ACE object. The ACE check itself will be done in the Client side.
Condition.expression: (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_SEEC_OpenSupportedTypes","Awb0SavedBookmark")=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_SWIM_OpenSupportedTypes","Awb0SavedBookmark")=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_TCAI_OpenSupportedTypes","Awb0SavedBookmark")=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_IPEM_OpenSupportedTypes","Awb0SavedBookmark")=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_TCIC_OpenSupportedTypes","Awb0SavedBookmark")=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_TCAA_OpenSupportedTypes","Awb0SavedBookmark")=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.fnd0isValuePresentInPref("AWC_TCISC_OpenSupportedTypes","Awb0SavedBookmark")=true)
Condition.name: Awp0MCADACECmdCond

Condition.description: Determines the visibility of the "Open in Creo" command. It checks the preference values for the supported open types for the Creo application. Additional client-side visibility conditions are associated (such as the one to determine if Active Workspace is running in the hosted mode) before the command is made visible.

Condition.description: This condition determines if the instance of business object passed is not of the type "Awp0AWCExternalSystemObject".

Condition.description: Checks if Awp0PinObject command should be visible. The exception being Saved Search object types, where it will not be visible.

TcAttribute.description: The name of the group to which the tile belongs.Null value not allowed.
The Collection from which the tile was inherited.Null value not allowed.

The order in which the tiles are to be displayed within the group. Order number dictates the position of the tile within its group. The lowest order number in a group dictates the position of the group relative to other groups.Null value not allowed.
Is the Tile hidden? Valid values are true and false. This property is set when a user unpins an inherited tile from their gateway.
Size of tile. Valid values are 0, 1, 2, or 3 (small, tall, wide, or large).Null value not allowed.
The tile is protected. An admin can set this to prevent users from unpinning the Tile.
Describes if the tile is live. This property is for future use to designate content that dynamically updates.
Id of the tile. Keep unique by name-spacing with a solution prefix.This property should not be null.
String identifying css resource to use.
Reference to the Tile Template for the tile.This property should not be null.
The localizable display name of the tile.
Parameters to be supplied for tile action. These parameters are specific to the action specified on the template and get appended to the URL when the tile is clicked.
The string representation of the pinned object.
Reference to the scope of the collection. It can be a site/group/role or project.Null values are not allowed.
The tile represented by the proxy.Null is not allowed.
An ID that uniquely identifies a tile template. Should be name-spaced with a solution prefix.Null is not allowed.
The integer that indicates the theme for color of the Tile. Valid values are presented via a list. 0: light, 1 medium, 2: highlight, 3: alternate.

The Tile icon can be specified using this property or the awp0IconSource. This property specifies the base name of the Icon for the tile. Dark or light versions of the icon will be retrieved as needed. Base icon name + _dark or _light refers to the CSS class names. The css class defines the background-image property. Background-image points to a web tier file. Using a static image from web tier results in best performance. Ootb icons are defined in gateway.css and are combined into 1 image using sprites.
The action that needs to be performed by the Tile on click.

Sizes of the Tiles that this template supports. Can be used to limit available sizes for a tile type - if blank, all sizes are allowed. Valid values are presented via a list. 0: small, 1: wide, 2: large.
Names of the contents that display on the Tile. Used on advanced tiles like Inbox.

The Tile icon can be specified using this property or the awp0Icon. This property specifies the persistent TC object containing the icon image file. This is easier to configure for a custom icon than awp0Icon.
The action type of tile. Valid values are presented via a list. 0: default, 1: external link, 2: static resource, 3: command.

TcProperty.description: Id of the tile template.

TcStandardType.description: Awp0GatewayTileRel is the relation type that attaches Tiles to Collections; includes important properties used for layout like Group and Order.Gateway Tile is used in the Active Workspace applicationThis object is not sub-classed or extended.

Awp0Tile is used to store instances of home/gateway tiles. It typically exists one to one with the tile template, but provides useful separation when there are multiple instances of the same tile type (e.g., pinned objects). When a Tiles are related to Tile Collections using Tile Relations. Tile objects are only used on the Home page in the Active Workspace.

TcProperty.description: Content values synchronized with content names of the tile template.
Dynamic messages on the tile.
Reference to the object that is pinned on the tile.
Represents the configured object, as per user session's revision rule, for the revision object pinned with the Tile.

TcStandardType.description: Tile Collections determine the Tiles displayed on the user's Home location. The Tile Collection collects Tile objects for a given scope (group, role, user, or project). Note that the Tile Collection is separate from tile grouping (see the Tile Group property on the Tile Relation).The Tile Collection is used on the Home page in the Active Workspace application.This object is not sub-classed or extended.

TcProperty.description: Array of typed references pointing to the related Tiles.

TcStandardType.description: A proxy object representing a tile in the tile collection. This object is necessary in certain cases where the same Tile is referenced by multiple Tile Collections used by the same user. Tile Proxy is used on the Home page in the Active Workspace application and is not subtyped or extended.
The Tile Template stores a tile definition. One exists for each type of Tile. The Tile Template is used on the Home page of the Active Workspace application and is not subtyped or extended.

TcProperty.description: awp0ProcessTemplates is Runtime which represents a list of all online process templates. awp0ProcessTemplates allows the user to select a process template to submit a newly create object to a workflow. awp0ProcessTemplates adds the ability for the system to automatically populate a dropdown list of online process templates based on a dynamic LOV for display/selection during the create of an object in AW.
List of signoff represent Acknowledgers from Acknowledge task
This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can demote this task.
List of signoff represent notifyees from Notify task
List of signoff represent reviewers from Review task

Property awp0ShowParticipants is a runtime property of string array type. Property awp0ShowParticipants will list all the participant types which should be shown in the Participants page of the EPMTask. If the storage of the participants is the workflow job then it gets its value by combining the values of existing properties fnd0OptionalParticipants and fnd0RequiredParticipants on the root task template. If the storage of the participants is the target then it will return the first target's allowable participant types that are also part of fnd0OptionalParticpants and fnd0RequiredParticipants on the root task template. The value can be null.
This is a runtime boolean property that reflects if the current user can demote this task.

Property awp0ShowParticipants is a runtime property of string array type. Property awp0ShowParticipants will list all the participant types which should be shown in the Participants page of the Signoff. If the storage of the participants is the workflow job then it gets its value by combining the values of existing properties fnd0OptionalParticipants and fnd0RequiredParticipants on the root task template. If the storage of the participants is the target then it will return the first target's allowable participant types that are also part of fnd0OptionalParticpants and fnd0RequiredParticipants on the root task template. The value can be null.

OperationInputProperty.description: awp0ProcessTemplates is Runtime which represents a list of all online process templates. awp0ProcessTemplates allows the user to select a process template to submit a newly create object to a workflow. awp0ProcessTemplates adds the ability for the system to automatically populate a dropdown list of online process templates based on a dynamic LOV for display/selection during the create of an object in AW.
