BusinessObjectInterface.name: EPMTask

BusinessObjectInterface.description: Interface Name for Business Object Signoff
BusinessObjectInterface.name: Signoff

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0AddReviewer command should be visible. This condition determines if the condition Fnd0AddReviewerPrivilege evaluates to true or false.
Condition.expression: (task != NULL AND Condition::Fnd0AddReviewerPrivilege(u, task)) OR (signoff != NULL AND Condition::Fnd0AddReviewerPrivilege(u, signoff.fnd0ParentTask))
Condition.name: Awp0AddReviewerCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0AddSurrogate command should be visible. This condition determines if the selected user object represents the currently logged-in user or evaluate the Fnd0ManageSurrogatePrivilege condition for the logged in user.
Condition.name: Awp0AddSurrogateCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if the user has delete access for selected business object ( Process assignment list).
Condition.name: Awp0DeletePALCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0DemoteTask command should be visible. This condition determines if the input business object is an EPMTask or Signoff and enable the Demote command based on awp0DemoteableByMeBehavior property value.
Condition.name: Awp0DemoteTaskCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0NewWorkflowProcess command should be visible. This condition enable the command if the input business objects are replica objects and checked out or not replica objects and should not be checked out. This will additionaly evalue the fnd0CurrentChangeContext proeprty value to be null to enable the command. In addition, there is additional visibility logic on the client side to detemine the valid supported objects types to enable the command based on provider.
Condition.expression: ( o != null AND (( o.owning_site != null AND o.checked_out_user != null ) OR ( o.owning_site = null AND o.checked_out_user = null )) AND ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0isArrayOrRefPropertyValueEmpty( o, "fnd0CurrentChangeContext", true ) = true ) AND ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0GetTypeConstant( o, "Awp0WorkflowSubmittable" ) = "true" ) )
Condition.name: Awp0NewWorkflowProcessCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0OpenInboxLocation command should be visible. This condition determines if the selected user object represents the currently logged-in user or evaluate the Fnd0AccessInboxPrivilege condition for the logged in user.
Condition.name: Awp0OpenInboxLocationCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0OutOfOffice command should be visible. This condition determines if the selected user object represents the currently logged-in user.
Condition.name: Awp0OutOfOfficeCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition checks if Awp0PerformTask command should be visible. This condition determines if the logged-in user is a valid user to perform selected EPMTask or Signoff object.
Condition.expression: ((u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "EPMTask") OR u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "Signoff") ) AND u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0GetPropertyValue(o, "awp0PerformableByMeBehavior", "true", false)) OR ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "WorkspaceObject" ) AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o, "EPMTask") = false ) AND ( ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsPlatformVersionAtLeast( "11.5","11.5") = false ) OR ( ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsPlatformVersionAtLeast( "11.5","11.5") = true ) AND u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0isArrayOrRefPropertyValueEmpty( o, "fnd0MyWorkflowTasks", true ) = false ) ) )
Condition.name: Awp0PerformTaskCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0PromoteTask command should be visible. This condition determines if the input business object is an EPMTask or Signoff and enable the Promote command based on awp0PromoteableByMeBehavior property value.
Condition.name: Awp0PromoteTaskCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0ReassignTask command should be visible. The condition determines if the root-task of the select object is not completed and it satisfies the Fnd0AssignTaskPrivilege condition.
Condition.expression: ((task != NULL) AND (task.real_state != "Suspended" AND( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0getPropValueOnRefObj(task, "root_task", "real_state") = "Started") ) OR (signoff != NULL) AND ( signoff.decision = 0) AND (signoff.fnd0ParentTask.real_state != "Suspended" AND ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0getPropValueOnRefObj(signoff.fnd0ParentTask, "root_task", "real_state") = "Started"))) AND (Condition::Fnd0AssignTaskPrivilege(u, task, signoff) OR ((task != NULL) AND (task.task_type = "EPMPerformSignoffTask") AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0isArrayOrRefPropertyValueEmpty(task, "user_all_signoffs", false) != true )))
Condition.name: Awp0ReassignTaskCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0Release command should be visible. The condition determines if the logged-in user is an active surrogate of EPMTask or Signoff object.
Condition.expression: (task != NULL AND task.active_surrogate != NULL AND task.active_surrogate = u.user ) OR (signoff != NULL AND signoff.active_surrogate != NULL AND signoff.active_surrogate.user != NULL AND signoff.active_surrogate.user = u.user)
Condition.name: Awp0ReleaseCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0ReplaceMultipleParticipants command should be visible. This condition determines if the input business objects are either ItemRevisions or sub type of ItemRevisions. In addition, there is additional visibility logic on the client side to detemine a minumum of two valid objects are selected.
Condition.name: Awp0ReplaceMultipleParticipantsCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0StandIn command should be visible or not. The condition enables the command if the logged-in user is a valid surrogate and active surrogate value of EPMTask or Signoff object is not set.
Condition.expression: ( task != NULL AND task.active_surrogate = NULL AND u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0getPropValueOnRefObj( task, "fnd0Assignee", "is_valid_surrogate" ) = "true" ) OR ( signoff != NULL AND signoff.active_surrogate = NULL AND u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0getPropValueOnRefObj( signoff, "fnd0Assignee", "is_valid_surrogate" ) = "true" )
Condition.name: Awp0StandInCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if the input business object is an EPMTask or Signoff and enable the Resume command based on current state of the task and based on property isvalidPerformer.
Condition.expression: ((task != NULL) AND (task.real_state = "Suspended") AND (task.fnd0IsValidPerformer) AND (task.fnd0MyTaskExecutionStatus !=1) ) OR ((signoff != NULL) AND (signoff.fnd0ParentTask.real_state = "Suspended") AND ( signoff.fnd0ParentTask.fnd0IsValidPerformer) AND (signoff.fnd0ParentTask.fnd0MyTaskExecutionStatus !=1 ))
Condition.name: Awp0ResumeTaskCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if Awp0RemoveSurrogate command should be visible. This condition determines if the logged-in user has privileges to modify the surrogate users.
Condition.name: Awp0RemoveSurrogateCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines if the input business object is an EPMTask or Signoff and enable the Suspend command based on current state of the task and based on property fnd0IsValidPerformer.
Condition.expression: ((task != NULL) AND (task.real_state != "Suspended") AND (task.real_state != "Aborted") AND (task.fnd0IsValidPerformer) AND (task.fnd0MyTaskExecutionStatus !=1)) OR ( (signoff != NULL) AND (signoff.fnd0ParentTask.real_state != "Suspended") AND (signoff.fnd0ParentTask.real_state != "Aborted") AND ( signoff.fnd0ParentTask.fnd0IsValidPerformer) AND (signoff.fnd0ParentTask.fnd0MyTaskExecutionStatus !=1 ))
Condition.name: Awp0SuspendTaskCmdCond

Condition.description: The condition checks if the "Awp0ClaimTask" command should be visible. This condition determines if the condition "Fnd0AssignTaskPrivilege" evaluates to true or false, and also if the logged-in user is a member of the resource pool for EPMTask or Signoff.
Condition.expression: task != NULL AND ( ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType( task.fnd0Assignee, "ResourcePool" ) ) AND ( ( task.task_type != "EPMPerformSignoffTask" AND ( Condition::Fnd0AssignTaskPrivilege ( u, task, signoff) OR task.fnd0IsValidPerformer ) ) OR ( task.task_type = "EPMPerformSignoffTask" AND task.awp0CheckSignoffClaimable() ) ) ) OR ( signoff != NULL AND u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType( signoff.fnd0Assignee, "ResourcePool" ) AND signoff.fnd0ParentTask.task_type = "EPMPerformSignoffTask" AND signoff.awp0CheckSignoffClaimable() )
Condition.name: Awp0ClaimEPMTaskCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines whether create workflow template command should be visible in Workflow Designer
Condition.name: Awp0CreateWorkflowTemplateCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines whether Workflow Template can be deleted
Condition.expression: (o != null) AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o,"EPMTaskTemplate") = true) AND (Condition::Awp0IsWorkflowTemplateAuthor(u)) AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsPlatformVersionAtLeast( "12.3","12.3" ) = true)
Condition.name: Awp0DeleteWorkflowTemplateCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines the visibility for command to edit Workflow Template
Condition.name: Awp0EditWorkflowTemplateCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determines visibility of the command to export Workflow template
Condition.expression: (o != null AND ((u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0GetPropertyValue(o,"template_stage","2",false)=true) OR (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0GetPropertyValue(o,"template_stage","1",false)=true)) AND (u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0IsObjectType(o,"EPMTaskTemplate") = true) AND (Condition::Awp0IsWorkflowTemplateAuthor(u) = true))
Condition.name: Awp0ExportWorkflowTemplateCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition determins the visibility of command to import Workflow Template
Condition.name: Awp0ImportWorkflowTemplateCmdCond

Condition.description: This condition is used to determine if user has Workflow template authoring privelege. It is used in other conditions such as Awp0CreateWorkflowTemplateCmdCond, Awp0DeleteWorkflowTemplateCmdCond , Awp0ExportWorkflowTemplateCmdCond , Awp0ImportWorkflowTemplateCmdCond , Awp0MakeWorkflowTemplateOnlineCmdCond and Awp0DeleteWorkflowTemplateCmdCond
Condition.name: Awp0IsWorkflowTemplateAuthor

Condition.description: This condition determines the visibility of command to Make the Workflow Template Online after editing.
Condition.name: Awp0MakeWorkflowTemplateOnlineCmdCond

Condition.description: Abort Task Command Condition
Condition.expression: (task != NULL AND ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0getPropValueOnRefObj(task, "root_task", "real_state") != "Aborted") AND ((task.owning_user=u.user) OR (task.fnd0Assignee=u.user) OR (task.active_surrogate=u.user))) OR (signoff != NULL AND ( u.fnd0ConditionHelper.awp0getPropValueOnRefObj(signoff.fnd0ParentTask, "root_task", "real_state") != "Aborted") AND ((signoff.fnd0ParentTask.owning_user=u.user) OR ((signoff.fnd0ParentTask.active_surrogate != NULL) AND (signoff.fnd0ParentTask.active_surrogate=u.user)) OR ((signoff.fnd0ParentTask.fnd0Assignee != NULL) AND (signoff.fnd0ParentTask.fnd0Assignee=u.user))))
Condition.name: Awp0AbortTaskCmdCond

Library.description: Library to manage RevisionRule related functionality.
Library.name: awp0revrulemgmt

Library.description: Service Library to manage Revision Rule Administration Feature.
Library.name: Awp0SoaRevRuleMgmt

ServiceInterface.description:
The RevisionRuleAdministration service exposes operations that are used to view, update, create or delete RevisionRule. Common uses for RevisionRule include configuration of product structure, Collaborative Design, Product Configurator, Search.

Use Cases:
This service provides following RevisionRule related use cases in Active Workspace.

Use Case 1: Creation of Revision Rule
In Active Workspace, RevisionRule can be created from “Revision Rules” sub-location where all existing rules along with their clauses will be listed, given that user have privileges to create a RevisionRule.

Use Case 2: Modification of existing Revision Rule:
In Active Workspace, RevisionRules can be modified inside “Revision Rules” sub-location , given that user have privileges to modify a RevisionRule.Clauses of a RevisionRule can be re-ordered to change the precedence by moving the clause up/down using the corresponding controls.New clause from list of available clauses can be added or a clause can be removed from existing list of clauses.

Use Case 3: Modification of existing Revision Rule inside ACE:
Inside ACE (Active Content Experience), adhoc changes to the RevisionRule clauses can be performed to configure product structure. Addition of new clauses, removal of exisiting clauses or re-ordering of the clauses can be done to create a 'modified' version copy of the original RevisionRule which will be available to the current user only.

Use Case 4: View details:
RevisionRule of interest can be viewed in Active Workspace,( inside “Revision Rules” sub-location as well inside of ACE). Details of the clauses and their ordering can be viewed to make the informed decision on configuring the product structure. (This is a frequently used feature in Teamcenter Structure Manager).

Use Case 5: Deletion of Revision Rule:
RevisionRules can be deleted from “Revision Rules” sub-location in Active Workspace, given that user have privileges to delete a RevisionRule.
ServiceInterface.name: RevisionRuleAdministration

Struct.description: Returns information on created or updated RevisionRule along with service data containing created or updated objects.
Struct.name: CreateOrUpdateRevRuleResp

StructElement.description: Information about created or updated RevisionRule.
StructElement.name: revisionRuleInfo

StructElement.description:
ServiceData with created or updated objects.
The following partial errors may be returned as part of service data:
710001 An internal error has occurred in the Configuration Management module. Please report this error to your system administrator.
710041 Revision Rule does not exist.
710042 Revision Rule with name already exists.
710052 Revision Rule already has a Date Entry - only one allowed per rule.
710053 Revision Rule already has a Unit No Entry - only one allowed per rule.
710055 An Override Entry must contain a valid Override Folder.
710056 Invalid date : must be set either to today or to a valid date.
710057 Invalid unit number : must be zero or positive.
StructElement.name: serviceData

Struct.description: Input structure required to create or update RevisionRule.
Struct.name: CreateUpdateRevRuleInput

StructElement.description: If true, an existing RevisionRule with the same name will be updated else a new RevisionRule will be created.
StructElement.name: updateExisting

StructElement.description: If true, RevisionRule is avaliable only to the user who has logged-in.In this case, a runtime property suppressed on a RevisionRule will be set.A combination of properties suppressed and owning_user will be used to decide if a RevisionRule is avaiable to the user or not.
StructElement.name: isPrivate

StructElement.description: Information on RevisionRule to be created or updated.
StructElement.name: revisionRuleInfo

Typedef.description:
A map (string, string) pairs of entry name and its value. For example,
1: For entry type Working, the map will contain “user”, and “group” as keys and UIDs of User and Group as values respectively.
2: For entry type Status, the map will contain “status_type”as key and UID of attached status i.e TaskType as value.
3: For entry type Override, the map will contain “folder” as key and UID of Folder as value.
Typedef.name: MapOfRevRuleEntryKeyToValue

Struct.description: Structure containing information about RevisionRule's name, description,clauses using which RevisionRule will be created or updated.
Struct.name: RevisionRuleInfo

StructElement.description: Unique Identifier (UID) of a RevisionRule to be created or updated.
StructElement.name: uid

StructElement.description: Name of the RevisionRule.
StructElement.name: name

StructElement.description: Description of a RevisionRule.
StructElement.name: description

StructElement.description: A list containing entries in a RevisionRule.
StructElement.name: entriesInfo

StructElement.description: If true, nested effectivity is added to RevisionRule. If nested effectivity is added, Teamcenter evaluates nested effectivities as per effectivity mappings.
StructElement.name: nestedEffectivity

Struct.description: Structure representing an entry\clause in a Revision Rule.
Struct.name: RevRuleEntryInfo

StructElement.description:
Indicates type of the entry inside RevisionRule.A RevisionRule is made up of a sequential list of entries. Evaluation of the rule involves evaluating each of the entries, in order, until a configured revision of the Item is successfully obtained. A rule is made up of entries of the following types.
0 - Working
1 - Status
2 - Override
3 - Date
4 - Unit No.
5 - Group
6 - Precise
7 - Latest
8 - End Item
9 - GroupByItemType
10 – Branch.
StructElement.name: entryType

StructElement.description: Display text of the entry.
StructElement.name: displayText

StructElement.description: A map (string, string) pairs of entry name and its value. For example: 1: For entry type Working, the map will contain “user”, and “group” as keys and UIDs of User and Group as values respectively. 2: For entry type Status, the map will contain "status_type”as key and UID of attached status i.e TaskType as value. 3: For entry type Override, the map will contain “folder” as key and UID of Folder as value.
StructElement.name: revRuleEntryKeyToValue

StructElement.description: Information about group entry.This structure is populated only in case of entry type is any of the supported group type entries.i.e. CFMGroupEntry, CFMGroupItemTypeEntry and Fnd0CFMGroupOccTypeEntry.
StructElement.name: groupEntryInfo

Struct.description: Structure to hold an information about group entry.
Struct.name: RevRuleGroupEntryInfo

StructElement.description: A list containing display names of types of Item or PSOccurrence on which this rule entry is to be evaluated. This will be populated in cases of entry type is CFMGroupItemTypeEntry or Fnd0CFMGroupOccTypeEntry. Example: For CFMGroupItemTypeEntry, it can contain display names of item types as AllocationMap, CAEBCItem, CAEConnItem, CAEItem.
StructElement.name: groupByTypes

StructElement.description: A list of entries that are grouped together.
StructElement.name: listOfSubEntries

Struct.description: This structure contains all information about input RevisionRule like description, all clauses of RevisionRule, Boolean if RevisionRule supports nested effectivity.
Struct.name: RevRuleInfoResponse

StructElement.description: Description of a RevisionRule.
StructElement.name: description

StructElement.description: A list containing rule entries in a RevisionRule.
StructElement.name: entriesInfo

StructElement.description: If true, nested effectivity is added to RevisionRule. If nested effectivity is added, Teamcenter evaluates nested effectivities as per effectivity mappings.
StructElement.name: nestedEffectivity

Struct.description: Structure represents a sub entry\clause in a group entry.
Struct.name: RevRuleSubEntryInfo

StructElement.description:
Indiactes type of the subentry inside group entry.A group entry is made up of a sequential list of sub entries. Evaluation of the group entry involves evaluating each of the sub-entries in a given order.Valid types of sub-entries are:
0 - Working
1 - Status
2 - Override
3 - Date
4 - Unit No.
6 - Precise
7 - Latest
8 - End Item
10 – Branch.
StructElement.name: subEntryType

StructElement.description: Display text of the sub entry.
StructElement.name: displayText

StructElement.description:
A map (string, string) pairs of entry name and its value. For example,
1: For entry type Working, the map will contain “user”, and “group” as keys and UIDs of User and Group as values respectively.
2: For entry type Status, the map will contain “status_type”as key and UID of attached status i.e TaskType as value.
3: For entry type Override, the map will contain “folder” as key and UID of Folder as value.
StructElement.name: mapOfSubEntryKeyToValue

TcGlobalConstant.description: Global Constant which when turned on stores the dataset fields for object data search.
TcGlobalConstant.name: Awp0StoreDatasetContent

TcGlobalConstant.description: Global Constant to determine whether to index object data properties which are marked as localizable in BMIDE.
TcGlobalConstant.name: Awp0IndexLocalizedValues

TcTypeConstant.description: Used to identify the Dataset to be indexed along with the Business Object. The value should be like <INHERIT/NO_INHERIT>:<RelationName>:<DatasetType>. Supports multiple dataset types for a single relation. Dataset types are to be separated by tilde character '~'. The value can be a comma separated list of the mentioned format.
TcTypeConstant.name: Awp0DatasetTypeToBeIndexedInline

TcTypeConstant.description: This constant defines the behavior of inline indexing of dataset contents. Possible values are Inline and Relation. In case of 'Inline', dataset content are indexed inline of the parent business object. So any time search operation matches the dataset content, associated parent business objects are returned. And in case of 'Relation', dataset content are indexed as part of the dataset itself. However, the indexed dataset maintains a reference to the parent business object. During search, when dataset is returned it also brings in the parent business object.
TcTypeConstant.name: Awp0SearchDatasetIndexingBehavior

TcGlobalConstant.description: The name for the Compound property defined to store the Effectivity Dates
TcGlobalConstant.name: Awp0EffectivityDatesPropertyName

OperationTemplate.description: Imports an Excel file into Teamcenter and creates the product structure and sets the properties on objects based on the values given in Excel file. The input Excel file contains a level column to indicate the level of the object in the structure. ”Level” and “Object Type” columns are mandatory in the input Excel sheet. The input Excel file is parsed to import the data to create product structure in Teamcenter. This operation supports the creation of objects only. Update and Delete are not supported. The column headers in excel are mapped to their respective properties which are saved as a mapping group on “import”. This operation support create and update of mapping groups.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::OccMgmt::ImportExport::importExcelAndUpdateMappingGrp
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The column headers and property information after parsing the input file and a ServiceData element.

The following partial errors may be returned:
223509    The selected input file does not have mandatory columns “Tc_Level” and “Tc_ObjectType”.
223510    The header information in the selected input file does not match with the mapping input data.
223511    The input type provided contains required properties which are not supplied in the input Excel file.
223512    The input type provided contains MFK properties which are not supplied in the input Excel file.
223518    The creation or updation of mapping group failed.

OperationParameter.description: A list of type and property related data and the file ticket of the Excel file to imported.
OperationParameter.name: importExcelData

OperationTemplate.description: Returns all the mapping group information which includes the names of all mapping groups as well as the mapping information of each group. The input Excel file contains a level column to indicate the level of the object in the structure. ”Level” and “Object Type” columns are mandatory in the input Excel sheet. The column headers of the excel file are mapped to their respective properties which are saved into a mapping group. The user can create, update or delete the mapping group. The input Excel file is parsed to import the data to create product structure in Teamcenter.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::OccMgmt::ImportExport::getMappingGroupInfo
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The column headers and property information after parsing the input file.

The following partial errors may be returned.
223509    The selected input file does not have mandatory columns “Tc_Level” and “Tc_ObjectType”.
223510    The header information in the selected input file does not match with the mapping input data.
223511    The input type provided contains required properties which are not supplied in the input Excel file.
223512    The input type provided contains MFK properties which are not supplied in the input Excel file.
223517    The mapping group information requested does not exist.

OperationParameter.description: contains the type and property related data and the file ticket of the Excel file to be imported to Teamcenter.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description: Imports an Excel file into Teamcenter and creates the product structure and sets the properties on objects based on the values given in Excel file. The input Excel file contains a level column to indicate the level of the object in the structure.” Level” and “Object Type” columns are mandatory in the input Excel sheet. The input Excel file is parsed to import the data to create product structure in Teamcenter. This operation supports the creation of objects only. Update and Delete are not supported. The column headers in excel are mapped to their respective properties which are saved as a mapping group on “import”. This operation support create and update of mapping groups.
OperationTemplate.name: Awp0::Soa::OccMgmt::ImportExport::importExcelAndUpdateMappingGrpAsync
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: This is an asynchronous method, there is no return value.

OperationParameter.description: It contains the list of type and property related data and the file ticket of the Excel file to be imported to Teamcenter.
OperationParameter.name: importExcelData

Operation.description: Returns all the mapping group information which includes the names of all mapping groups as well as the mapping information of each group. The input Excel file contains a level column to indicate the level of the object in the structure. ”Level” and “Object Type” columns are mandatory in the input Excel sheet. The column headers of the excel file are mapped to their respective properties which are saved into a mapping group. The user can create, update or delete the mapping group. The input Excel file is parsed to import the data to create product structure in Teamcenter.
Operation.name: getMappingGroupInfo
Operation.returnDescription:
The column headers and property information after parsing the input file.

The following partial errors may be returned.
223509    The selected input file does not have mandatory columns “Tc_Level” and “Tc_ObjectType”.
223510    The header information in the selected input file does not match with the mapping input data.
223511    The input type provided contains required properties which are not supplied in the input Excel file.
223512    The input type provided contains MFK properties which are not supplied in the input Excel file.
223517    The mapping group information requested does not exist.
Operation.useCase:
1) User clicks on the “Browse” button to parse an Excel file with a header row that contains display names of the properties. This header information is parsed and user is presented mapping screens to map the property names with the column headers in the Excel sheet.
2) If the user selects an existing saved mapping group, the mapped properties get populated for the respective column headers.

ParameterInfo.description: contains the type and property related data and the file ticket of the Excel file to be imported to Teamcenter.

Operation.description: Imports an Excel file into Teamcenter and creates the product structure and sets the properties on objects based on the values given in Excel file. The input Excel file contains a level column to indicate the level of the object in the structure. ”Level” and “Object Type” columns are mandatory in the input Excel sheet. The input Excel file is parsed to import the data to create product structure in Teamcenter. This operation supports the creation of objects only. Update and Delete are not supported. The column headers in excel are mapped to their respective properties which are saved as a mapping group on “import”. This operation support create and update of mapping groups.
Operation.name: importExcelAndUpdateMappingGrp
Operation.returnDescription:
The column headers and property information after parsing the input file and a ServiceData element.

The following partial errors may be returned:
223509    The selected input file does not have mandatory columns “Tc_Level” and “Tc_ObjectType”.
223510    The header information in the selected input file does not match with the mapping input data.
223511    The input type provided contains required properties which are not supplied in the input Excel file.
223512    The input type provided contains MFK properties which are not supplied in the input Excel file.
223518    The creation or updation of mapping group failed.
Operation.useCase:
1.    The user creates a new mapping group by mapping the property names with the column headers in the Excel sheet, giving a new group name and clicking on “Import” button.
2.    The user uses an existing mapping group by selecting a group name which populates the existing mappings and clicking on “Import” button.
3.    The user updates an existing mapping group by selecting a group name, changing some of the existing mappings and clicking on “Import” button.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of type and property related data and the file ticket of the Excel file to imported.

TcLOVValue.description: This option enables packing of multiple objects to a single row.
The level of the object will be treated as absolute level of the object and not with respect to topline.
The outlining feature will be disabled.
If the parent has children then they will not be traversed automatically.
The template will be used for Audit purpose.
The template will be used for budget purpose.
This option enables the export process to crawlback and collect the parents of selected object.
This option enables the export process to export all datasets attactments with exported excel file in a zip format.
